original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:üîΩPramanavarttikatika

original: pra m'a na bar ti ka t'i ka / bod skad du /
analyzed: pra m'a na bar ti ka t'i ka / bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
analyzed: tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel bshad /
translated: A commentary on the Pramanavarttika

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Volume 1

original: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo //üîΩsrid gsum 'phen par byed pa yi //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo // srid gsum 'phen par byed pa yi //
translated: Homage to the Omniscient One!üîΩThe Victorious Ones, who have conquered

original: zag pa ma lus las rgyal ba //
analyzed: zag pa ma lus las rgyal ba //
translated: all defilements that propel one into the three existences,üîΩhave perfectly realized existence and renunciation

original: bde gshegs gang dag srid pa dang // nges 'byung legs par rtogs pa dang // de chos yang dag gzigs las byung //
analyzed: bde gshegs gang dag srid pa dang // nges 'byung legs par rtogs pa dang // de chos yang dag gzigs las byung //
translated: and have seen the Dharma.

original: mkhas pas so so rang rig bya //
analyzed: mkhas pas so so rang rig bya //
translated: The wise should understand this individually.

original: legs gsungs rims bral dang dge 'dun //
analyzed: legs gsungs rims bral dang dge 'dun //
translated: The well-spoken, the disease-free, and the Sangha

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag brgyad po rgyal //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag brgyad po rgyal //
translated: are the eight noble persons.

original: blo gros chen po'i bzhed pa gting rnyed ma yin zhing //
analyzed: blo gros chen po'i bzhed pa gting rnyed ma yin zhing //
translated: The intention of the Great Mind is not found in the depths,

original: 'bad byas pas kyang gsal bar rtogs pa med pa 'di //
analyzed: 'bad byas pas kyang gsal bar rtogs pa med pa 'di //
translated: and even with effort, clear understanding is not attained.

original: tshig don tsam gyi rang bzhin rab tu bstan pa yis //
analyzed: tshig don tsam gyi rang bzhin rab tu bstan pa yis //
translated: By thoroughly teaching the nature of mere words and meaning,

original: gna' rabs rnams kyis gsal ba nyid du byas gyur pa //
analyzed: gna' rabs rnams kyis gsal ba nyid du byas gyur pa //
translated: the ancient scholars have made it clear.

original: des na 'dir ni de nyid rtogs phyir 'bad pas ni //
analyzed: des na 'dir ni de nyid rtogs phyir 'bad pas ni //
translated: Therefore, here, for the sake of understanding that, with effort,

original: gsal bar bya ste de bstan pa yang phan phyir yin //
analyzed: gsal bar bya ste de bstan pa yang phan phyir yin //
translated: I will clarify it, and that teaching is also for the sake of benefit.

original: 'gro ba ma rtogs pa ni rtogs par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'gro ba ma rtogs pa ni rtogs par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to bring about the understanding of beings who do not understand,

original: 'di la 'bad pa byas pa ngal ba'i 'bras bu yin //
analyzed: 'di la 'bad pa byas pa ngal ba'i 'bras bu yin //
translated: this is the fruit of the effort I have made.

original: rtog pa'i dra ba rnam bsal cing //
analyzed: rtog pa'i dra ba rnam bsal cing //
translated: Having removed the net of conceptualization,

original: zhes @2a * //
analyzed: zhes @2a * //
translated: and so on.

original: bya ba la sogs pas ni rab tu byed pa la gus pa bskyed pa'i don du lha dang drang srong gi skye bos zhabs kyi padma la phyag byas pa'i bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag byed pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pas ni rab tu byed pa la gus pa bskyed pa'i don du lha dang drang srong gi skye bos zhabs kyi padma la phyag byas pa'i bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag byed pa'o //
translated: Here, in order to generate respect for the treatise, the Blessed One, the TathƒÅgata, is worshipped by beings born as gods and sages who have bowed at his lotus feet.

original: 'jig rten ni cher 'dod pa'i bya ba la 'jug pa na rang 'dod pa'i lha la phyag byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid kyis yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni cher 'dod pa'i bya ba la 'jug pa na rang 'dod pa'i lha la phyag byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid kyis yin no //
translated: This is because in the world, when engaging in activities with great desire, one is preceded by worshipping one's desired deity.

original: de bzhin du slob dpon gyis kyang rab tu byed pa mdzad pa na don chen po nyid kyis dgos pa chen po dang ldan par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du slob dpon gyis kyang rab tu byed pa mdzad pa na don chen po nyid kyis dgos pa chen po dang ldan par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, when the master composes the treatise, he teaches it as having a great purpose due to its great meaning.

original: gal te 'jig rten gyi phyag byed pa'i 'jug pa 'di lta bu ni phun sum tshogs pa nyid kyis ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten gyi phyag byed pa'i 'jug pa 'di lta bu ni phun sum tshogs pa nyid kyis ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If you say that this salutation to the world is not done out of perfection,

original: dgos pa chen po nyid kyis mngon par 'dod pa grub pa nyid kyis yin mod /
analyzed: dgos pa chen po nyid kyis mngon par 'dod pa grub pa nyid kyis yin mod /
translated: then it is done out of a great purpose, which is the accomplishment of the highest goal.

original: des na 'dir ni de nyid bstan par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dir ni de nyid bstan par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, here the highest goal is taught.

original: dgos pa chen po nyid kyang gtan du sdug bsngal dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: dgos pa chen po nyid kyang gtan du sdug bsngal dang bral ba yin te /
translated: The great purpose is the complete freedom from suffering,

original: de ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa rtogs pa'i phyir 'di las 'grub po //
analyzed: de ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa rtogs pa'i phyir 'di las 'grub po //
translated: which is accomplished here through the realization of the selflessness of persons and of phenomena.

original: yang ci ste 'di rang gi ngag gis mi brjod /
analyzed: yang ci ste 'di rang gi ngag gis mi brjod /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy is this not stated in his own words?‚Äù

original: phyag byas pas ni gus par bya ba yin la de yang srid pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir mchod pas don ci yod ce na /
analyzed: phyag byas pas ni gus par bya ba yin la de yang srid pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir mchod pas don ci yod ce na /
translated: The answer is that salutation is done out of respect, and since that is free from existence, what is the point of worship?

original: 'dir ni slob dpon gyi gus pa'i ro ston pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: 'dir ni slob dpon gyi gus pa'i ro ston pa nyid kyis te /
translated: Here, the master shows the taste of respect,

original: don bstan par bya ba yin yang snying gi ro yongs su rgyas pa nyid @2b kyis ston pa yang 'jal ba po'i chos yin no //
analyzed: don bstan par bya ba yin yang snying gi ro yongs su rgyas pa nyid @2b kyis ston pa yang 'jal ba po'i chos yin no //
translated: even though the meaning is to be taught, the taste of the heart is fully expanded, and that is also the Dharma of the one who comprehends.

original: gus pa yang 'dud pa'i 'bras bu can yin la /
analyzed: gus pa yang 'dud pa'i 'bras bu can yin la /
translated: Moreover, reverence is the fruit of bowing down.

original: de yang phyag byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang phyag byed pa yin no //
translated: And that is the homage.

original: gus pa la yang dgos pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gus pa la yang dgos pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the purpose of reverence?

original: 'di bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not to be accomplished,

original: bral ba nye bar ston pas phan 'dogs pa la rang bzhin gyis grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bral ba nye bar ston pas phan 'dogs pa la rang bzhin gyis grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is naturally established in the benefit of showing freedom.

original: rang bzhin gyis grub pa yang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyes pa'i 'bras bu can ni bzlog par bya la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis grub pa yang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyes pa'i 'bras bu can ni bzlog par bya la /
translated: And that which is naturally established is to be turned away from the fruit of faults such as passion,

original: snying rje dang yid byung ba la sogs pa nyes pa med pa ni 'jug par bya ba yin no //üîΩde bzhin du bcom ldan 'das la phan 'dogs pa las byung ba'i sems kyi khyad par bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: snying rje dang yid byung ba la sogs pa nyes pa med pa ni 'jug par bya ba yin no // de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das la phan 'dogs pa las byung ba'i sems kyi khyad par bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: and to be engaged in the faultless such as compassion and disgust.

original: bla na med pa'i 'bras bu 'phen par byed pa'i phyir brtse ba la sogs pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i 'bras bu 'phen par byed pa'i phyir brtse ba la sogs pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: Likewise, the special mental activity that arises from the benefit of the Lord is itself the projection of the unsurpassed fruit, like love, etc.

original: 'di ltar lam mi 'dzin pa dang / lam nor ba dang / lam la the tshom za ba ni 'gro ba po'i 'bras bu thob pa'i bar chad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir khams gsum pa las nges par 'byung bar 'dod pa ni the tshom med par lam la brten pa nyid du bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar lam mi 'dzin pa dang / lam nor ba dang / lam la the tshom za ba ni 'gro ba po'i 'bras bu thob pa'i bar chad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir khams gsum pa las nges par 'byung bar 'dod pa ni the tshom med par lam la brten pa nyid du bya'o //
translated: Thus, not holding the path, mistaking the path, and doubting the path are causes of obstacles to the fruition of the traveler. Therefore, one who wishes to escape the three realms should definitely rely on the path without doubt.

original: le'u gnyis par bshad pa'i tshul gyis lam gzhan yang med de /üîΩdes na lam nyid 'dzin par 'dod pas de nye bar ston par mdzad pa bcom ldan 'das la gzhan yongs su spangs te gus pas bsgrub par bya zhing skye ba gzhan dag tu yang mu stegs pa gzhan gyis bstan pa'i don 'dzin par ma gyur cig ces de
analyzed: le'u gnyis par bshad pa'i tshul gyis lam gzhan yang med de / des na lam nyid 'dzin par 'dod pas de nye bar ston par mdzad pa bcom ldan 'das la gzhan yongs su spangs te gus pas bsgrub par bya zhing skye ba gzhan dag tu yang mu stegs pa gzhan gyis bstan pa'i don 'dzin par ma gyur cig ces de
translated: There is no other path than the one explained in the second chapter.üîΩTherefore, one who wishes to hold the path should practice with devotion, abandoning other teachers, with respect to the BhagavƒÅn, the teacher of that path. And in other lives, one should remember the BhagavƒÅn, delight in him, make offerings to him, follow him, and so on, in order to reverse doubt.

original: rjes su dran pa dang / mngon par dga' ba dang mchod pa dang rjes su 'jug pa la sogs pas the tshom bzlog pa'i phyir goms par yang bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa dang / mngon par dga' ba dang mchod pa dang rjes su 'jug pa la sogs pas the tshom bzlog pa'i phyir goms par yang bya'o //
translated: One should also cultivate the path in order to not hold the meaning taught by other tƒ´rthikas.

original: de'i phyir bya ba gzhan yang dag pas rab tu byed pa'i bya ba khyad du 'phags par bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi yul la bsam pa'i khyad par gyis rab tu bcug pa bcom ldan 'das la phyag bya ba ni gdon mi za bar bya ba yin
analyzed: de'i phyir bya ba gzhan yang dag pas rab tu byed pa'i bya ba khyad du 'phags par bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi yul la bsam pa'i khyad par gyis rab tu bcug pa bcom ldan 'das la phyag bya ba ni gdon mi za bar bya ba yin
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate the superiority of the activity of the perfect one over other activities, the homage to the Lord is definitely to be performed by one who is engaged in the treatise through the excellence of his intention with regard to the object.

original: no zhes drug po yon tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba can phyag bya ba'i yul nye bar bstan pa na bstod pa yang rab tu sbyor ro //
analyzed: no zhes drug po yon tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba can phyag bya ba'i yul nye bar bstan pa na bstod pa yang rab tu sbyor ro //
translated: When the object of homage is presented, preceded by the expression of the qualities of the Lord, praise is also employed.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das la phyag bya ba la mdor bsdus nas rgyu dang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas yon tan rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das la phyag bya ba la mdor bsdus nas rgyu dang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pas yon tan rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: In this regard, homage to the Lord is, in brief, of two kinds, by way of the excellence of cause and effect.

original: rgyu ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The cause is the completion of intention and application.

original: bsam pa ni thugs rje'i bdag nyid yin la de dang rjes su mthun par 'jug pa ni sbyor ba'o //üîΩ'bras @3a * //
analyzed: bsam pa ni thugs rje'i bdag nyid yin la de dang rjes su mthun par 'jug pa ni sbyor ba'o // 'bras @3a * //
translated: Intention is the nature of compassion, and application is the engagement in accordance with that.

original: bu yang rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bu yang rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: The effect is the excellence of benefit for oneself and others.

original: gal te 'bras bu ni rgyu dang mthun par nges pa'i phyir ji skad brjod pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa gang las she na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu ni rgyu dang mthun par nges pa'i phyir ji skad brjod pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa gang las she na /
translated: If the effect is definitely in accordance with the cause, then how could the effect, the perfection of one‚Äôs own goal, arise from the cause, the perfection of others‚Äô goals?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni gzhan gyi don grub pa la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir mi 'dod kyang 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni gzhan gyi don grub pa la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir mi 'dod kyang 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though one does not wish for the perfection of one‚Äôs own goal, it is accomplished because it is infallible that the perfection of others‚Äô goals is accomplished.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩYou do not assert nirvana for yourself

original: gang phyir 'gro ba mya ngan ma 'das par khyod mya ngan 'das par mi bzhed pa //
analyzed: gang phyir 'gro ba mya ngan ma 'das par khyod mya ngan 'das par mi bzhed pa //
translated: until all beings are emancipated from suffering.

original: tshul 'di bde bar gshegs pa'i go 'phang ma thob par ni nus pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: tshul 'di bde bar gshegs pa'i go 'phang ma thob par ni nus pa ma yin pa //
translated: This method is not possible without attaining the state of a sugata.

original: de phyir khyod ni thams cad mkhyen pa yon tan gter gyur thob par nges 'gyur te //
analyzed: de phyir khyod ni thams cad mkhyen pa yon tan gter gyur thob par nges 'gyur te //
translated: Therefore you will definitely attain omniscience, the treasure of good qualities.

original: khyod la stobs bcu'i yon tan rnams kyis bya ba gzhan ni cung zad kyang mi mnga' //
analyzed: khyod la stobs bcu'i yon tan rnams kyis bya ba gzhan ni cung zad kyang mi mnga' //
translated: You have no other activity than the ten powers of good qualities.

original: zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'bras bu brjod na rgyu 'grub pa nyid ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu brjod na rgyu 'grub pa nyid ni /
translated: If the effect is stated, the accomplishment of the cause is:

original: des na phyed snga mas ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa brjod la phyi mas ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: des na phyed snga mas ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa brjod la phyi mas ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the first half describes the perfection of his own aim, and the second half describes the perfection of others' aims.

original: rtog pa ni gang zag dang chos su rtog pa yin la chos su rtog pa yang gzung bar snang ba med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa ni gang zag dang chos su rtog pa yin la chos su rtog pa yang gzung bar snang ba med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin te /
translated: Conceptualization is the conceptualization of persons and phenomena. And the conceptualization of phenomena is not independent of the appearance of objects.

original: des na rtog pa'i dra ba rnam par bsal ba nyid kyis ni gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin tsam gyi sku bdag dang mi 'dra bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rtog pa'i dra ba rnam par bsal ba nyid kyis ni gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin tsam gyi sku bdag dang mi 'dra bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, by the very removal of the net of conceptualization, the body of reality, which is the mere nature devoid of duality, is described as not like the self.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason, it is said:

original: shes rab pha rol phyin gnyis med //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin gnyis med //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is nondual.

original: ye shes de ni de bzhin gshegs //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ye shes de ni de bzhin gshegs // zhes gsungs so //
translated: That intuition is the Tathagata.

original: zab pas ni gzhan gyis shes par byar med pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa'i rten nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: zab pas ni gzhan gyis shes par byar med pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa'i rten nyid du brjod do //
translated: By profound, it is said to be the very basis of the immeasurable qualities of omniscience, etc., which cannot be known by others.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan ni dpag tu med de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan ni dpag tu med de /
translated: The qualities of the Lord are immeasurable.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos //
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos //
translated: If the Dharma of the Tathagata

original: 'di dag bstan du yod gyur na //üîΩmkhar yang mi shong yon tan mtsho //
analyzed: 'di dag bstan du yod gyur na // mkhar yang mi shong yon tan mtsho //
translated: If these were to be taught,üîΩeven the sky would not be large enough to contain them.

original: khyod kyi yon tan mtha' las 'das //
analyzed: khyod kyi yon tan mtha' las 'das //
translated: Your qualities are beyond measure.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly,üîΩThose who have attained the equality of liberation,üîΩthose who are different from them,

original: rnam grol mnyam pa thob rnams dang // gang zag de las gzhan rnams dang // sangs rgyas chos kyi mnyam med khyod //
analyzed: rnam grol mnyam pa thob rnams dang // gang zag de las gzhan rnams dang // sangs rgyas chos kyi mnyam med khyod //
translated: and you, Buddha, with your incomparable qualities,

original: bar na khyad par shin tu che //
analyzed: bar na khyad par shin tu che //
translated: there is a great difference between you.

original: zhes so // rgya che bas ni gzhan dang mtshungs pa med pas bla na med pa nyid brjod do //
analyzed: zhes so // rgya che bas ni gzhan dang mtshungs pa med pas bla na med pa nyid brjod do //
translated: By its greatness, it is said to be unsurpassed, since it is not equal to anything else.üîΩSince there is no other path, it is not surpassed by any other path, whether of sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, or bodhisattvas.üîΩSince there is no other path, it is not surpassed by any other path, whether of sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, or bodhisattvas.

original: lam gzhan med pa'i phyir re zhig nyon mongs pa dang bral ba la ni de la mi 'am lha gang gis kyang @3b bsgrun du de med pa nyid do //üîΩrang bzhin gyis grub pa'i nus pa yang med pas phyi rol pa rnams kyis gnon pa la sogs pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa yang bsod nams kyi mngon par 'du byed pa las skyes par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lam gzhan med pa'i phyir re zhig nyon mongs pa dang bral ba la ni de la mi 'am lha gang gis kyang @3b bsgrun du de med pa nyid do //üîΩrang bzhin gyis grub pa'i nus pa yang med pas phyi rol pa rnams kyis gnon pa la sogs pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa yang bsod nams kyi mngon par 'du byed pa las skyes par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since there is no other path, it is not surpassed by any other path, whether of sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, or bodhisattvas.üîΩSince there is no other path, it is not surpassed by any other path, whether of sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, or bodhisattvas.üîΩSince there is no other path, it is not surpassed by any other path, whether of sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, or bodhisattvas.üîΩSince there is no other path, it is not surpassed by any other path, whether of sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, or bodhisattvas.üîΩSince there is no other path, it is not surpassed by any other path, whether of sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, or bodhisattvas.üîΩSince there is no other path, it is not surpassed by any other path, whether of sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, or bodhisattvas.üîΩSince there is no other path, it is not surpassed by any other path, whether of sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, or bodhisattvas.üîΩSince there is no other path, it is not surpassed by any other path, whether of sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, or bodhisattvas.üîΩSince there is no other path, it is not surpassed by any other path, whether of sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, or bodhisattvas.üîΩSince there is no other path, it is not surpassed by any other path, whether of sravakas, pr

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan ni mi srid de /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan ni mi srid de /
translated: The accumulation of the aggregate of merit is also impossible apart from the TathƒÅgata,

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the perfection of generosity, morality, etc.

original: des na de la bla na med pa'i nus pa dang ldan par de dang der bshad do //
analyzed: des na de la bla na med pa'i nus pa dang ldan par de dang der bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained in this and that scripture that he has unsurpassed power.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i sku'i rang bzhin gang la mnga' ba'i bcom ldan 'das de la phyag 'tshal ba'o//
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i sku'i rang bzhin gang la mnga' ba'i bcom ldan 'das de la phyag 'tshal ba'o//
translated: Homage to that Bhagavat who has a body of that kind.

original: kun tu bzang po zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi don grub pa brjod do //
analyzed: kun tu bzang po zhes bya bas ni gzhan gyi don grub pa brjod do //
translated: By the word ‚ÄúSamantabhadra‚Äù he describes the accomplishment of the aims of others.

original: kun tu legs pa ni de las 'byung ba'i phyir te bcom ldan 'das kyi legs pa ni legs pa ma yin pa dang ma 'dres pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun tu legs pa ni de las 'byung ba'i phyir te bcom ldan 'das kyi legs pa ni legs pa ma yin pa dang ma 'dres pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúAll good‚Äù is derived from that, because the good of the Bhagavat is not mixed with evil.

original: gzhan la gnod pa snying por gyur pa'i phan 'dogs pa mngon par mi sgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa snying por gyur pa'i phan 'dogs pa mngon par mi sgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: He does not accomplish the benefit of others if it is harmful to them.

original: thugs rjes 'jug pa'i phyir dang / de yang thams cad la khyad par mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs rjes 'jug pa'i phyir dang / de yang thams cad la khyad par mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the engagement of compassion, and because that is not differentiated in all.

original: gnod pa byed pa'i snying por gyur pa'i phan 'dogs pa ni 'dod chags las skyes pa nyid de /
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa'i snying por gyur pa'i phan 'dogs pa ni 'dod chags las skyes pa nyid de /
translated: The benefit that is the essence of harm is born from passion.

original: 'ga' zhig lha ma yin bsad pas lha la sogs pa dag par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig lha ma yin bsad pas lha la sogs pa dag par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, some purify the gods, etc. by killing the asuras.

original: gang la de lta bu'i rang bzhin mnga' ba de brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gang la de lta bu'i rang bzhin mnga' ba de brjod pa ni /
translated: The one who has such a nature is described as

original: 'od zer dag kun nas 'phro zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'od zer dag kun nas 'phro zhes bya ste /
translated: radiating light rays.

original: 'dis ni don thams cad khyab pa'i gsal ba nyid brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni don thams cad khyab pa'i gsal ba nyid brjod do //
translated: This describes the illumination that pervades all objects.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with omniscience.

original: rtsom pa'i khyad par gyis gtso bo'i dgos pa rtogs kyang gzhan gyi dbang du byas nas nye bar bstan pa ma yin par brtags te goms pa tsam gyis rab tu bcug pa nyid rtsom pa'i 'bras bu yin par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rtsom pa'i khyad par gyis gtso bo'i dgos pa rtogs kyang gzhan gyi dbang du byas nas nye bar bstan pa ma yin par brtags te goms pa tsam gyis rab tu bcug pa nyid rtsom pa'i 'bras bu yin par bshad pa ni /
translated: Although the primary purpose is understood through the difference in composition, it is not taught from the perspective of another. The result of composition is explained as just the engagement through mere investigation and familiarity.

original: skye bo phal po cher zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: skye bo phal po cher zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase to the multitude of people and so on.

original: bdag la rtsom par 'dod pa'i gzhung 'di ni gzhan la phan pa yin zhes bsam pa med pa yin yang /
analyzed: bdag la rtsom par 'dod pa'i gzhung 'di ni gzhan la phan pa yin zhes bsam pa med pa yin yang /
translated: Even though he has no intention of thinking, This treatise that I am about to compose is for the benefit of others,

original: sems ni yun ring por skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i legs bshad gang yin pa de goms pas lhur len skyed phyir skabs su bab pa'i gzhung sbyar ba 'di la dga' ba skyes so //
analyzed: sems ni yun ring por skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i legs bshad gang yin pa de goms pas lhur len skyed phyir skabs su bab pa'i gzhung sbyar ba 'di la dga' ba skyes so //
translated: he is delighted by this treatise that he has composed, because he has long cultivated the habit of mind that is the principal limb of the welfare of beings, and because he has generated a sincere interest in the good explanations that are the principal limb of the welfare of beings.

original: ci'i phyir gzhan la phan pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan la phan pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not for the benefit of others?

original: rgyu @4a * //
analyzed: rgyu @4a * //
translated: He explains the reason:

original: bshad pa / skye bo mang du ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad nye bar ston pa'i rang bzhin gyi gzhung la chags so //
analyzed: bshad pa / skye bo mang du ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad nye bar ston pa'i rang bzhin gyi gzhung la chags so //
translated: Many people are attached to treatises that have the nature of teaching mundane conventions.

original: de ltar gyur kyang 'jig rten pa la snying po med par mthong bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur kyang 'jig rten pa la snying po med par mthong bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Even though that is the case, one might say, Because they see that the mundane is without essence, they will enter the supramundane path.

original: shes rab rtsal med pas na zhes smos te /
analyzed: shes rab rtsal med pas na zhes smos te /
translated: He says, Because they lack the power of wisdom.

original: blun po nyid kyi snying po dang snying po ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa'i mthu med pas don 'dzin par mi nus so //
analyzed: blun po nyid kyi snying po dang snying po ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa'i mthu med pas don 'dzin par mi nus so //
translated: The fool, being devoid of the power to discriminate between the essence and the non-essence of things, is incapable of grasping the meaning.

original: gal te yang 'ga' zhig la rtsal med pa de lta na yang don du mi gnyer bas sdang bar gyur to //
analyzed: gal te yang 'ga' zhig la rtsal med pa de lta na yang don du mi gnyer bas sdang bar gyur to //
translated: And even if he is devoid of skill, he is not interested in the meaning, and so he becomes hostile.

original: rang gi rigs kyi rgyun khas blangs pa 'ga' zhig la bdag gi ba nyid kyi dngos por zhen pa ni byams pas phan 'dogs pa tsam gyis rab tu sbyar ba'i bstan bcos gzhan la gzhan gyi yin pa'i blos yon tan mthong yang phrag dog gi dri ma skyesüîΩpa ni sdang ba skyed par byed do //
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi rgyun khas blangs pa 'ga' zhig la bdag gi ba nyid kyi dngos por zhen pa ni byams pas phan 'dogs pa tsam gyis rab tu sbyar ba'i bstan bcos gzhan la gzhan gyi yin pa'i blos yon tan mthong yang phrag dog gi dri ma skyes pa ni sdang ba skyed par byed do //
translated: He is attached to the idea of ownership in regard to some object which he has accepted as his own property, and he is not inclined to the idea of its being the property of another, even though he sees its good qualities, because of the teaching of the treatises which are based on the mere benefit of love.

original: de'i phyir rgyu 'dis ni 'di gzhan la phan pa nyid ma yin te de'i phyir gtso bor gyur pa'i dgos pa yan lag yin yang 'di goms pas 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu 'dis ni 'di gzhan la phan pa nyid ma yin te de'i phyir gtso bor gyur pa'i dgos pa yan lag yin yang 'di goms pas 'jug pa yin no //
translated: And so, because of this cause, he does not benefit others, and so, even though the principal purpose is the limb, he is engaged in it through practice.

original: 'dir yang tshad mar gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gi 'grel par dmigs pa'i phyir tshad ma kun las btus pa'i 'grel pa yin yang de'i rim pa dor te phyogs chos zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang por rjes su dpag pa brjod pa gang
analyzed: 'dir yang tshad mar gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gi 'grel par dmigs pa'i phyir tshad ma kun las btus pa'i 'grel pa yin yang de'i rim pa dor te phyogs chos zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang por rjes su dpag pa brjod pa gang
translated: Here, too, the commentary on the passage beginning ‚ÄúA valid cognition is . . .‚Äù is a commentary on the Compendium of Valid Cognition, but it omits the order of that text and first presents inference, beginning with the line ‚ÄúThe property of the subject.‚Äù

original: yin pa de mi rigs par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir 'grel pas dgos pa bshad pa ni don dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: yin pa de mi rigs par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir 'grel pas dgos pa bshad pa ni don dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: To show that this is not incorrect, the commentary explains the purpose of the text, beginning with the line ‚ÄúThe purpose is . . .‚Äù

original: don ni don dam par yod pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: don ni don dam par yod pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMeaning‚Äù is the nature of ultimate existence.

original: don ma yin pa ni de las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: don ma yin pa ni de las bzlog pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNon-meaning‚Äù is the opposite of that,

original: gzugs la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yod pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yod pa'am /
translated: such as form and so on, which exist conventionally,

original: gtso bo dang dbang phyug dang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gtso bo dang dbang phyug dang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: or the nonexistence of such things as a primal substance, ƒ™≈õvara, or the horns of a rabbit.

original: de dag rnam par 'byed pa ni de'i yul can gyi dpyod pa ste ji ltar snang ba'am ji ltar khas blangs pa rtogs pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i chos don dam par yod pa'am yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de'i rjes su 'jug pa'o
analyzed: de dag rnam par 'byed pa ni de'i yul can gyi dpyod pa ste ji ltar snang ba'am ji ltar khas blangs pa rtogs pa'i chos kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i chos don dam par yod pa'am yod pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de'i rjes su 'jug pa'o
translated: The analysis of those is the analysis of the subject, which is the engagement in the ultimate existence or nonexistence of the object of the appearance or the object of the assertion, which is the nature of the object of knowledge.

original: // gang zhig gang gi bdag nyid can du gyur pa'i chos de rnam par dpyad pa na de rtog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: // gang zhig gang gi bdag nyid can du gyur pa'i chos de rnam par dpyad pa na de rtog par 'gyur te /
translated: When the object that is the nature of that is analyzed, it is imagined.

original: dper na sha pa nyid rnam par dpyad pas shing bzhin zhes 'brel pa bstan par ston par 'gyur ro //üîΩde ni rjes su dpag @4b pa la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na sha pa nyid rnam par dpyad pas shing bzhin zhes 'brel pa bstan par ston par 'gyur ro // de ni rjes su dpag @4b pa la brten pa yin no //
translated: For example, it is taught that the relation is shown by the statement ‚Äúlike a tree by the analysis of the nature of a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ.‚ÄùüîΩThat is based on inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa la de gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la de gnas pa ste /
translated: It is based on inference.

original: de rtsa bar gyur pas rjes su dpag pa rang gi ngo bo thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtsa bar gyur pas rjes su dpag pa rang gi ngo bo thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since that is the root, inference obtains its own nature.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni 'brel pa mngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir na rjes su dpag pa ni de lta bu'i spyod pa'i rtsa ba can yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni 'brel pa mngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir na rjes su dpag pa ni de lta bu'i spyod pa'i rtsa ba can yin no //
translated: Because inference is that which proceeds by way of a relation, inference is rooted in such activity.

original: chos gzhan gyi bdag nyid du rtogs pas rnam par brtags pa na chos gzhan rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: chos gzhan gyi bdag nyid du rtogs pas rnam par brtags pa na chos gzhan rtogs par byed de /
translated: When one understands the nature of another phenomenon through conceptualization, one understands another phenomenon.

original: des na 'brel pa nyid rnam par dpyad pa na de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir de'i rtsa ba 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'brel pa nyid rnam par dpyad pa na de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir de'i rtsa ba 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when one analyzes the relation itself, one understands it in that way. Thus, the root of that is the relation.

original: des na de ni rjes su dpag pa bstan pa nyid kyis bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de ni rjes su dpag pa bstan pa nyid kyis bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is demonstrated that it is inference itself that is taught.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.

original: slob dpon gyi bzhed pa 'chad par gzhal bya grub pa'i 'bras bu can nyid kyi tshad ma rnam par 'jog pa na gdon mi za bar thabs 'ga' la bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi bzhed pa 'chad par gzhal bya grub pa'i 'bras bu can nyid kyi tshad ma rnam par 'jog pa na gdon mi za bar thabs 'ga' la bsten par bya'o //
translated: When the master posits a valid cognition that has the effect of establishing the object of comprehension, he must rely on some method.

original: de la gzhal bya grub pa'i thabs ni tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gzhal bya grub pa'i thabs ni tshad ma yin no //
translated: In that regard, the method for establishing the object of comprehension is valid cognition.

original: dngos po rang nyid ni rig pa med pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis mi 'grub pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: dngos po rang nyid ni rig pa med pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis mi 'grub pa'i phyir ;
translated: The thing itself is not established because it is by nature not knowledge.

original: de gsal na rang gi ngo bo 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir rtogs pas dngos po rnam par gzhag pa yin no //üîΩde lta na yang rtogs pa khyad par med par sgra las byung ba la sogs pa'i tshad ma las kyang /
analyzed: de gsal na rang gi ngo bo 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir rtogs pas dngos po rnam par gzhag pa yin no // de lta na yang rtogs pa khyad par med par sgra las byung ba la sogs pa'i tshad ma las kyang /
translated: If it is clear, then its own nature is established. Therefore, things are established by cognition.üîΩEven so, because of the object of comprehension, such as substance and action,

original: rdzas dang bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdzas dang bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir /
translated: by the means of valid knowledge that arise from sound, etc., without a difference in cognition,üîΩthey are established by the conceptualizing that is worldly,

original: 'jig rten par gyur pa'i rtog par byed pa dag gis gzhag par bya bas yongs su rtog pa'i ngal ba don med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten par gyur pa'i rtog par byed pa dag gis gzhag par bya bas yongs su rtog pa'i ngal ba don med do //
translated: so the effort of conceptualizing is pointless.

original: 'di ltar rtogs pa rtogs pa nyid du grub pa rtogs pa ma yin no zhes rtogs pa gzhan gyi rnam par gzhag pa ma yin pa gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtogs pa rtogs pa nyid du grub pa rtogs pa ma yin no zhes rtogs pa gzhan gyi rnam par gzhag pa ma yin pa gang yin pa'am /
translated: In this way, cognition is not established by another cognition, saying, ‚ÄúCognition is not established as cognition.‚Äù

original: yang na the tshom gyi rang bzhin nyid kyis gang yang rung ba'i char gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang nyid rnam par mi gnas par ma skyes pa sngon po la sogs pa'i rtogs pa de nyid kyis 'jig rten pa'i don rnam par 'jog par byed kyi /
analyzed: yang na the tshom gyi rang bzhin nyid kyis gang yang rung ba'i char gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang nyid rnam par mi gnas par ma skyes pa sngon po la sogs pa'i rtogs pa de nyid kyis 'jig rten pa'i don rnam par 'jog par byed kyi /
translated: Or else, because of the very nature of doubt, which does not abide in any one thing, the non-abiding itself, which is non-arisen, is the cognition of blue, etc. That very thing establishes the meaning of the world.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the cognition of dreams, etc.

original: dbang po'i shes pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa las kyang yin zhing sgra dang nye bar 'jal ba la sogs pa dag las kyang yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa las kyang yin zhing sgra dang nye bar 'jal ba la sogs pa dag las kyang yin no //
translated: It is also from conceptual cognition, as from a sense cognition, and also from the perception of sound, etc.

original: 'on te 'jig rten pa'i tshad mas grub pa 'jig rten pa'i don rnam par 'jog pa gang yin pa 'di ni rgyan nyid yin no zhe na bden te 'on kyang bstan bcos ni rtsis pas bris pa'i 'gro yig dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te 'jig rten pa'i tshad mas grub pa 'jig rten pa'i don rnam par 'jog pa gang yin pa 'di ni rgyan nyid yin no zhe na bden te 'on kyang bstan bcos ni rtsis pas bris pa'i 'gro yig dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is the very ornament of the world that the meaning of the world is established by the valid cognition of the world, it is true, but the treatise would be like a travel brochure written by an accountant.

original: 'on te @5a * //
analyzed: 'on te @5a * //
translated: But if

original: 'jig rten pas grub pa nyid phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'i mi mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pas grub pa nyid phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'i mi mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos 'jug go zhe na /
translated: If you say that the treatise is undertaken in order to refute the misconception of the unwise who are governed by what is established in the world,

original: de yang 'jig rten pa'i dngos po bstan pa'i 'bras bu can nyid kyis sngar brjod pa'i rnam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten pa'i dngos po bstan pa'i 'bras bu can nyid kyis sngar brjod pa'i rnam pa nyid do //
translated: then the treatise would have the result of teaching worldly things, and so would have the very form that was previously mentioned.

original: don du gnyer ba yod na ni de 'jig rten nyid las rtog par 'gyur bas bstan bcos don med pa nyid la /
analyzed: don du gnyer ba yod na ni de 'jig rten nyid las rtog par 'gyur bas bstan bcos don med pa nyid la /
translated: If there were a purpose, then one would understand that from the world itself, and so the treatise would be pointless.

original: de lta ma yin na bstan bcos las kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na bstan bcos las kyang de bzhin no //
translated: If not, then it would be the same as the treatise.

original: phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni mthong ba la yang rmongs par thal lo zhe na /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni mthong ba la yang rmongs par thal lo zhe na /
translated: If it were a misconception, then it would follow, absurdly, that one would be confused even when seeing.

original: 'jig rten pa'i tshad mas rnyed pa'i mthong ba la rmongs pa ldog pa ni 'jig rten nyid las don du gnyer ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tshad mas rnyed pa'i mthong ba la rmongs pa ldog pa ni 'jig rten nyid las don du gnyer ba rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The confusion with regard to seeing that is found by worldly valid cognition is refuted by the world itself, and so one would understand the purpose.

original: gal te de la phyin ci log tu 'gyur bar rigs pas 'jig rten pa'i lam rtogs pa'i don du bstan bcos 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de la phyin ci log tu 'gyur bar rigs pas 'jig rten pa'i lam rtogs pa'i don du bstan bcos 'jug go zhe na /
translated: If you say that the treatise is undertaken in order to understand the worldly path, then it would be correct for it to be a misconception.

original: gal te rigs pa de yang 'jig rten pa'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni bstan bcos don med la /
analyzed: gal te rigs pa de yang 'jig rten pa'i rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni bstan bcos don med la /
translated: If that reasoning is of the nature of mundane thought, then the treatise is pointless.

original: gzhan du gyur pa yin na yang gang las rtogs /
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa yin na yang gang las rtogs /
translated: But if it is otherwise, then how can it be conceived?

original: de'i bu nyid la sogs pa dag la rjes su dpag par 'khrul pa bzlog pa'i 'bras bu yin na /
analyzed: de'i bu nyid la sogs pa dag la rjes su dpag par 'khrul pa bzlog pa'i 'bras bu yin na /
translated: If the result of the refutation of error is inference in regard to the son-ship, etc.,

original: gal te de dag gi de 'jig rten pa yin na bzlog par mi nus so //
analyzed: gal te de dag gi de 'jig rten pa yin na bzlog par mi nus so //
translated: if that is mundane, then it cannot be refuted.

original: gzhan du yin na 'jig rten nyid las ldog go //
analyzed: gzhan du yin na 'jig rten nyid las ldog go //
translated: If it is otherwise, then it is refuted by the world itself.

original: de'i phyir dngos po ma yin pa mthong ba dang / mthong ba la mi mkhas pa'i 'jig rten nye bar dmigs pa na mkhas pa rtogs pa dang rtogs par bya ba brtag pa'i phyir bstan bcos sbyor la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po ma yin pa mthong ba dang / mthong ba la mi mkhas pa'i 'jig rten nye bar dmigs pa na mkhas pa rtogs pa dang rtogs par bya ba brtag pa'i phyir bstan bcos sbyor la /
translated: Therefore, when the non-entity is seen and the world is seen to be unskilled, the treatise is composed in order to investigate the understanding and the object of understanding of the skilled.

original: de la yang thabs dngos po'i 'jug pa rjes su rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang thabs dngos po'i 'jug pa rjes su rtogs pa yin no //
translated: And in that, the method is the understanding of the engagement of entities.

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa bshad pas bshad par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa bshad pas bshad par byas pa yin te /
translated: That is explained by the explanation of inference,

original: rang rgyud du tshad ma gzhan yin par dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rgyud du tshad ma gzhan yin par dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the doubt that it is another valid cognition in the autonomous is refuted.

original: de'i phyir so sor nges pa'i tshad ma rnam par bzhag nas nges pa'i gzhal bya rtogs pa'i phyir dang po thabs bstan pa'i don du rjes su dpag pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor nges pa'i tshad ma rnam par bzhag nas nges pa'i gzhal bya rtogs pa'i phyir dang po thabs bstan pa'i don du rjes su dpag pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, having established the valid cognitions that are individually ascertained, in order to understand the ascertained objects of comprehension and in order to teach the method at the beginning, inference is explained.

original: de lta ma yin na rnam par rtog pa'i yul yang gzhal bya dang / sgra la sogs pa tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rnam par rtog pa'i yul yang gzhal bya dang / sgra la sogs pa tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then the object of conceptual thought would be the object of comprehension, and sound and so on would be valid cognitions.

original: 'on te mang du rjes su dpag pa dang / de'i rten rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mang du rjes su dpag pa dang / de'i rten rtogs so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that one understands inference and its basis by means of many inferences,

original: de yang ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni de la log par rtogs pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni de la log par rtogs pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then that is also not so. This is explained by ‚Äúbecause of wrong understanding of that.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i bstan @5b bcos la dngos po gnas pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i tshad ma med pas na de dag ni rjes su dpag pa la log par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i bstan @5b bcos la dngos po gnas pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i tshad ma med pas na de dag ni rjes su dpag pa la log par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Since there is no valid cognition that accords with the way things are in the treatises that follow the worldly and mundane paths, they are wrong with respect to inference.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, in order to establish inference, it is said:

original: phyogs chos zhes bya ba bsgrub bya'i chos can gyi chos dang / de chas khyab pa bsgrub bya'i chos kyis khyab pa ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: phyogs chos zhes bya ba bsgrub bya'i chos can gyi chos dang / de chas khyab pa bsgrub bya'i chos kyis khyab pa ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: The property of the subject is called the ‚Äúproperty of the position.‚Äù The pervasion by that part is the pervasion by the property of the probandum.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med na med pa'i phyir dang / de yod na ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos med na med pa'i phyir dang / de yod na ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the reason because the property of the probandum does not exist when it is absent and because when it exists, the property of the probandum exists.

original: ci 'di dngos po'i rang bzhin rjes su brjod pa tsam du zad dam /
analyzed: ci 'di dngos po'i rang bzhin rjes su brjod pa tsam du zad dam /
translated: Is this merely a statement of the nature of the thing?

original: 'on te de lta bu'i rang bzhin du grub pa nye bar bkod pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te de lta bu'i rang bzhin du grub pa nye bar bkod pa yin /
translated: Or is it a statement of the establishment of the nature of the thing?

original: de la dngos po la de de lta bur gyur pa'i phyir ni de rtogs pa'i 'bras bu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dngos po la de de lta bur gyur pa'i phyir ni de rtogs pa'i 'bras bu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the first case, it is not the effect of the understanding of that because the thing is just as it is.

original: de'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: In the second case, the statement of the understanding of its nature is to be stated.

original: des na de'i chas khyab par rtogs pa sgrub byed yin par brjod pa'i phyir gang du gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin 'di grub pa der rang bzhin 'di nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: des na de'i chas khyab par rtogs pa sgrub byed yin par brjod pa'i phyir gang du gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin 'di grub pa der rang bzhin 'di nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, because the statement of the pervasion by that part is the proof, in whatever is established as the nature of the reason, that nature is included.

original: ji skad brjod pa'i rang bzhin can gyi gtan tshigs de ni rnam gsum nyid de rnam pa gsum kho na'o //
analyzed: ji skad brjod pa'i rang bzhin can gyi gtan tshigs de ni rnam gsum nyid de rnam pa gsum kho na'o //
translated: The reason that has the nature as described is threefold, and only threefold.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: med na mi 'byung nges phyir ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung nges phyir ro //
translated: Because of the certainty of the invariable relation.

original: de'i chas khyab pa'i mtshan nyid med na mi 'byung ba nges pa ni rnam pa gsum nyid la yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i chas khyab pa'i mtshan nyid med na mi 'byung ba nges pa ni rnam pa gsum nyid la yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: The certainty of the invariable relation, which is characterized by pervasion by a portion of it, exists only in the threefold reason.

original: de nyid rang gi bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rang gi bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is related to its own probandum.

original: 'brel pa'i rang bzhin can gyi gtan tshigs ni rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i rang bzhin can gyi gtan tshigs ni rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: The reason that has the nature of a relation is threefold.

original: des na 'di skad du brjod pa yin te med na mi 'byung ba ni 'brel pa'i bdag nyid nges pa yin la /üîΩde nges pa'i phyir yang rnam pa gsum nyid gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di skad du brjod pa yin te med na mi 'byung ba ni 'brel pa'i bdag nyid nges pa yin la / de nges pa'i phyir yang rnam pa gsum nyid gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is what is being said: the invariable relation is the certainty of the nature of a relation.üîΩAnd because of the certainty of that, the threefold reason is ascertained.

original: med na mi 'byung ba nges pa ni rnam pa gsum la 'dod pa yin la de las ni de gtan tshigs nyid du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba nges pa ni rnam pa gsum la 'dod pa yin la de las ni de gtan tshigs nyid du nges pa yin no //
translated: The certainty of the invariable relation is accepted in the threefold reason, and from that, it is ascertained as the reason itself.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum la med na mi 'byung ba nges par sgrub pa na /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum la med na mi 'byung ba nges par sgrub pa na /
translated: Thus, when establishing the invariable relation of the three modes,

original: 'dir de'i chas khyab pa khas len pa dngos po rjes su brjod pa tsam ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir de'i chas khyab pa khas len pa dngos po rjes su brjod pa tsam ni ma yin gyi /
translated: it is not merely a matter of repeating the expression of the thing to be proven,

original: 'on kyang 'di ni de lta bu'i dngos por bsgrub bar nus pa yin pas gang gis grub pa de nyid der de'i sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni de lta bu'i dngos por bsgrub bar nus pa yin pas gang gis grub pa de nyid der de'i sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: but rather, since it is possible to prove that thing in that way, whatever establishes it is the proof of that.üîΩIf that is so, then the fourth and so on, which are not able to prove, would exist as things that pervade by part.

original: de lta na 'o na sgrub par mi nus pa bzhi pa la sogs pa dngos po la de'i chas khyab pa yod par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni gtan tshigs ltar snang ba rnam pa gsum las gzhan bzhi pa la sogs pa yin
analyzed: de lta na 'o na sgrub par mi nus pa bzhi pa la sogs pa dngos po la de'i chas khyab pa yod par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni gtan tshigs ltar snang ba rnam pa gsum las gzhan bzhi pa la sogs pa yin
translated: The explanation that they do not is that the fourth and so on are different from the three types of seemingly correct reasons.

original: no// @6a * //  'di'i de sred pa'i rgyu mtshan du brjod pa gang yin pa de ni gsum nyid la yod kyi gzhan dag la yang ma yin pas gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: no// @6a * //  'di'i de sred pa'i rgyu mtshan du brjod pa gang yin pa de ni gsum nyid la yod kyi gzhan dag la yang ma yin pas gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'o //
translated: The reason that is stated as the basis for the desire for that exists only in the three, but not in others, so it is a seemingly correct reason.

original: 'di nyid 'dir mtshan nyid du rigs te /
analyzed: 'di nyid 'dir mtshan nyid du rigs te /
translated: This alone is reasonable as the definition here.

original: rtags ni bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags ni bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sign is the effect of the understanding of the probandum.

original: gang gi che grub par byed pa yod na bsgrub par bya ba yod pa de'i tshe der de las bsgrub bya rtogs pa rigs pas na bsgrub bya rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi che grub par byed pa yod na bsgrub par bya ba yod pa de'i tshe der de las bsgrub bya rtogs pa rigs pas na bsgrub bya rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the existence of the probandum is dependent on the existence of the proof, then the understanding of the probandum is possible, because it is logical that the probandum is understood from that.

original: de las der rtogs pa ni phyogs kyi chos nyid las so //
analyzed: de las der rtogs pa ni phyogs kyi chos nyid las so //
translated: The understanding of that from that is from the property of the subject.

original: sgrub par byed pa yod na bsgrub bya rtogs pa de yod pa ni rjes su 'gro ba yin no /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa yod na bsgrub bya rtogs pa de yod pa ni rjes su 'gro ba yin no /
translated: The existence of the understanding of the probandum when the proof exists is the positive concomitance.

original: gal te de ma nges pa ni rtogs bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de ma nges pa ni rtogs bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is not ascertained, then the probandum is not understood.

original: ma nges pa yang sgrub byed yod kyang res 'ga' bsgrub bya med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa yang sgrub byed yod kyang res 'ga' bsgrub bya med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the nonascertainment is because even when the proof exists, the probandum sometimes does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe ldog pas bsgrub bya med na sgrub byed med pa la grub pa de'i tshe na sgrub byed yod na bsgrub bya rtogs pa la rtsod pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ldog pas bsgrub bya med na sgrub byed med pa la grub pa de'i tshe na sgrub byed yod na bsgrub bya rtogs pa la rtsod pa med do //
translated: When the absence of the probandum is established by the contrapositive in the absence of the proof, then there is no dispute that the probandum is understood when the proof exists.

original: de'i phyir bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i yan lag ni tshul gsum po kho na'o ;
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i yan lag ni tshul gsum po kho na'o ;
translated: Therefore the only three modes are the members of the understanding of the probandum.

original: / gal te med na med pa rang bzhin ma yin te rtags dngos por gyur pa la dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: / gal te med na med pa rang bzhin ma yin te rtags dngos por gyur pa la dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If it does not exist, then nonexistence is not the nature of the sign, because the nature of nonexistence does not exist in the entity of the sign.

original: gang gis med pa de ltar mi 'gyur ba 'dir dngos po'i rang bzhin ni rtags kyi chos su bstan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis med pa de ltar mi 'gyur ba 'dir dngos po'i rang bzhin ni rtags kyi chos su bstan pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the nature of the entity is not taught as the property of the sign, because nonexistence is not like that.

original: rjes su 'gro ba yang dngos po'i chos nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba yang dngos po'i chos nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is the nature of the entity the property of the sign, because pervasion is not the nature of the entity.

original: 'di ltar me yod na du ba 'byung ba'i rang bzhin nyid ni dngos po'i chos su 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar me yod na du ba 'byung ba'i rang bzhin nyid ni dngos po'i chos su 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, the nature of the arising of smoke when fire exists is the property of the entity.

original: du ba yod na me yod do zhes bya ba 'di ni dngos po'i chos ma yin te /
analyzed: du ba yod na me yod do zhes bya ba 'di ni dngos po'i chos ma yin te /
translated: But this statement, ‚ÄúWhen smoke exists, fire exists,‚Äù is not the property of the entity.

original: skad cig so so la med pa'i phyir dang / rgyun gzhan yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig so so la med pa'i phyir dang / rgyun gzhan yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist in each moment, and because another continuum is not established.

original: des na skad cig la brten pa'i dngos po nges pa la brten nas rgyun du gyur ba 'di ni de yod na yod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na skad cig la brten pa'i dngos po nges pa la brten nas rgyun du gyur ba 'di ni de yod na yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this continuum that is based on the entity that is based on the moment is that which exists when it exists.

original: 'brel pa rtsa bar gyur pa nyid kyis don so sor nges pa grub na rtogs pa'i rnam pa ci zhig ltar 'byung ba ni mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa rtsa bar gyur pa nyid kyis don so sor nges pa grub na rtogs pa'i rnam pa ci zhig ltar 'byung ba ni mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the ascertainment of the meaning is established by the root of the relation, then it is not contradictory that the form of the understanding arises in any way.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi gtan tshigs la ni chos tha dad pa nyid med pa'i phyir gzhan yod na gzhan 'gyur ba'i chos nyid yod par gal 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi gtan tshigs la ni chos tha dad pa nyid med pa'i phyir gzhan yod na gzhan 'gyur ba'i chos nyid yod par gal 'gyur te /
translated: In the case of a reason of nature, since there is no difference in the property, if the other exists, how could the property of being the other exist,

original: gzhan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other?

original: gal te de lta na dngos po'i chos 'brel pa nyid phyogs kyi chos dang lhan cig rang bzhin yin par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te de lta na dngos po'i chos 'brel pa nyid phyogs kyi chos dang lhan cig rang bzhin yin par 'gyur mod /
translated: If that is so, then the property of the thing, which is the relation itself, would be the nature along with the property of the subject.

original: dngos po ma yin pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog bas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po ma yin pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog bas ci bya zhe na /
translated: But what is the use of the positive and negative concomitance that is not a thing?

original: de ltar @6b 'gyur bar ni mi nus te /
analyzed: de ltar @6b 'gyur bar ni mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be like that,

original: 'brel pa yod kyang de ltar ma rtogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa mi 'grub ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa yod kyang de ltar ma rtogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa mi 'grub ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even if the relation exists, an inference that does not understand it in that way is not established.

original: gang gi phyir du ba me'i rgyu can yin zhing byas pa nyid kyang mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa de'i phyir thams cad du du ba yod na me yod la byas pa yin na mi rtag pa yin no zhes chos can thams cad la nges pa
analyzed: gang gi phyir du ba me'i rgyu can yin zhing byas pa nyid kyang mi rtag pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa de'i phyir thams cad du du ba yod na me yod la byas pa yin na mi rtag pa yin no zhes chos can thams cad la nges pa
translated: Because smoke is the effect of fire and because that which is produced has the nature of being impermanent, therefore, wherever there is smoke there is fire and whatever is produced is impermanent.

original: rtogs nas skabs kyi chos can la rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs nas skabs kyi chos can la rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having ascertained this, one realizes it in the context of the subject.

original: de lta ma yin te ji srid du rgyu mtshan 'di las du ba yod na me yod la med na du ba mi 'byung ngo zhes ma rtogs na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te ji srid du rgyu mtshan 'di las du ba yod na me yod la med na du ba mi 'byung ngo zhes ma rtogs na /
translated: Otherwise, until one realizes that from this reason, wherever there is smoke there is fire and in the absence of fire there is no smoke,

original: gang gi phyir me las du ba 'byung ba de'i phyir du ba mthong nas me rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir me las du ba 'byung ba de'i phyir du ba mthong nas me rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could one realize fire from seeing smoke, since smoke arises from fire?

original: chos can gcig la brten nas de ltar rtogs pa yang ma yin te 'on kyang thams cad du yin no //
analyzed: chos can gcig la brten nas de ltar rtogs pa yang ma yin te 'on kyang thams cad du yin no //
translated: It is not that one realizes this in dependence on a single subject, but rather, it is so in all cases.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bor rtogs pa nyid kyis thams cad khongs su bsdus pas chos can la lkog tu gyur pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos su rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bor rtogs pa nyid kyis thams cad khongs su bsdus pas chos can la lkog tu gyur pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos su rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Since all of that is included in the realization of such an essence, it is the realization of the property to be established that is hidden to the subject.

original: des na rnam pa 'di lta bu rtogs pas chod nas rtogs pa'i phyir 'brel pa rtags kyi mtshan nyid du ma brjod kyi 'on kyang tshad ma nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam pa 'di lta bu rtogs pas chod nas rtogs pa'i phyir 'brel pa rtags kyi mtshan nyid du ma brjod kyi 'on kyang tshad ma nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is realized after having been interrupted by the realization of such an aspect, the connection is not stated as the definition of a reason, but rather valid knowledge is stated.

original: de ni mdo 'di nyid don gyi sgo nas ston pa ni phyogs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mdo 'di nyid don gyi sgo nas ston pa ni phyogs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the statement of the meaning of this s≈´tra is ‚Äúthe property of the subject‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir phyogs chos zhes bya ba phan tshun 'brel pa 'gal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dir phyogs chos zhes bya ba phan tshun 'brel pa 'gal ba'i phyir te /
translated: Here, the term ‚Äúproperty of the subject‚Äù is contradictory because of the mutual connection.

original: phyogs zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsgrub bya brjod pa'i phyir dang / chos ni chos can la bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir na chos la chos gang la 'thad /
analyzed: phyogs zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsgrub bya brjod pa'i phyir dang / chos ni chos can la bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir na chos la chos gang la 'thad /
translated: The term ‚Äúsubject‚Äù expresses the probandum, and since the property is to be established with regard to the subject, what property is suitable for the property?

original: des na bram ze'i khye'u la seng ge zhes bya ba ltar ma 'brel pas phyogs ni chos can no zhes smos so //
analyzed: des na bram ze'i khye'u la seng ge zhes bya ba ltar ma 'brel pas phyogs ni chos can no zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, like the statement ‚Äúthe young brahmin is a lion,‚Äù since it is not connected, it is stated that the subject is the property of the subject.

original: chos can la phyogs su brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: chos can la phyogs su brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: The property is stated as the subject,

original: gang gi chos kyi sgra dang chos ma 'brel par 'gyur ba gnyi ga brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi chos kyi sgra dang chos ma 'brel par 'gyur ba gnyi ga brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not both, since the word property would not be related to the property.

original: sgra don gzhan la 'jug pa ni nye bar btags pa las 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra don gzhan la 'jug pa ni nye bar btags pa las 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The word is applied to another object by designation.

original: de yang 'dod pa'i dbang gis der 'jug pa na dngos nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa'i dbang gis der 'jug pa na dngos nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: And that is applied to that by the power of desire, as if it were real,

original: de la yang 'dod pa'i dbang gis zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang 'dod pa'i dbang gis zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is applied to that by the power of desire.

original: de'i phyir don nyid don gzhan la nye bar 'dogs pa yin la der rang gi sgra ni rang gi don nyid kyis 'jug pa yin no zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir don nyid don gzhan la nye bar 'dogs pa yin la der rang gi sgra ni rang gi don nyid kyis 'jug pa yin no zhes smos pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the object itself is designated as another object, and the word is applied to its own object by its own meaning.

original: yan lag la spyi nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag la spyi nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is because the universal is designated in the part.

original: gal te yang chos chos can la bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi spyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang chos chos can la bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi spyi ni ma yin te /
translated: Even if the property is to be established in the subject, not the universal,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as it is said:

original: de'i phyir chos nyid chos can la bsgrub @7a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos nyid chos can la bsgrub @7a * //
translated: Therefore, the property itself is to be established in the subject,

original: par bya ba'am phyin ci log tu bya ba yin no zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: par bya ba'am phyin ci log tu bya ba yin no zhes bshad pa /
translated: or it is to be established in the opposite way.

original: de lta na yang 'bras bur chos can chos de dang ma 'brel pa rnam par bcad pas bya ba 'grub pa'i phyir na gang las de la phyogs kyi sgra'i don nye bar btags pas de'i sgra 'jug pa 'grub pa spyi bsgrub byar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'bras bur chos can chos de dang ma 'brel pa rnam par bcad pas bya ba 'grub pa'i phyir na gang las de la phyogs kyi sgra'i don nye bar btags pas de'i sgra 'jug pa 'grub pa spyi bsgrub byar brjod pa yin no //
translated: In that case, since the activity is accomplished by the exclusion of the subject that is not related to that property in the effect, the meaning of the term ‚Äúside‚Äù is figuratively applied to it, and the establishment of the term is expressed as the probandum.

original: don gzhan nye bar btags pas don gzhan go bar byed pa'i tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa po ni mi 'dra bar bstan pas dgos pa nyid 'ga' zhig 'dod pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don gzhan nye bar btags pas don gzhan go bar byed pa'i tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa po ni mi 'dra bar bstan pas dgos pa nyid 'ga' zhig 'dod pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The one who posits the convention of causing the understanding of one thing through the figurative application of another thing, having taught the difference, asserts some purpose. This is stated by ‚ÄúIf‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: ma 'brel pa'i phyir nye bar gdags par bya ba yin par gnas pas na 'di nye bar btags pa yin pa 'gog pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma 'brel pa'i phyir nye bar gdags par bya ba yin par gnas pas na 'di nye bar btags pa yin pa 'gog pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Since it is established as the figurative object due to being unrelated, this is not a negation of figurative application.

original: 'on kyang sgra'i don gzhan sgro btags pa'i sgo nas nye bar btags pa las gzhan nye bar gdags par mi bya ba rang gi sgras brjod pa de bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgra'i don gzhan sgro btags pa'i sgo nas nye bar btags pa las gzhan nye bar gdags par mi bya ba rang gi sgras brjod pa de bya ba yin no //
translated: However, the activity is to express that other figurative object through the figurative application by superimposing another meaning of the term, which is not to be figuratively applied by its own term.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because there is no need for it.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: chos can rang gi tshig gis brjod par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: chos can rang gi tshig gis brjod par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The subject is to be expressed by its own words.

original: tshig don gzhan nye bar btags pas ni ma yin te de ltar bstan pa la dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig don gzhan nye bar btags pas ni ma yin te de ltar bstan pa la dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not by the imputation of another meaning of the word, because there is no need for such an explanation.

original: ji ltar lhas byin la seng ge'i don nye bar btags pas dpa' ba la sogs par sgrub pa de bzhin du 'dir 'ga' yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar lhas byin la seng ge'i don nye bar btags pas dpa' ba la sogs par sgrub pa de bzhin du 'dir 'ga' yang ma yin no //
translated: Just as Devadatta is established as courageous by the imputation of the meaning of lion, so it is not in this case.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di lta bu'i brjod pa ni yon tan bstan pa'i 'bras bu can nyid kyis na sgra rang gi don la 'jug kyang phal bar brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di lta bu'i brjod pa ni yon tan bstan pa'i 'bras bu can nyid kyis na sgra rang gi don la 'jug kyang phal bar brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: For this reason, such an expression is a mere statement, even though the word engages its own meaning, because it has the effect of teaching a quality.

original: yon tan brjod pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan brjod pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not for the purpose of expressing a quality.

original: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa nye bar gdags par mi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa nye bar gdags par mi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: In order to refute this, it is said that the explanation should not be imputed.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na chos can gyi chos thams cad yin pa dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na chos can gyi chos thams cad yin pa dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because it is for the purpose of refuting all the qualities of the subject.

original: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: bshad pa / der nye bar gdags su rung ba'i chos can yin par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / der nye bar gdags su rung ba'i chos can yin par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The response: Because it is understood to be a subject that is suitable to be designated in that way.

original: nye bar btags pa'i dgos pa can gyi chos thams cad yin pa dgag pa ni phyogs su nye bar gdags su rung ba'i chos can yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nye bar btags pa'i dgos pa can gyi chos thams cad yin pa dgag pa ni phyogs su nye bar gdags su rung ba'i chos can yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The purpose of the designation is all phenomena. The negation is taught to be a subject that is suitable to be designated as a position.

original: nye bar ma btags pa ni chos can rang gi tshig gis brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: nye bar ma btags pa ni chos can rang gi tshig gis brjod pa yin la /
translated: That which is not designated is a subject that is expressed by its own words.

original: de lta na yang chos can chos zhes bstan pa na bsgrub bya dang dpe dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos can yod pas chos can gyi sgra spyi brjod pa yin pa'i phyir bsgrub bya dang @7b sgrub byed dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i chosüîΩcan gyi chos kyang brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang chos can chos zhes bstan pa na bsgrub bya dang dpe dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos can yod pas chos can gyi sgra spyi brjod pa yin pa'i phyir bsgrub bya dang @7b sgrub byed dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i chos can gyi chos kyang brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, when a subject and a phenomenon are taught, since there is a subject that has the nature of a probandum, an example, and neither, the word subject expresses a generality. Therefore, a phenomenon of a subject that is a probandum, a proof, or neither is also expressed.

original: de yang gtan tshigs su brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu dag gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang gtan tshigs su brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu dag gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Since that is also asserted to be a reason, those types become reasons.

original: des na de ltar nye bar ma btags na nyes pa gang du 'gyur ba de nye bar btags pas bkag pa yin no //üîΩnye bar btags pa de yang nges pa'i chos can rtogs par byed pa na nye bar ma btags na thal bar 'gyur ba chos can kun gyi chos nyid yin pas 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: des na de ltar nye bar ma btags na nyes pa gang du 'gyur ba de nye bar btags pas bkag pa yin no // nye bar btags pa de yang nges pa'i chos can rtogs par byed pa na nye bar ma btags na thal bar 'gyur ba chos can kun gyi chos nyid yin pas 'gog par byed do //
translated: Therefore, if one does not impute in that way, whatever fault there is, that is refuted by the imputation.üîΩMoreover, when one understands the ascertained subject, if one does not impute, the consequence is that it is the nature of all subjects, and so one refutes.

original: 'dir chos can thams cad kyi chos can yin pa bkag pas ngas pa'i chos can rtags par byed pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang nye bar btags pas der rung ba'i chos can du rtogs na chos can thams cad kyi chos yin par thal bar mi 'gyur ba
analyzed: 'dir chos can thams cad kyi chos can yin pa bkag pas ngas pa'i chos can rtags par byed pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang nye bar btags pas der rung ba'i chos can du rtogs na chos can thams cad kyi chos yin par thal bar mi 'gyur ba
translated: Here, by refuting that it is the subject of all subjects, one does not understand the subject that is indicated. However, if one understands the subject that is suitable as that by imputation, then it does not follow that it is the nature of all subjects.

original: yin no // de lta na yang chos can gyi chos thams cad yin pa bkag pa'i don nyid kyis der nye bar gdags su rung ba'i chos can rtogs par bya ba'i don yin par brjod pa gang yin pa de ni nye bar ma btags par chos can gyi chos thams cad
analyzed: yin no // de lta na yang chos can gyi chos thams cad yin pa bkag pa'i don nyid kyis der nye bar gdags su rung ba'i chos can rtogs par bya ba'i don yin par brjod pa gang yin pa de ni nye bar ma btags par chos can gyi chos thams cad
translated: The consequence that all the properties of the subject are

original: yin par thal ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin par thal ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is taught in order to show that it is not suitable to be designated.

original: nye bar ma btags na thal ba de ni nye bar btags pas bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar ma btags na thal ba de ni nye bar btags pas bkag pa yin no //
translated: When it is not designated, that consequence is negated by the designation.

original: de lta na 'o na der nye bar gdags su rung ba'i chos can yin par rtogs pa'i don gyis chos can gyi chos thams cad yin pa bkag pa'i don gyis 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na der nye bar gdags su rung ba'i chos can yin par rtogs pa'i don gyis chos can gyi chos thams cad yin pa bkag pa'i don gyis 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then the meaning of the understanding of the subject that is suitable to be designated there is the meaning of the negation of the existence of all the properties of the subject,

original: nges pa rtogs na gzhan dgag pa shugs kyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa rtogs na gzhan dgag pa shugs kyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when ascertainment is understood, the negation of other is implicitly understood.

original: bzlog pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not the opposite.

original: gal te der nye bar gdags su rung ba'i phyir chos can yin par rtogs pa'i don nyid gtso bo'i dgos pa ma yin na de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te der nye bar gdags su rung ba'i phyir chos can yin par rtogs pa'i don nyid gtso bo'i dgos pa ma yin na de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the purpose of the chief matter were not the very meaning of the understanding of the subject as it is suitable to be designated there, then that would be so.

original: de lta na ni chos can gyi chos thams cad yin pa bkag pa'i don nyid gtso bo'i dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni chos can gyi chos thams cad yin pa bkag pa'i don nyid gtso bo'i dgos par 'gyur ro //
