analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i blos mi bden par rtog pa yin gyi mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don kyang ni ma yin te /
translated: The mind that conceives of the unreal is a conceptual mind, but it is not the meaning of the characteristics such as impermanence.

original: de ni phyi rol na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni phyi rol na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that exists externally.

original: rnam pa btags pa ni gtso bo la sogs pa bzhin dngos po la yod pa ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa btags pa ni gtso bo la sogs pa bzhin dngos po la yod pa ma yin pa yin no //
translated: The imputed aspect, like prakriti and so on, does not exist in things.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i byas pa mi rtag pa las tha dad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i byas pa mi rtag pa las tha dad pa yin gyi /
translated: The aspect of impermanence is different from impermanence,

original: ji ltar dngos po rnams kyis rtag pa bzhin du byas pa nyid kyang dngos po la med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po rnams kyis rtag pa bzhin du byas pa nyid kyang dngos po la med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but impermanence itself is not nonexistent in things, just as permanence is not.

original: gal te ji skad brjod pa'i tshul gyis 'di'i phyi rol gyi byas pa nyid dang @19b mi mthun pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te ji skad brjod pa'i tshul gyis 'di'i phyi rol gyi byas pa nyid dang @19b mi mthun pa ma yin nam /
translated: If impermanence is not incompatible with external things in the way that has been described,

original: de ji ltar na de yang dngos po med par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na de yang dngos po med par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how could it not be nonexistent in things?

original: blo'i bye brag ces smos so //
analyzed: blo'i bye brag ces smos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdue to the distinction of mind‚Äù is stated.

original: 'di brjod pa yin te gal te rnam par rtog pa don gyi gzhan gyi dbang yin pa'i phyir don gyi yul can du gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di brjod pa yin te gal te rnam par rtog pa don gyi gzhan gyi dbang yin pa'i phyir don gyi yul can du gyur pa yin na /
translated: This is what is being said: If conceptual consciousness is the object of another, that is, if it is the object of another consciousness,

original: de'i tshe phyin ci log gi rang bzhin gyi don rtogs na dngos po'i yul nyid nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe phyin ci log gi rang bzhin gyi don rtogs na dngos po'i yul nyid nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: then at that time, if it understands an object that has an erroneous nature, the object of that consciousness would be invalidated.

original: des rtogs par bya ba dngos po ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des rtogs par bya ba dngos po ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the object that it understands would not be a real thing,

original: rnam pa thams cad du don gyi yul can nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du don gyi yul can nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the fact that it has an object that is a real thing is completely negated.

original: gang gi tshe rang dbang du gyur pa'i phyir 'di dag don gyi yul can ma yin pa de'i tshe ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang dbang du gyur pa'i phyir 'di dag don gyi yul can ma yin pa de'i tshe ni nyes pa med do //
translated: But when it is not the object of another, that is, when it is independent, then there is no fault.

original: don gyi yul can gyi shes pa don de la de'i rang bzhin ma yin par rtogs pa ni nges pa kho nar don dam pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gyi yul can gyi shes pa don de la de'i rang bzhin ma yin par rtogs pa ni nges pa kho nar don dam pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When a consciousness that has an object that is a real thing understands an object that is not of its nature, then it definitely appears to have an unreal nature.

original: gang zhig dngos po la rten pa med pa rang gi ngo bo thob pa de ni nye bar len pa tsam gyi gzhan dbang yin pa'i phyir don gyi gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pas rang dbang du gyur pa ni mi srid pa rtogs pa gang yin pa de
analyzed: gang zhig dngos po la rten pa med pa rang gi ngo bo thob pa de ni nye bar len pa tsam gyi gzhan dbang yin pa'i phyir don gyi gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pas rang dbang du gyur pa ni mi srid pa rtogs pa gang yin pa de
translated: Since it is not the other-dependent nature of an object, it is impossible for it to be independent.

original: ni rnam par rtog pa'i nye bar len pa'i stobs kyis yin pa'i phyir chos tha dad pa ltar de ni med pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: ni rnam par rtog pa'i nye bar len pa'i stobs kyis yin pa'i phyir chos tha dad pa ltar de ni med pa kho na yin la /
translated: That is realized by the power of the conceptual appropriation of the object. Therefore, it is only nonexistent, like a different phenomenon.

original: gnod pa med pa'i rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po'i nye bar len pa'i las yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa rnams dngos po la brten pa ma yin pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni dngos po'i nye bar len pa'i las yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa rnams dngos po la brten pa ma yin pa nyid kyis na /
translated: That which is realized without error is the object of the action of appropriation of things. Therefore, since conceptualization is not dependent on things,

original: byas pa'i bdag nyid kyi don kyang btags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byas pa'i bdag nyid kyi don kyang btags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: the nature of the object is not imputed.

original: gal te dngos por yod pa ma yin pa chos kyis rnam par bcad pa ni byas pa nyid phyi rol ma yin pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te dngos por yod pa ma yin pa chos kyis rnam par bcad pa ni byas pa nyid phyi rol ma yin pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If it is not an existent thing, is it not the case that the object of conceptualization is not external, since it is excluded by the object of conceptualization?

original: des na blo la yod pa'i nye bar len pa'i stobs las 'ongs pa yang mi bden pa nyid de /
analyzed: des na blo la yod pa'i nye bar len pa'i stobs las 'ongs pa yang mi bden pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, that which comes from the power of the object‚Äôs presence to the mind is also not real.

original: des na zla ba gnyis la sogs pa bzhin du de rtags ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na zla ba gnyis la sogs pa bzhin du de rtags ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, like two moons, that is not a reason.

original: 'di la bshad pa ni de dag gis brtags pa'i yul gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa ni de dag gis brtags pa'i yul gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation here is ‚Äúthe object imagined by them.‚Äù

original: de dag gis brtags pa'i yul blo de la rnam par gnas pa'i chos gang yin pa des don go na ste /
analyzed: de dag gis brtags pa'i yul blo de la rnam par gnas pa'i chos gang yin pa des don go na ste /
translated: If the object imagined by them is the phenomenon that abides in the mind, then the object is cognized.

original: de rtags nyid yin na ni don mi thob pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rtags nyid yin na ni don mi thob pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is a reason, then the object is not obtained.

original: 'di brjod pa yin te blo la rnam par gnas pa'i chos nyid ni rtags ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di brjod pa yin te blo la rnam par gnas pa'i chos nyid ni rtags ma yin te /
translated: This is the point: The phenomenon that abides in the mind is not a reason.

original: de rtags yin na don thob pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtags yin na don thob pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is a reason, then the object is not obtained.

original: 'on kyang dngos po nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po nyid yin no //
translated: However, it is a thing.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba mi bden pa nyid yin yang 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba mi bden pa nyid yin yang 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: Therefore, even though the appearance of conceptual thought is not real, what is the contradiction?

original: 'o na ji ltar chos tha dad par rtogs pa nye bar bkod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar chos tha dad par rtogs pa nye bar bkod ce na /
translated: Well then, how is it that the understanding of a different phenomenon is presented?

original: chos tha dad par brtags pa can gyi rnam par rtog pas @20a * //
analyzed: chos tha dad par brtags pa can gyi rnam par rtog pas @20a * //
translated: The conceptual thought that imputes phenomena as separate entities.üîΩ

original: de rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is understood by a conceptual thought that apprehends the difference of the two.

original: de lta bur rtogs na grub pa dang bsgrub par bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba 'thob pa'i phyir bsgrub bya dang sgrub pa'i dngos po 'thad pa des na de ltar rtogs pa'i dngos po nyid sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur rtogs na grub pa dang bsgrub par bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba 'thob pa'i phyir bsgrub bya dang sgrub pa'i dngos po 'thad pa des na de ltar rtogs pa'i dngos po nyid sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: If it were understood in that way, then the distinction between what is to be established and the proof would be obtained, and so the nature of the object that is understood would be the proof.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi mi 'khrul ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi mi 'khrul ba grub pa yin no //
translated: And for that very reason, the non-erroneous [cognition] that has the reason of the relation is established.

original: 'o na ji ltar phyi rol dang mi 'dra ba'i byas pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa de rtogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar phyi rol dang mi 'dra ba'i byas pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa de rtogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: But how is that conceptual thought that understands the produced, which is not like the external [object], understood?

original: rnam par rtog pa ni de rtogs pa ma yin gyi mngon sum nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni de rtogs pa ma yin gyi mngon sum nyid do //
translated: That conceptual thought is not the understanding of that [object], but is itself a direct perception.

original: gal te mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'i byas pa nyid mi rtag pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ji ltar sgrub pa dang bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos por 'gyur zhe na ;
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'i byas pa nyid mi rtag pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ji ltar sgrub pa dang bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos por 'gyur zhe na ;
translated: If the produced that is understood by direct perception is not different from impermanence, how can there be the nature of what is to be established and the proof?

original: brjod pa byas pa las mi rtag pa tha mi dad pa yin yang mngon sum byas pa zhes bya bar rjes su 'jug gi /
analyzed: brjod pa byas pa las mi rtag pa tha mi dad pa yin yang mngon sum byas pa zhes bya bar rjes su 'jug gi /
translated: Although impermanence is not different from what is produced, it is said to be ‚Äúperceived‚Äù because it is engaged by perception.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni ma yin pa'i phyir chos tha dad par rtogs par 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni ma yin pa'i phyir chos tha dad par rtogs par 'thad pa yin no //
translated: But since impermanence is not perceived, it is reasonable to understand that the two are different things.

original: gal te mngon sum nyid kyis rtags rtogs pa yin na //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum nyid kyis rtags rtogs pa yin na //
translated: If the reason is understood by perception itself,

original: 'o na ji ltar blo la yod pa'i zhes bshad ci na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar blo la yod pa'i zhes bshad ci na /
translated: then why is it said, ‚Äúthat which exists in the awareness‚Äù?

original: 'di na bshad zin te /
analyzed: 'di na bshad zin te /
translated: This has already been explained.

original: blo la yod pa'i chos kyi bye brag gang yin pa 'di ni mngon sum gyi rjes su 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: blo la yod pa'i chos kyi bye brag gang yin pa 'di ni mngon sum gyi rjes su 'jug pa yin te /
translated: That which is a particular quality of an object existing in awareness is engaged by perception.

original: des na mngon sum gyis grub pa las 'das pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: des na mngon sum gyis grub pa las 'das pa yang ma yin /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it is beyond what is established by perception,

original: chos tha dad pa nyams pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos tha dad pa nyams pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it the case that the difference between the two is lost.

original: de ltar rang bzhin 'brel pas don go bar byed pa nyid du brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin 'brel pas don go bar byed pa nyid du brjod nas /
translated: Having thus described the understanding of the meaning through the relation of nature,

original: de'i rnam pa gcig bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa gcig bshad pa yin no //
translated: one aspect of that has been explained.

original: rnam pa gzhan yang bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang bshad pa ni /
translated: The other aspect is explained as follows.

original: 'bras bu yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The result is also.

original: de'i bdag nyid 'ba' zhig der rang bzhin 'brel bar ni ma zad de /üîΩ'bras bu ji srid pa yang rang bzhin 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid 'ba' zhig der rang bzhin 'brel bar ni ma zad de / 'bras bu ji srid pa yang rang bzhin 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Not only is the nature of the sign related to the nature of the probandum,üîΩbut also the effect is related to the nature of the sign.

original: 'bras bu yang rag las pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang rag las pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: And the effect is related to the nature of the sign.üîΩHere, if there is a natural relation, then the meaning of the sign is not mistaken with regard to the meaning of the probandum.

original: 'di la rang bzhin 'brel pa yod na don gyis don 'khrul pa med do zhes bya bas go bar byed pa go bar bya ba la rag las pa nyid kyis der mi 'khrul bar brjod la /
analyzed: 'di la rang bzhin 'brel pa yod na don gyis don 'khrul pa med do zhes bya bas go bar byed pa go bar bya ba la rag las pa nyid kyis der mi 'khrul bar brjod la /
translated: By saying, ‚ÄúIt is understood by the fact that the sign is dependent on the probandum,‚Äù it is said that the sign is not mistaken with regard to the probandum by virtue of being dependent on the probandum.

original: de ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas bdag nyid bya bas ni go bar bya ba'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i rgyu mtshan rnam pa gcig gis go bar byed pa'i //üîΩgo bar bya ba las mi 'khrul par bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas bdag nyid bya bas ni go bar bya ba'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i rgyu mtshan rnam pa gcig gis go bar byed pa'i //üîΩgo bar bya ba las mi 'khrul par bkod pa yin no //
translated: And by saying, ‚ÄúBecause it is of the nature of that,‚Äù it is said that the sign is not mistaken with regard to the probandum by virtue of being of the nature of the probandum, by virtue of the reason that is of the same nature as the probandum.

original: rang bzhin 'brel pa'i phyir gang la 'khrul pa med pa de'i rang bzhin 'brel po de 'bras bu yin no zhes bshad pa na yang don gang zhig don gang la 'khrul pa med pa de ni de la ltos nas 'bras bu yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur bas
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel pa'i phyir gang la 'khrul pa med pa de'i rang bzhin 'brel po de 'bras bu yin no zhes bshad pa na yang don gang zhig don gang la 'khrul pa med pa de ni de la ltos nas 'bras bu yin no zhes brjod par 'gyur bas
translated: When it is said that ‚Äúthe nature of that which is not mistaken is the nature related to the effect,‚Äù it is said that ‚Äúthe object that is not mistaken with regard to the object is the effect in reliance on that.‚Äù

original: de rgyu nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rgyu nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is understood to be the cause.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: @20b de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin dang de las byung ba'i rang bzhin 'brel pas don gyis don 'khrul pa med pa yin no zhes so //
analyzed: @20b de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin dang de las byung ba'i rang bzhin 'brel pas don gyis don 'khrul pa med pa yin no zhes so //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe nature related to the object‚Äù is that the object is not mistaken with regard to the object.

original: de'i bdag nyid la ni bdag nyid gcig pa nyid rang bzhin 'brel pa yin pas de nyid las 'khrul pa med par 'gyur ba yin na 'bras bu go mi 'khrul ba'i yul la bdag nyid 'brel pa ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid la ni bdag nyid gcig pa nyid rang bzhin 'brel pa yin pas de nyid las 'khrul pa med par 'gyur ba yin na 'bras bu go mi 'khrul ba'i yul la bdag nyid 'brel pa ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the nature of the effect is the same nature as the cause, the nature related to the cause is the same nature as the cause, so how could the object of the nonerroneous effect be related to the cause?

original: de'i rang bzhin zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin zhes smos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe nature of that‚Äù is stated.

original: dngos po rnams skyes pa las sngar ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams skyes pa las sngar ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Things do not exist prior to their production.

original: 'di ni yod pa nyid na skye ba las yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni yod pa nyid na skye ba las yin no //
translated: This is because it is existent.

original: 'bras bu dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gyi skye ba de yang gang la 'di'i 'khrul pa med pa de las yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gyi skye ba de yang gang la 'di'i 'khrul pa med pa de las yin te /
translated: And that arising which is related to the effect by the relation of intrinsic nature is from that which is nonerroneous with regard to it.

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir 'bras bu rang bzhin 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir 'bras bu rang bzhin 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effect is related to the cause by the relation of intrinsic nature.

original: gang gis de lta bu'i rang bzhin 'brel pa'i gtan tshigs las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa tshad mar 'gyur ba de ltar rang bzhin 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis ston pa'i rgyu ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis de lta bu'i rang bzhin 'brel pa'i gtan tshigs las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa tshad mar 'gyur ba de ltar rang bzhin 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis ston pa'i rgyu ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reason for teaching the two kinds of relations of intrinsic nature, from which there arises an inference that is valid knowledge?

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the knowledge of the object to be inferred.‚Äù

original: gang gis de lta bu'i go byed kyi shugs kyis rang bzhin thob pa'i rjes su dpag pa tshad mar gyur pa gtan tshigs kyi rjes su dpag par bya ba la mi 'khrul pa rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i mtshan nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i don 'di bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de lta bu'i go byed kyi shugs kyis rang bzhin thob pa'i rjes su dpag pa tshad mar gyur pa gtan tshigs kyi rjes su dpag par bya ba la mi 'khrul pa rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i mtshan nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i don 'di bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches that the inference that is valid knowledge, which has the intrinsic nature of the instrument of knowledge that causes such understanding, is nonerroneous with regard to the object to be inferred, the reason, and has the characteristic of invariable concomitance.

original: gtan tshigs nyid ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs nyid ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: The reason itself is not a means of valid cognition,

original: 'on kyang rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa yin no //
translated: but it is the cognition that is the inferential understanding.

original: des na de'i 'khrul pa med pas de lta bu'i dngos po grub pa na de'i rtsa ba can gyi shes pa don yod pa can du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i 'khrul pa med pas de lta bu'i dngos po grub pa na de'i rtsa ba can gyi shes pa don yod pa can du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when the thing is established in that way, the cognition that has it as its basis is shown to be nondeceptive and to have an object.

original: de na rnam pa 'dis rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa rnam pa gnyis tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de na rnam pa 'dis rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa rnam pa gnyis tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this way, the two kinds of cognition that are the objects of inference are means of valid cognition.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa 'di gnyis ni zhes gang brjod pa rjes su dpag par bya ba'i shes pa gnyis kyang gang du brjod ce na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa 'di gnyis ni zhes gang brjod pa rjes su dpag par bya ba'i shes pa gnyis kyang gang du brjod ce na /
translated: But if the two kinds of cognition that are the objects of inference are said to be means of valid cognition, what are the two kinds of cognition that are the objects of inference?

original: ji ltar ma brjod /
analyzed: ji ltar ma brjod /
translated: How is it that they are not mentioned?

original: 'di ltar rjes su dpag par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bshad pa zhes skabs brtsams nas phyogs chos zhes bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su dpag par rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bshad pa zhes skabs brtsams nas phyogs chos zhes bshad pa yin la /
translated: In this way, the passage begins with the words ‚Äúbecause it is explained,‚Äù and then explains that the property of the subject is mentioned in order to establish the object of inference.

original: de rnam par gzhag pa na yang rtags kyi mtshan nyid brjod pa yan lag yin te /
analyzed: de rnam par gzhag pa na yang rtags kyi mtshan nyid brjod pa yan lag yin te /
translated: And when that is established, the statement of the definition of the reason is a part of it,

original: de rtags las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtags las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is produced from the reason.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni tshul gsum yin la /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni tshul gsum yin la /
translated: The definition of a reason is the trimodal condition.

original: de yang gsum la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang gsum la yod pa yin no //
translated: And that is present in the three.

original: gsum po yang 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis las gnyis yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsum po yang 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis las gnyis yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And the three are twofold in relation to the two.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bskyed pa rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa ni gnyis yin la /üîΩrjes su dpag par bya ba @21a * //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bskyed pa rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa ni gnyis yin la / rjes su dpag par bya ba @21a * //
translated: The cognition of the inferential object generated by such a reason is twofold.

original: shes pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: shes pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba kho na'o //
translated: The cognition of the inferential object is only the inferential.

original: rang bzhin 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i rtags kyis bskyed pa 'di gnyis tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i rtags kyis bskyed pa 'di gnyis tshad ma yin no //
translated: These two, generated by a reason endowed with the twofold natural relation, are valid cognitions.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are born from that.

original: re zhig nges par gyur pa'i rtags las rjes su dpag pa skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: re zhig nges par gyur pa'i rtags las rjes su dpag pa skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: First, the cognition born from a definite reason is called inference.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i rang bzhin 'brel pa'i rtags las skyes pa na yang rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa rjes su dpag par bya ba las kyang skyes pa yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i rang bzhin 'brel pa'i rtags las skyes pa na yang rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa rjes su dpag par bya ba las kyang skyes pa yin pa nyid do //
translated: When it is produced from a reason that is related to the object to be inferred in the manner described, then the cognition of the object to be inferred is also produced from the object to be inferred.

original: 'di ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba'i bdag nyid kyi rtags las skyes pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba las kyang skyes pa kho na'o ;
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su dpag par bya ba'i bdag nyid kyi rtags las skyes pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba las kyang skyes pa kho na'o ;
translated: Thus, when it is produced from a reason that has the nature of the object to be inferred, it is also produced from the object to be inferred.

original: / rjes su dpag par bya ba'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i rtags las skyes pa gang yin pa de yang de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: / rjes su dpag par bya ba'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i rtags las skyes pa gang yin pa de yang de bzhin nyid do //
translated: And that which is produced from a reason that is the effect of the object to be inferred is also just that.

original: shes pa de rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don la skyes pa na yang des nges par yod pa'i phyir de nyid gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir don gsal ba nyid kyis 'di gnyis tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa de rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don la skyes pa na yang des nges par yod pa'i phyir de nyid gsal ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir don gsal ba nyid kyis 'di gnyis tshad ma yin no //
translated: When that cognition is produced from the object to be inferred, it is ascertained by that cognition, and because it has the nature of manifestation, the two are valid cognitions by virtue of manifesting the object.

original: ji ltar gsal ba'i don med na ni don gsal bar mi 'gyur na de ni 'di ltar srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gsal ba'i don med na ni don gsal bar mi 'gyur na de ni 'di ltar srid pa ma yin no //
translated: If the object were not manifested, it would not manifest the object, but that is not possible.

original: de smras pa ni /
analyzed: de smras pa ni /
translated: He says that:

original: der 'khrul pa med pa dag yin te zhes bya'o //
analyzed: der 'khrul pa med pa dag yin te zhes bya'o //
translated: They are said to be ‚Äúnon-erroneous‚Äù in regard to that.

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid kyi don dang ldan pa las mi 'da' ba'i phyir gsal bar nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid kyi don dang ldan pa las mi 'da' ba'i phyir gsal bar nges pa yin no //
translated: They are ‚Äúclear‚Äù because they do not deviate from the object that is their result.

original: mngon sum bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /
analyzed: mngon sum bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /
translated: ‚ÄúLike perception‚Äù is the example.

original: dper na don las skyes pas don la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir don gsal ba'i rang bzhin tshad ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di gnyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: dper na don las skyes pas don la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir don gsal ba'i rang bzhin tshad ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di gnyis kyang ngo //
translated: Just as perception is a valid cognition because it is non-erroneous in regard to the object that it arises from, so are these two.

original: de ni don las skyes pa'i phyir shes pa de gnyis kyang don la mngon sum nyid yin nam /
analyzed: de ni don las skyes pa'i phyir shes pa de gnyis kyang don la mngon sum nyid yin nam /
translated: Are these two cognitions direct perception in regard to the object because they arise from the object?

original: don nyid rnam par shes pa bskyed pa ni bdag gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: don nyid rnam par shes pa bskyed pa ni bdag gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The object itself, which produces the consciousness, is what illuminates itself.

original: des na rjes su dpag par bya bas bskyed pa rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa gnyis ni mngon sum bzhin dngos po nyid du na don gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag par bya bas bskyed pa rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa gnyis ni mngon sum bzhin dngos po nyid du na don gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the two cognitions that are produced by the object of inference and the object of testimony are direct perception in the sense that they are things that illuminate their objects.

original: de snang ba nyid ma yin yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: de snang ba nyid ma yin yang zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though it does not appear‚Äù is stated.

original: gang gis 'di gnyis dngos su na dngos po gsal ba'i phyir de la mngon sum du 'gyur ba rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa 'di gnyis rjes su dpag par bya ba snang pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis 'di gnyis dngos su na dngos po gsal ba'i phyir de la mngon sum du 'gyur ba rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa 'di gnyis rjes su dpag par bya ba snang pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since these two are actually the manifestation of a thing, they are direct perception, but the knowledge that infers the object to be inferred does not manifest the object to be inferred.üîΩHow is it that these two are not the manifestation of a thing, although they are not different from the cause of the manifestation of a thing?

original: ji ltar na dngos po snang ba'i rgyu khyad par med pa las 'di gnyis ni dngos po snang ba ma yin par 'gyur la mngon sum ni ma yin zhe na dngos las ma skyes pa'i phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar na dngos po snang ba'i rgyu khyad par med pa las 'di gnyis ni dngos po snang ba ma yin par 'gyur la mngon sum ni ma yin zhe na dngos las ma skyes pa'i phyir zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause they are not produced from a thing.‚Äù

original: gang gis 'di gnyis mngon sum bzhin du dngos bo gsal ba @21b nyid du 'gyur ba rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa rjes su dpag par bya ba dag las dngos su skyes pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gis 'di gnyis mngon sum bzhin du dngos bo gsal ba @21b nyid du 'gyur ba rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa rjes su dpag par bya ba dag las dngos su skyes pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Since these two are not actually produced from the object to be inferred, the knowledge that infers the object to be inferred, they are not direct perception, although they are the manifestation of a thing, like direct perception.

original: 'on kyang mi rtag pa byas pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa yin yang byas pa nyams su myong bas bar chod pas rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang mi rtag pa byas pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa yin yang byas pa nyams su myong bas bar chod pas rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa skyed par byed do //
translated: Although impermanence is the nature of the produced, the knowledge that conceives of it is produced by the experience of the produced, which is an obstruction.

original: rtags sam rtags can gyi rnam par rtog pa dngos su don las skye ba 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: rtags sam rtags can gyi rnam par rtog pa dngos su don las skye ba 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no real production of the sign or the sign-bearer from an object.

original: de bzhin du me yang rang gi 'bras bu du ba myong bas bar chod pas rang gi shes pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du me yang rang gi 'bras bu du ba myong bas bar chod pas rang gi shes pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: In the same way, fire is the cause of the cognition of its effect, smoke, because it is the obstruction of the experience of its effect.

original: des na don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning.

original: ji skad brjod pa'i 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rtags rjes su dpag par bya ba la 'khrul pa med pas na /
analyzed: ji skad brjod pa'i 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rtags rjes su dpag par bya ba la 'khrul pa med pas na /
translated: Because it possesses the relation as it has been described, the sign is not mistaken with regard to the inferential object.

original: de yod na bsgrub bya yod par nges par rtogs nas rtogs pa po rjes su dpag par 'jug par byed pa ni tshad ma nyid 'jug par byed pa yin te de lta bur gyur pa'i don de nyid de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na bsgrub bya yod par nges par rtogs nas rtogs pa po rjes su dpag par 'jug par byed pa ni tshad ma nyid 'jug par byed pa yin te de lta bur gyur pa'i don de nyid de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one has ascertained that the probandum exists if that exists, the one who understands engages in inference. The engagement of valid cognition is just that, because the object that is such engages in that understanding.

original: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum bzhin du rgyu rkyen gyi nus pa tsam las skyes pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum bzhin du rgyu rkyen gyi nus pa tsam las skyes pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: In this way, inference is not produced merely from the power of causes and conditions, like perception.

original: 'on kyang ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i rigs pa rtsol ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i rigs pa rtsol ba yin no //
translated: However, in order to understand the meaning that is not understood, inferential reasoning is exertion.

original: de yang 'di ltar 'thad pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar 'thad pa yin te /
translated: And that is tenable in this way:

original: de don gzhan las rtogs pa na don gzhan de mi 'khrul par nges pas de las de rtogs par 'thad ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de don gzhan las rtogs pa na don gzhan de mi 'khrul par nges pas de las de rtogs par 'thad ba'i phyir ro //
translated: when one understands a meaning from another meaning, it is tenable that it is understood from that because it is ascertained without error.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i don de lta bu nyid du rtog pa ni tshad ma yin no ;üîΩ/ don gzhan 'khrul pa med par nges par ma rtogs na ni brtag par mi bya ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i don de lta bu nyid du rtog pa ni tshad ma yin no ; / don gzhan 'khrul pa med par nges par ma rtogs na ni brtag par mi bya ba'am /
translated: The conception of that meaning as just such is valid knowledge.

original: the tshom du 'gyur ba'i phyir rtogs pa tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: the tshom du 'gyur ba'i phyir rtogs pa tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: If one does not understand the ascertainment of another meaning without error, then it is not to be conceived or it would be doubt. Therefore understanding is not valid knowledge.

original: 'on te 'brel pa ma brtags pa 'khrul pa las nges pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin na de lta na yang nges pa tsam las ni rnam par rtog pa tshad ma ma yin te mngon sum bzhin du rang bzhin nyid kyis don gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'on te 'brel pa ma brtags pa 'khrul pa las nges pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin na de lta na yang nges pa tsam las ni rnam par rtog pa tshad ma ma yin te mngon sum bzhin du rang bzhin nyid kyis don gsal ba ma yin pa'i phyir
translated: But if ascertainment arises from an unanalyzed connection that is erroneous, then even in that case, conception is not valid knowledge from mere ascertainment because, like direct perception, it is not a clear object by its very nature.

original: ro // don gsal ba la ni don grub pa'i rtsa ba can yin pas don ma grub kyang nges pa tsam las ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: ro // don gsal ba la ni don grub pa'i rtsa ba can yin pas don ma grub kyang nges pa tsam las ga la 'gyur /
translated: If the meaning is clear, then since the meaning is established as the basis, how could there be ascertainment from mere non-establishment of the meaning?

original: de'i phyir don gyi 'bras bu nyid kyis don la so sor nges pas don ji ltar rtogs pa de bzhin du yod pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin pa de bas na rang bzhin 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir don gyi 'bras bu nyid kyis don la so sor nges pas don ji ltar rtogs pa de bzhin du yod pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin pa de bas na rang bzhin 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis nye bar bkod do //
translated: Therefore, since the meaning is ascertained individually by the result itself, the meaning exists just as it is understood. Thus, inference is valid cognition. Therefore, the two types of natural relation are presented.

original: des na de ltar 'brel pa nye bar bkod pa gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar 'brel pa nye bar bkod pa gzhung btsugs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the presentation of relation in this way is the establishment of the treatise.

original: de nges pa nyid ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan med pa nyid kyis 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nges pa nyid ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan med pa nyid kyis 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Ascertaining that is established by the absence of anything else, such as the statement, ‚ÄúThe nature of cause and effect.‚Äù

original: gang gis de de dang mtshungs par @22a * //
analyzed: gang gis de de dang mtshungs par @22a * //
translated: By what is that similar to that?

original: rjes su dpag pa yang de ltar 'gyur ba mngon sum don la 'khrul pa med pas ni tshad ma ma yin gyi 'on kyang rang gi rgyu'i nus pa nyid las dngos po gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis dngos po la tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang de ltar 'gyur ba mngon sum don la 'khrul pa med pas ni tshad ma ma yin gyi 'on kyang rang gi rgyu'i nus pa nyid las dngos po gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis dngos po la tshad ma yin no //
translated: And inference is like that. Direct perception is not a valid cognition because it is nonerroneous with regard to its object. However, it is a valid cognition with regard to things, because the nature of the clarity of things arises from the power of its own cause.üîΩTherefore, having seen blue without obstruction, one understands it as blue.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chod pa med par sngon po mthong nas sngon po'o zhes rtogs kyi rjes su dpag pa ltar sngon po la mi 'khrul ba'i rjes su 'jug pas ni ma yin no zhes dogs pa 'di bsu nas mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid kyang zhes smos
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chod pa med par sngon po mthong nas sngon po'o zhes rtogs kyi rjes su dpag pa ltar sngon po la mi 'khrul ba'i rjes su 'jug pas ni ma yin no zhes dogs pa 'di bsu nas mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid kyang zhes smos
translated: To anticipate the qualm, ‚ÄúIt is not like inference, which engages its object by way of being nonerroneous with regard to blue,‚Äù he says, ‚ÄúDirect perception is a valid cognition.‚Äù

original: so // gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa 'ba' zhig tu mi zad kyi /
analyzed: so // gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa 'ba' zhig tu mi zad kyi /
translated: Because it is not only inference,

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma ji srid pa yang don 'khrul pa med pa yin na yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma ji srid pa yang don 'khrul pa med pa yin na yin no //
translated: direct perception is also a valid cognition.

original: yang 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig tshad ma yin nam /
analyzed: yang 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig tshad ma yin nam /
translated: What is this so-called nonerroneous?

original: 'on te tshad ma'i rgyu yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te tshad ma'i rgyu yin nam /
translated: Is it a valid cognition? Or is it the cause of a valid cognition?

original: de ste tshad ma rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin /
analyzed: de ste tshad ma rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin /
translated: That is, it is a means of valid cognition.

original: re zhig tshad ma ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig tshad ma ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a means of valid cognition,

original: tshad ma slu ba med pa can gyi shes pa zhes don gsal ba'i rang bzhin tsam gyis rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma slu ba med pa can gyi shes pa zhes don gsal ba'i rang bzhin tsam gyis rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a means of valid cognition is posited merely by the nature of the clarity of the object.

original: rgyu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it a cause,

original: tshad ma'i rgyu nyid las tshad ma'i de nyid 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma'i rgyu nyid las tshad ma'i de nyid 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reality of a means of valid cognition is established from the cause of a means of valid cognition.

original: rnam par 'jog par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par 'jog par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it a positer,

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i don dmigs pa nyid las don nges pas tshad ma rnam par 'jog pas don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i don dmigs pa nyid las don nges pas tshad ma rnam par 'jog pas don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is meaningless to posit a means of valid cognition by the ascertainment of an object from the mere observation of an object without error.

original: de bzhin du don nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi mngon sum yang rang gi rgyu nyid las yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du don nges pa'i bdag nyid kyi mngon sum yang rang gi rgyu nyid las yin no //
translated: In the same way, perception, which has the nature of the ascertainment of an object, is posited as a means of valid cognition from its own cause.

original: tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin yang don gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis kyang gzhag par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yin yang don gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis kyang gzhag par nus pa yin no //
translated: Although it is posited as a means of valid cognition, it can also be posited by the nature of the clarity of the object.

original: gal te don med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir don la mi bslu ba mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa tshad mar 'jog pa yin la de yang don la 'khrul pa med pa'i rang bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba'i bsam pas de skad brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir don la mi bslu ba mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa tshad mar 'jog pa yin la de yang don la 'khrul pa med pa'i rang bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba'i bsam pas de skad brjod do zhe na /
translated: This is what is meant by the statement that they are nondeceptive.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: yul nyid ston par byed pa 'di gnyis ni don la mi bslu ba nyid la brten par 'gyur bas mi bslu ba de nyid rnam par 'jog pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur bas don la mi 'khrul bas ci bya ste /
analyzed: yul nyid ston par byed pa 'di gnyis ni don la mi bslu ba nyid la brten par 'gyur bas mi bslu ba de nyid rnam par 'jog pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur bas don la mi 'khrul bas ci bya ste /
translated: These two, which reveal the object, are based on nondeceptiveness in regard to the object, and nondeceptiveness is a factor that establishes them. So what is the use of being nonmistaken in regard to the object?

original: de nyid kyi nang gi yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi nang gi yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is an internal factor of them.

original: de ni 'di dag la bdag nyid ji lta bar khyad par can du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di dag la bdag nyid ji lta bar khyad par can du grub pa yin no //
translated: That is how they are established as being special in accordance with their nature.

original: de'i phyir 'dir bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the intention here.

original: dngos po'i mthu la mi ltos pa 'di dag gis rab tu bstan pa nyid mthar phyin par mi 'gyur bas shes pa dang don dag tha dad pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid med na ji ltar myong ba'i don med na mi 'byung ba nyid dngos @22b po'i nus pa
analyzed: dngos po'i mthu la mi ltos pa 'di dag gis rab tu bstan pa nyid mthar phyin par mi 'gyur bas shes pa dang don dag tha dad pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid med na ji ltar myong ba'i don med na mi 'byung ba nyid dngos @22b po'i nus pa
translated: Since these do not depend on the power of things, they do not ultimately teach. Since consciousness and objects are different, if they are not of the same nature, how could the object of experience not arise when there is no object?

original: yin no // de'i phyir mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pas don rtogs par byed pas ni gdon mi za bar de'i don med na mi 'byung ba rtogs par bya'i /
analyzed: yin no // de'i phyir mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pas don rtogs par byed pas ni gdon mi za bar de'i don med na mi 'byung ba rtogs par bya'i /
translated: Therefore, when one understands an object through perception or inference, one must understand that the object is not possible without it.

original: gal te mngon sum gyis don bar ma chod pa nyid du rtogs so zhes brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis don bar ma chod pa nyid du rtogs so zhes brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it said that perception understands the object without any obstruction?

original: mngon sum 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de /
analyzed: mngon sum 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad de /
translated: It is not only perception.

original: tshad ma med pa yang yul gzhan na khron pa'i chu la sogs so //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa yang yul gzhan na khron pa'i chu la sogs so //
translated: Even without valid cognition, one understands the water in a well in another place.

original: rtogs pa tsam ni de lta ma yin par mi 'gyur pa'i phyir 'thad pa la ltos par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa tsam ni de lta ma yin par mi 'gyur pa'i phyir 'thad pa la ltos par bya ba yin no //
translated: But understanding is not like that. Therefore, it must depend on what is reasonable.

original: dngos po ma brtags pa'i shes pa nyid ni don sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //üîΩ'on te shes pas don dmigs pa'i phyir de las de 'grub po zhe na ;
analyzed: dngos po ma brtags pa'i shes pa nyid ni don sgrub par byed pa ma yin no // 'on te shes pas don dmigs pa'i phyir de las de 'grub po zhe na ;
translated: But a cognition that does not examine an object does not establish the object.üîΩIf you say that the object is established from that cognition because the object is perceived by the cognition,

original: de yang rnam par nges par mthong ba las don 'grub po zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang rnam par nges par mthong ba las don 'grub po zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal ba yin te /
translated: then the passage beginning ‚ÄúBut if the object is established from the perception of the object by the cognition‚Äù clarifies this.

original: de nyid du gtan la phab pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid du gtan la phab pa yin no //
translated: This is the conclusion.

original: de lta na 'o na don gyi don 'khrul pa med kyi rjes su dpag pa'i don grub pas na de don la 'khrul pa med par bstan pas ci bya /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na don gyi don 'khrul pa med kyi rjes su dpag pa'i don grub pas na de don la 'khrul pa med par bstan pas ci bya /
translated: If that is so, then since the object of inference is established without error, what is the point of teaching that the object is without error?

original: 'di ltar don de nyid kyis yod par grub pa'i don rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar don de nyid kyis yod par grub pa'i don rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In this way, the object is understood to be established as existent by that very object.

original: de ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi /
translated: This is true.

original: de'i tshad ma nyid kyang rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshad ma nyid kyang rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
translated: But its validity must also be established.

original: de ni rang gi chos kyis gzhag par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni rang gi chos kyis gzhag par nus pa yin te /
translated: It can be established by its own property.

original: gzhan gyi chos ni gzhan gyi rang bzhin rnam par 'jog par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi chos ni gzhan gyi rang bzhin rnam par 'jog par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The property of another cannot establish the nature of another.

original: gal te tshad ma nyid don la 'khrul pa med pas nges pa yin na bdag thob pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang tshad mar gtan la ma phebs pa'i phyir the tshom du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma nyid don la 'khrul pa med pas nges pa yin na bdag thob pa'i rjes su dpag pa yang tshad mar gtan la ma phebs pa'i phyir the tshom du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If a valid cognition is a certainty because it is nonerroneous with respect to its object, then even an inference that has attained its object would be a doubt because it is not established as a valid cognition.

original: rjes su dpag pa ma skyes pa dngos po'i mthu nyid kyis skye ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ma skyes pa dngos po'i mthu nyid kyis skye ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: An inference does not arise by the power of things themselves without being generated.

original: 'on kyang 'di ni tshad ma yin te don la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir don rtogs par nus pa yin no zhes bya bas skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni tshad ma yin te don la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir don rtogs par nus pa yin no zhes bya bas skye ba yin no //
translated: However, it is a valid cognition because it is nonerroneous with respect to its object, and it is capable of comprehending its object.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid 'khrul pa med pa kho na ji ltar yin zhes dogs na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid 'khrul pa med pa kho na ji ltar yin zhes dogs na /
translated: How is it that a valid perceptual cognition is nonerroneous?

original: phyogs gzhan la tshad ma ma yin par bshad pa ni de med par zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan la tshad ma ma yin par bshad pa ni de med par zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The explanation that it is not a valid cognition with respect to another object is ‚Äúif it does not exist.‚Äù

original: don med par 'byung ba ni don der 'khrul pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don med par 'byung ba ni don der 'khrul pa'i phyir te /
translated: It arises without an object because it is mistaken with respect to that object.

original: phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is erroneous.

original: phyin ci log ni ji ltar rtog pa'i don med pa yin te /
analyzed: phyin ci log ni ji ltar rtog pa'i don med pa yin te /
translated: An error is an object that does not exist as it is imagined.

original: de yod na shes pa phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de yod na shes pa phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: If it does exist, then consciousness is not erroneous.

original: de'i phyir 'khrul pa med pa nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khrul pa med pa nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, non-error is a valid cognition.

original: des na de ltar 'khrul na tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid mi 'khrul pa'i rtsa ba can du bsgrubs nas de yang de las byung ba'i rtsa ba can du @23a * //
analyzed: des na de ltar 'khrul na tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid mi 'khrul pa'i rtsa ba can du bsgrubs nas de yang de las byung ba'i rtsa ba can du @23a * //
translated: Thus, since it is not a valid cognition if it is erroneous in this way, having established that the validity of a direct perception has non-error as its root, he shows that non-error has as its root arising from that.

original: bstan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi zhes smos so //
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúfrom another.‚Äù

original: shes pa ni don las gzhan yin no //
analyzed: shes pa ni don las gzhan yin no //
translated: Consciousness is different from the object.

original: dngos po tha dad pa gzhan gyi mi 'khrul pa de yang de las skyes pa las gzhan ci zhig yod /
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa gzhan gyi mi 'khrul pa de yang de las skyes pa las gzhan ci zhig yod /
translated: What else is there that is non-erroneous with regard to a different, separate thing, if it arises from that?

original: de las skyes pa'i rgyu mtshan can nyid yin pa'i phyir nye bar btags nas tha mi dad par bstan to //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i rgyu mtshan can nyid yin pa'i phyir nye bar btags nas tha mi dad par bstan to //
translated: Since it has the reason of arising from that, it is designated as non-different.

original: 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyi chos yin pa'i phyir gzhan la zhes rtogs pa nyid ma brjod do //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyi chos yin pa'i phyir gzhan la zhes rtogs pa nyid ma brjod do //
translated: Since non-error is a property of a duality, he does not say, ‚Äúfrom another,‚Äù but rather, ‚Äúfrom that.‚Äù

original: 'dir yang mi 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan de las skyes pa yin par sgrub pa na rgyu mtshan gzhan med par brjod par bsgrub pa ni rag ma las pa'i ngo bo rnams ni zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang mi 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan de las skyes pa yin par sgrub pa na rgyu mtshan gzhan med par brjod par bsgrub pa ni rag ma las pa'i ngo bo rnams ni zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Here, when proving that something arises from a cause, if one states the reason without any other reason, the proof is called ‚Äúan intrinsic nature that is not dependent on another.‚Äù

original: gang dag gi ngo bo rag las pa med pa de rnams ni de las de thob pa'i phyir gang la ngo bo rag las pa de dang lhan cig 'byung bar nges pa rag las pa de yod na yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rangüîΩbzhin gyi mi 'khrul pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag gi ngo bo rag las pa med pa de rnams ni de las de thob pa'i phyir gang la ngo bo rag las pa de dang lhan cig 'byung bar nges pa rag las pa de yod na yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi mi 'khrul pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those whose intrinsic nature is not dependent on another, since they obtain that from themselves, are ascertained to occur simultaneously with that on which their intrinsic nature depends. If that on which they depend exists, they exist.üîΩBut that intrinsic nature is not nonerroneous, because that intrinsic nature is not established from that.

original: de las de'i rang gi ngo bo grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir de med kyang yod pas na de yod na de yod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de las de'i rang gi ngo bo grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir de med kyang yod pas na de yod na de yod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba med pa yin no //
translated: Since it exists even when that does not exist, it is not the case that if that exists, it exists. Therefore they are not coexistent.

original: des na de ltar med na mi 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan de bzhin 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir gsum la tshul gsum srid pas gtan tshigs nyid bsgrubs nas da ni go rims bzhin du de dag la bsgrub bya sgrub byed kyi rang bzhin gyis khyad par bstan pa'i phyir
analyzed: des na de ltar med na mi 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan de bzhin 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir gsum la tshul gsum srid pas gtan tshigs nyid bsgrubs nas da ni go rims bzhin du de dag la bsgrub bya sgrub byed kyi rang bzhin gyis khyad par bstan pa'i phyir
translated: Having established the reason, now, in order to demonstrate the nature of the probandum and the proof in accordance with the order of the three modes,

original: gal te zhes rtsod pa slong bar byed do //
analyzed: gal te zhes rtsod pa slong bar byed do //
translated: the following is stated to raise the objection:

original: gal te ji skad bshad pa de las skyes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi phyir 'bras bu rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan go bar byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te ji skad bshad pa de las skyes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi phyir 'bras bu rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan go bar byed pa yin na /
translated: If the reason is characterized by arising from what has been explained, then the reason is the cause for understanding the probandum.

original: de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i ngo bo yin par 'gyur ro /üîΩ// / bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i ngo bo yin par 'gyur ro /üîΩ// / bam po gsum pa /
translated: In that case, all aspects would be the nature of what is to be understood and what causes understanding.

original: ji ltar du ba de'i bdag nyid de las skyes pa'i phyir du ba zhes du ba'i bdag nyid du bstan pa go bar byed pa yin pa de bzhin du gzhan yang de'i bdag nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid ji lta bar gyurüîΩpas de dag kyang go bar byed pa nyid du 'gyur te /üîΩ'di na me yod de /
analyzed: ji ltar du ba de'i bdag nyid de las skyes pa'i phyir du ba zhes du ba'i bdag nyid du bstan pa go bar byed pa yin pa de bzhin du gzhan yang de'i bdag nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid ji lta bar gyur pas de dag kyang go bar byed pa nyid du 'gyur te / 'di na me yod de /
translated: Just as smoke is taught to be the identity of smoke because it arises from that identity, and it is understood to be the identity of smoke, so too, since they are the identity of themselves by way of their own intrinsic reality, they would be just like the self.üîΩüîΩThey would also be the cause of understanding.üîΩHere fire exists because there is smoke.üîΩ

original: dngos po'i phyir ro //üîΩthogs bcas kyi phyir dang / mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde bzhin du 'di na dngos po 'am thogs bcas sam mi rtag pa yod de du ba yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'gyur na de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i phyir ro // thogs bcas kyi phyir dang / mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o // de bzhin du 'di na dngos po 'am thogs bcas sam mi rtag pa yod de du ba yod pa'i phyir ro // 'gyur na de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: Just as smoke is taught and understood to be the nature of smoke because it arises from that nature, so too, other things are understood to be the nature of smoke because they are of the same nature as smoke.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bus rgyu rjes su dpag par mi nus so //üîΩdngos po las me rtogs @23b pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bus rgyu rjes su dpag par mi nus so // dngos po las me rtogs @23b pa'am /
translated: If you say that the reason is not established, then it is not possible to infer a cause from an effect.

original: du ba las dngos po rtogs par nus pa ni ma yin te chu la sogs pa'i dngos po yod kyang me med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ba las dngos po rtogs par nus pa ni ma yin te chu la sogs pa'i dngos po yod kyang me med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, it is not possible to infer fire from an entity, or to infer an entity from smoke, because fire does not exist where there is water, and so on.

original: des na de las skyes pa ni 'khrul ba med pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag par bya ba grub par bya ba'i phyir brjod par mi bya'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na de las skyes pa ni 'khrul ba med pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag par bya ba grub par bya ba'i phyir brjod par mi bya'o snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is not erroneous, it should not be said that it is produced from that in order to establish the object of inference.

original: ci ste thams cad las bdag nyid thams cad kyis de la skyes pa nyid ma yin no zhes brjod na de ni mi rigs so zhes smras pa ni rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ste thams cad las bdag nyid thams cad kyis de la skyes pa nyid ma yin no zhes brjod na de ni mi rigs so zhes smras pa ni rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if it is said that it is not produced from everything in every way, then that is unreasonable, as stated in the verse ‚Äúin every way.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir me las dngos po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rnams las kyang du ba dngos po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can du skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir me las dngos po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rnams las kyang du ba dngos po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can du skye ba yin gyi /
translated: Because smoke is produced from things like fire with the nature of things like fire,

original: mo tsam las du ba tsam du skye ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mo tsam las du ba tsam du skye ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but not from mere fire as mere smoke.

original: re zhig 'di go bar bya ba la ltos nas spang ba'i phyir mdo'i 'brel pa gzhi 'cha' bar byed pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig 'di go bar bya ba la ltos nas spang ba'i phyir mdo'i 'brel pa gzhi 'cha' bar byed pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But this is not to establish the connection of the sutra in order to refute that, relying on what is to be understood here.

original: me'i chos gang yin pa de dag yod na du ba 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: me'i chos gang yin pa de dag yod na du ba 'byung ba'am /
translated: If those qualities of fire exist, smoke arises.

original: de med na du ba ldog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de med na du ba ldog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If that is not so, then smoke does not cease.

original: re zhig ldog par mi nus pa'i chos dngos po dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnams ni rjes su 'gro ba bkag pa nyid kyi rgyu ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: re zhig ldog par mi nus pa'i chos dngos po dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnams ni rjes su 'gro ba bkag pa nyid kyi rgyu ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: First, phenomena that cannot be reversed, such as existence and impermanence, are not causes just by the negation of concomitance.

original: 'di ltar bud shing dang bcas pa'i dngos po gzhan nam mi rtag pa yod kyang du ba mi skye'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bud shing dang bcas pa'i dngos po gzhan nam mi rtag pa yod kyang du ba mi skye'o //
translated: Thus, even when other things with fuel exist, smoke does not arise.

original: gzhan 'bar ba can dang bud shing gi khyad par las skyes pa la sogs pa rnams ni med kyang bud shing sreg par nus ba tsam yod na 'byung ba'i phyir du ba tsam gyi rgyu can ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan 'bar ba can dang bud shing gi khyad par las skyes pa la sogs pa rnams ni med kyang bud shing sreg par nus ba tsam yod na 'byung ba'i phyir du ba tsam gyi rgyu can ma yin no //
translated: But when there is mere ability to burn fuel, such as that produced by the difference of blazing and fuel, smoke arises even without the other. Therefore, smoke is not caused by mere fuel.

original: de'i phyir gang med par 'bras bu 'byung ba de las 'di skye ba'i mtshan nyid nges pa med pa'i phyir de las skyes pa'i phyir 'bras bu go bar byed pa yin pa la ji skad bshad pa'i skyon yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang med par 'bras bu 'byung ba de las 'di skye ba'i mtshan nyid nges pa med pa'i phyir de las skyes pa'i phyir 'bras bu go bar byed pa yin pa la ji skad bshad pa'i skyon yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when an effect arises without that, since there is no definite characteristic of arising from that, there is no fault as explained in the understanding of the effect by that which produces it.

original: gang gi phyir de bas na 'bras bu ni gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bas na 'bras bu ni gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effect is the reason.

original: bsgrub par bya ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the probandum?

original: bshad pa gang dag rgyu la rang bzhin rgyu'i dngos po gang yin pa de dag ji snyed cig med na mi 'byung ste de dag gis ni yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa gang dag rgyu la rang bzhin rgyu'i dngos po gang yin pa de dag ji snyed cig med na mi 'byung ste de dag gis ni yin no //
translated: The explanation is: those things that are the nature of the cause, whatever they are, are not produced without the cause.

original: 'dis ni 'bras bu'i bsgrub par bya ba'i khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'bras bu'i bsgrub par bya ba'i khyad par bstan to //
translated: This shows the difference in the probandum that is the effect.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rgyu'i dngos por rtogs pa'i rgyu'i chos gang yin pa de dag nyid 'bras bus go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rgyu'i dngos por rtogs pa'i rgyu'i chos gang yin pa de dag nyid 'bras bus go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The cause that is understood from the forward and reverse pervasion is the property of the reason that is understood from the effect.

original: des na du ba las dngos po dang mi rtag pa'am rtsva las byung ba rtog pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang me zhes bya ba ste 'di ni sreg par byed pa brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na du ba las dngos po dang mi rtag pa'am rtsva las byung ba rtog pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang me zhes bya ba ste 'di ni sreg par byed pa brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the impermanent or that which arises from grass is inferred from smoke, but rather it is fire, because that is what is expressed by the term ‚Äúburning.‚Äù

original: 'di ni 'bras bu nying kyis go bar byed pa yin la 'bras bu yang gang dag med na mi 'byung @24a * //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu nying kyis go bar byed pa yin la 'bras bu yang gang dag med na mi 'byung @24a * //
translated: This is the understanding of the effect. The effect is that which is not produced without the cause.

original: ba de dag kho na'i yin te /
analyzed: ba de dag kho na'i yin te /
translated: It is only the effect of those.

original: des na 'di ni de nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi dngos por rigs so //
analyzed: des na 'di ni de nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi dngos por rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that this is the actual evidence for that.

original: de smras pa ni gang dag med na 'bras bu mi 'byung ba de dag gi 'bras bu nyid du 'di nges pa yin te /üîΩde'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de smras pa ni gang dag med na 'bras bu mi 'byung ba de dag gi 'bras bu nyid du 'di nges pa yin te / de'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthose without which‚Äù is ascertained as the effect of those, because it is the effect of those.

original: de ltar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi bsgrub bya bstan pas rnam pa thams cad du go bar bya ba nyid du thal ba spangs nas sgrub par byed pa'i khyad par bstan pas rnam pa thams cad du go bar byed pa nyid yin pa yang spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi bsgrub bya bstan pas rnam pa thams cad du go bar bya ba nyid du thal ba spangs nas sgrub par byed pa'i khyad par bstan pas rnam pa thams cad du go bar byed pa nyid yin pa yang spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having avoided the consequence of being understood in every way by teaching the probandum of the effect evidence, in order to also avoid being understood in every way by teaching the particular of the proof,

original: gang dag ces smos so //
analyzed: gang dag ces smos so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúthose without which.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir mdor ma bstan zhe na ma bstan zhes sus smras /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mdor ma bstan zhe na ma bstan zhes sus smras /
translated: If it is asked why it is not taught in the root text, who says it is not taught?

original: 'dir rgyu yod pa la rang bzhin ji snyed cig med na mi 'byung ba'i 'bras bu ni gtan tshigs yin no zhes brjod par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rgyu yod pa la rang bzhin ji snyed cig med na mi 'byung ba'i 'bras bu ni gtan tshigs yin no zhes brjod par nus pa yin no //
translated: Here, it is possible to say that the cause that exists is the evidence, the effect that does not occur without as many essential natures as there are.

original: 'di'i rang bzhin rgyu med na mi 'byung ba gang yin pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin rgyu med na mi 'byung ba gang yin pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the nature of this is not non-arisen without a cause.

original: gzhan du na yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du na yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that it exists elsewhere,

original: dngos po la sogs pa ni me med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la sogs pa ni me med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because things and so on exist even without fire.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag gi zhes bya ba dang / de dag kho na zhes mdor 'brel par 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag gi zhes bya ba dang / de dag kho na zhes mdor 'brel par 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the Commentary itself explains the connection with ‚Äúby those‚Äù and ‚Äúonly those.‚Äù

original: mdor na 'bras bu ni zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig brjod do //
analyzed: mdor na 'bras bu ni zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig brjod do //
translated: In brief, it says only this: ‚ÄúThe effect is . . .‚Äù

original: de la go bar bya ba la ltos nas 'di dag gis zhes 'brel la /
analyzed: de la go bar bya ba la ltos nas 'di dag gis zhes 'brel la /
translated: In that case, in dependence on the object of understanding, it is connected with ‚Äúby those.‚Äù

original: go bar byed pa la ltos nas ni de kho na nas zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: go bar byed pa la ltos nas ni de kho na nas zhes 'brel to //
translated: In dependence on the agent of understanding, it is connected with ‚Äúonly those.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhung 'di ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du nye bar bkod de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhung 'di ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du nye bar bkod de /
translated: Therefore, this text is set forth in dependence.

original: 'bras bu ni de dag kho nas gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni de dag kho nas gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The effect is only those reasons.

original: rang bzhin bya ba 'di bshad pa ni chos de dag bya ba yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin bya ba 'di bshad pa ni chos de dag bya ba yin la /
translated: This explanation of the action of nature is the action of those phenomena.

original: med na mi 'byung zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni gang dag de dag med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni gang dag de dag med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúnot arising without‚Äù is ‚Äúnot arising if those do not exist.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du de med par 'byung ba ni de las skye bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de med par 'byung ba ni de las skye bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yang bshad par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, ‚Äúarising without that‚Äù means that there is no certainty that it arises from that.

original: 'dir pha rol po sngar bshad pa'i rang gi phyogs sgrub par byed par ston pa ni gal te gang dag rgyu la yod pa'i chos 'ga' zhig nyid med na mi 'byung ba 'bras bu la yod pa'i chos 'ga' zhig nyid go bar byed pa yin no zhe na
analyzed: 'dir pha rol po sngar bshad pa'i rang gi phyogs sgrub par byed par ston pa ni gal te gang dag rgyu la yod pa'i chos 'ga' zhig nyid med na mi 'byung ba 'bras bu la yod pa'i chos 'ga' zhig nyid go bar byed pa yin no zhe na
translated: Here, the opponent presents his own position, which was previously explained, saying, ‚ÄúIf a certain phenomenon that exists in the cause is not found in the effect, then a certain phenomenon that exists in the effect is not found in the cause.‚Äù

original: / cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then the effect would be produced by a part of the cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang gi tshe rgyu'i chos de dag nyid kyis 'bras bu'i chos skyed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang gi tshe rgyu'i chos de dag nyid kyis 'bras bu'i chos skyed pa de'i tshe /
translated: For that very reason, when those phenomena of the cause produce the phenomena of the effect,

original: dngos po nyid la sogs pa rgyu la gnas pa skyed par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos po nyid la sogs pa rgyu la gnas pa skyed par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: then the cause that exists in the thing itself and so on does not produce them.

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa yang bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa yang bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the one abiding in the effect would be without a cause, because it is not to be produced.

original: de lta yin dang @24b 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa'i phyir rgyu la yod pa'i chos rnams tha dad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang @24b 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa'i phyir rgyu la yod pa'i chos rnams tha dad par 'gyur la /
translated: If that were so, the attributes of the cause would be different, because the attributes of the abiding would be contradictory.

original: 'bras bu la yod pa 'ga' zhig rgyu med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu la yod pa 'ga' zhig rgyu med par 'gyur te /
translated: And some attribute of the effect would be without a cause.

original: de bas na skyon 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na skyon 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, this fault would ensue.

original: rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa yin na yang rnam pa thams cad du go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos por rnam par gnas pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa yin na yang rnam pa thams cad du go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos por rnam par gnas pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: Even if there is production in every way, there is the state of being the object of understanding and the agent of understanding in every way.

original: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: This is not to be refuted,

original: des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par dang zhes smos so //
translated: because of the distinction of what is to be produced by that.

original: 'bras bu ni chos gang zhig rgyu la yod pa'i chos gang dag med na mi 'byung ba de dag kho nas de dag kho na'i gtan tshigs yin no zhes khas blangs pa na cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa yin par thal bar
analyzed: 'bras bu ni chos gang zhig rgyu la yod pa'i chos gang dag med na mi 'byung ba de dag kho nas de dag kho na'i gtan tshigs yin no zhes khas blangs pa na cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa yin par thal bar
translated: If you accept that the effect is the reason of only those causes that are not without the effect, then it follows that the effect is produced by a part of the cause.

original: 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa 'bras bu de dag gis bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par gang yin pa de bzung na yin par 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa 'bras bu de dag gis bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par gang yin pa de bzung na yin par 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: If you accept that, then it is just as we maintain.

original: rgyu'i chos ni rnam pa gnyis te dngos po nyid la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba spyi'i chos dang / rtsva las byung ba la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba med pa khyad par gyi chos so //
analyzed: rgyu'i chos ni rnam pa gnyis te dngos po nyid la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba spyi'i chos dang / rtsva las byung ba la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba med pa khyad par gyi chos so //
translated: The properties of the cause are of two kinds: general properties, such as being an entity, and specific properties, such as arising from grass, etc.

original: de la spyi'i chos rnams rjes su dpog par thal ba ni shin tu 'gal ba ma yin te khas blang bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la spyi'i chos rnams rjes su dpog par thal ba ni shin tu 'gal ba ma yin te khas blang bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not at all contradictory to infer the general properties, but it is contradictory to infer the specific properties.

original: bye brag gi chos rnams ni khas blang bar mi mus pa nyid kyis de las skyes pa tsam la brten nas rjes su dpag par bya ba yin na 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bye brag gi chos rnams ni khas blang bar mi mus pa nyid kyis de las skyes pa tsam la brten nas rjes su dpag par bya ba yin na 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The specific properties are not accepted as being the cause, so it is not contradictory to infer the mere arising from that.üîΩHere, the response is that even though the specific properties of arising from grass, etc. are different, since smoke has other specific properties, it does not arise from those specific properties.

original: de la brjod pa ni rtsva las byung ba la sogs pa'i khyad par tha dad pa yang du ba khyad par gzhan la yod pa'i phyir khyad par de las skyes pa ma yin pa de lta na yang rgyu la yod pa'i khyad par 'bras bu'i bdag nyid la
analyzed: de la brjod pa ni rtsva las byung ba la sogs pa'i khyad par tha dad pa yang du ba khyad par gzhan la yod pa'i phyir khyad par de las skyes pa ma yin pa de lta na yang rgyu la yod pa'i khyad par 'bras bu'i bdag nyid la
translated: However, it is not possible to say that the specific properties that exist in the cause do not exist in the nature of the effect,

original: byed pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya bar ni mi nus te cha shas kyi sa skyed par byed pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya bar ni mi nus te cha shas kyi sa skyed par byed pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the cause would not produce any part of the effect.

original: des na khyad par de 'bras bu'i bdag nyid la yang khyad par tsam mo zhes 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: des na khyad par de 'bras bu'i bdag nyid la yang khyad par tsam mo zhes 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is accepted that those specific properties are mere specific properties in the nature of the effect.

original: rgyu khyad par med par 'bras bu'i khyad par yod pa'i nyes par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu khyad par med par 'bras bu'i khyad par yod pa'i nyes par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the fault of the effect having specific properties without specific causes would arise.

original: rgyu'i khyad par de yang gang gi tshe rjes su 'gro ba rtogs par gyur pa de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad du go bar bya ba yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par de yang gang gi tshe rjes su 'gro ba rtogs par gyur pa de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad du go bar bya ba yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And this particular cause is understood in every case when the concomitance is understood.

original: 'di la 'di'i dpyad pa bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la 'di'i dpyad pa bya ste /
translated: Here, this should be analyzed:

original: de lta na yang cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed par 'gyur ba ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed par 'gyur ba ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: Even so, the production of the effect by the cause is not excluded.

original: me tsam gyi bdag nyid kyis yin gyi /
analyzed: me tsam gyi bdag nyid kyis yin gyi /
translated: It is just fire that is the cause,

original: khyad par btang snyoms pa ston pa yin na der thal bar 'gyur gyi khyad par gyis kyang khyad par skyed pa la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par btang snyoms pa ston pa yin na der thal bar 'gyur gyi khyad par gyis kyang khyad par skyed pa la ni ma yin no zhe na /
