translated: but if you teach indifference to the particular, then that would follow, but not if the particular also produces the particular.

original: rma yin @25a * //üîΩte spyi nyid las spyi yin te khyad par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rma yin @25a * // te spyi nyid las spyi yin te khyad par ni ma yin no //
translated: It is a wound.üîΩIt is a universal from the universal itself, but not from the particular.

original: de ni khyad par nyid ma yin no zhes khas blangs pa na 'di khyad par spyi'i bdag nyid la btang snyoms su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni khyad par nyid ma yin no zhes khas blangs pa na 'di khyad par spyi'i bdag nyid la btang snyoms su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When it is accepted that it is not a particular itself, then this is indifference to the nature of the particular and the universal.

original: dngos po'i bdag nyid cha shas dang bcas par thal ba nyid ni 'di nyid skyon du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i bdag nyid cha shas dang bcas par thal ba nyid ni 'di nyid skyon du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The fault of having parts that is entailed by the intrinsic reality of things is this very fault.

original: de lta ma yin na khyad par gyi rang bzhin btang snyoms su gnas pa la yang skyon med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na khyad par gyi rang bzhin btang snyoms su gnas pa la yang skyon med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then even if the intrinsic nature of the distinction were to remain neutral, there would be no fault.

original: dngos po ni chos nges pa rnams bya ba'i yul tha dad pa nyid na ji ltar cha shas nyid du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po ni chos nges pa rnams bya ba'i yul tha dad pa nyid na ji ltar cha shas nyid du mi 'gyur /
translated: If things are the objects of distinct actions, how could they not have parts?

original: 'on te rtsva las byung ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gcig tu gyur pa nyid kyi ne zhi me'i rnam pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te rtsva las byung ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gcig tu gyur pa nyid kyi ne zhi me'i rnam pa yin la /
translated: But if the intrinsic nature of what arises from grass, etc. is the same, then the form of the fire is the same.

original: de bzhin du du ba'i rnam pa yang de las bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par rnam par dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du du ba'i rnam pa yang de las bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par rnam par dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: And likewise, the form of the smoke is also the same, since it is produced from that, and its intrinsic nature is not distinguished.

original: de lta bu'i rgyu de las de lta bur gyur pa de skye ba na rnam pa thams cad las rnam pa thams cad du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rgyu de las de lta bur gyur pa de skye ba na rnam pa thams cad las rnam pa thams cad du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When that which is like that cause arises in that way, it arises in every way from everything.

original: 'on kyang chos tha dad par nges pa'i rnam par rtog pas me'i cha las khyad par gyi cha tha dad par byed par zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos tha dad par nges pa'i rnam par rtog pas me'i cha las khyad par gyi cha tha dad par byed par zad do //
translated: However, the conceptual thought that ascertains the difference of phenomena merely makes a difference in the aspect of the quality from the aspect of fire.

original: des na gang gis khyad par gyi cha med kyang de ltar rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin yod na yod pa'i du ba de med par 'byung ba ni zhes khyad par gyi rgyu can yin pa sel bar 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig ni chos can gzhan la yod pa
analyzed: des na gang gis khyad par gyi cha med kyang de ltar rjes su 'gro ba'i rang bzhin yod na yod pa'i du ba de med par 'byung ba ni zhes khyad par gyi rgyu can yin pa sel bar 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig ni chos can gzhan la yod pa
translated: Therefore, if the existence of smoke, which is like that, exists even though the quality does not exist, then the reason that is the basis for the distinction, ‚ÄúIt does not occur without that,‚Äù is eliminated.

original: nyid kyi de dang gcig tu byas nas nges pas rjes su 'gro bar brjod pa yin la gzhan ni ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: nyid kyi de dang gcig tu byas nas nges pas rjes su 'gro bar brjod pa yin la gzhan ni ldog pa yin no //
translated: Some say that the existence of that is ascertained by making it one with another subject, and it is said to be pervasion, while the other is the counter pervasion.

original: dngos po la ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid gnyis po de rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa gzhan dag las gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir mi 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid las skye bas na cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byedüîΩpa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid gnyis po de rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa gzhan dag las gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir mi 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid las skye bas na cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byedüîΩpa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In things, those two, the cause and the effect, are different from other causes and effects, because they are produced from a different characteristic. Therefore, since they are produced from a different characteristic, the produced and the producer do not exist by part.

original: de bzhin du spyi dang khyad par gyi chos gzhan dag la yang brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du spyi dang khyad par gyi chos gzhan dag la yang brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: So too, it should be said of other general and specific qualities.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: That also is not correct,

original: ma yin te de med par 'byung ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung mi brjod par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te de med par 'byung ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung mi brjod par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the text ‚Äúthat which arises without it‚Äù would not be stated.

original: de bzhin du gtan tshigs thigs pa'i rdza mkhan las ni 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du gtan tshigs thigs pa'i rdza mkhan las ni 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin /
translated: So too, it is not tenable to say that in the Tattva·π≠ƒ´kƒÅ, ‚Äúthe shape is not the intrinsic reality of the clay,

original: 'jim pa las ni dbyibs kyi khyad par ma yin zhes bya ba yang mi 'thad par 'gyur te 'jim pa dang rdza mkhan gnyis ka las 'jim pa dang dbyibs kyi khyad par cha med pa'i dngos po 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jim pa las ni dbyibs kyi khyad par ma yin zhes bya ba yang mi 'thad par 'gyur te 'jim pa dang rdza mkhan gnyis ka las 'jim pa dang dbyibs kyi khyad par cha med pa'i dngos po 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and the clay is not the particular shape,‚Äù because a partless entity arises from both the clay and the potter.

original: de la 'di ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis gcig las kyang 'byung la gzhan las kyang 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'di ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis gcig las kyang 'byung la gzhan las kyang 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Here, it is not that it arises from one by its entire nature and from another by its entire nature.

original: des na 'di ni rdza mkhan las kyang 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid yin @25b la ;
analyzed: des na 'di ni rdza mkhan las kyang 'jim pa'i ngo bo nyid yin @25b la ;
translated: Therefore, it is the intrinsic reality of the clay from the potter,üîΩand it is the particular shape from the clay.

original: 'jim pa las kyang dbyibs kyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: 'jim pa las kyang dbyibs kyi khyad par yin no //
translated: and from the clay, the specific shape.

original: rdza mkhan ma yin pa'i skyes bu dang 'jim pa dang bskyed par bya ba so phag la sogs pa gang yin pa de yang mi 'dra ba nyid mi 'dra ba'i tshogs pas bskyed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rdza mkhan ma yin pa'i skyes bu dang 'jim pa dang bskyed par bya ba so phag la sogs pa gang yin pa de yang mi 'dra ba nyid mi 'dra ba'i tshogs pas bskyed pa yin gyi /
translated: The clay, the potter, and the bricks, etc., which are not the product of a potter, are also produced by a collection of heterogeneous causes.

original: der 'jim pa yod kyang rdza mkhan med pa'i phyir bum pa'i dbyibs med pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir rdza mkhan de rgyu nyid do zhes bya bar nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der 'jim pa yod kyang rdza mkhan med pa'i phyir bum pa'i dbyibs med pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir rdza mkhan de rgyu nyid do zhes bya bar nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: But since the clay exists there, even though the potter does not exist, the shape of the pot is not absent. Thus, the potter is the cause.

original: lhan cig byed pa mi 'dra ba dang ldan pa'i 'jim pa dang rdza mkhan dag 'bras bu mi 'dra bar byed pa'i phyir cha shas kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa mi 'dra ba dang ldan pa'i 'jim pa dang rdza mkhan dag 'bras bu mi 'dra bar byed pa'i phyir cha shas kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: The clay and the potter, which are endowed with heterogeneous cooperative conditions, produce a heterogeneous effect. Thus, the existence and non-existence of the parts are not ascertained by the method of agreement and difference.

original: rnam par rtog pas nye bar btags pa'i chos rjes su 'gro ba la brten pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la brten nas de skad bshad pa yin no zhe na ma yin te btags pa la brten pa ni ldog pa'i rten ma yin pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas nye bar btags pa'i chos rjes su 'gro ba la brten pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la brten nas de skad bshad pa yin no zhe na ma yin te btags pa la brten pa ni ldog pa'i rten ma yin pa'i phyir ro
translated: If you say that it is explained in that way based on the forward and reverse pervasion of the property of the subject that is imputed by thought, that is not so, because that which is based on imputation is not the basis of the reverse pervasion.

original: // de bzhin du mig kyang mig la sogs pa'i tshogs pa khyad par can las skye la /
analyzed: // de bzhin du mig kyang mig la sogs pa'i tshogs pa khyad par can las skye la /
translated: Similarly, the eye is produced from a special collection of the eye and so on.

original: bde ba la sogs pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir /üîΩde dang de min dngos rang bzhin //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir / de dang de min dngos rang bzhin //
translated: But it is not pleasure and so on.

original: zhes mi brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes mi brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it is not said that the eye and so on is the nature of the thing that is and is not that.

original: mig la sogs pa yang shes pa'i rang bzhin du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa yang shes pa'i rang bzhin du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And it follows that the eye and so on would be by nature consciousness.

original: ji ltar rtogs bzhin pa'i rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su 'brangs na ni mig tshogs pa de med kyang sngar yang yod pa'i phyir tshogs pa de'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin pas bde ba la sogs pa dang rgyu mi mtshungs pa nyid kyis de dang 'dra bar
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs bzhin pa'i rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su 'brangs na ni mig tshogs pa de med kyang sngar yang yod pa'i phyir tshogs pa de'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin pas bde ba la sogs pa dang rgyu mi mtshungs pa nyid kyis de dang 'dra bar
translated: If you follow the forward and reverse pervasions as they are realized, then because the eye exists even when that collection does not exist, it is not a reason for that collection. Therefore it is not similar to pleasure and so on.

original: shes pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It does not follow that it is consciousness.

original: gang gi tshe khyad par gyi rten pa nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'brang ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyad par gyi rten pa nyid kyis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'brang ba de'i tshe /
translated: When it is the basis of the distinction, it is the cause of the occurrence and cessation of the effect.

original: de phyis mi 'byung ba'i phyir du ba la sogs pa me la sogs pa'i tshogs pas bskyed par bya bar nges pa don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de phyis mi 'byung ba'i phyir du ba la sogs pa me la sogs pa'i tshogs pas bskyed par bya bar nges pa don med pa nyid do //
translated: Then, since it does not occur later, it is meaningless to say that smoke, etc. are definitely produced by the collection of fire, etc.

original: 'on te gcig du ba yin pa nyid na gzhan yang du ba yin pa'i phyir du ba la brten nas nges par brten pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gcig du ba yin pa nyid na gzhan yang du ba yin pa'i phyir du ba la brten nas nges par brten pa yin zhe na /
translated: But if smoke is one thing and fire is another, then smoke is based on fire because it is different from it.

original: da ni du ba gzhan me la yod pa'i khyad par las nges pa ma yin te de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni du ba gzhan me la yod pa'i khyad par las nges pa ma yin te de med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Now, smoke is not based on fire because it is different from it, since it exists even when fire does not exist.

original: des na du ba khyad par gyi rgyu can du ji ltar 'gyur de bzhin du me las ni du ba gzhan 'byung la /
analyzed: des na du ba khyad par gyi rgyu can du ji ltar 'gyur de bzhin du me las ni du ba gzhan 'byung la /
translated: How then could smoke be the cause of the distinction? In the same way, smoke arises from fire,

original: brgya byin gyi spyi bo las du ba rnam pa gzhan 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brgya byin gyi spyi bo las du ba rnam pa gzhan 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: but another kind of smoke arises from the head of Indra.

original: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa 'am cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa 'di brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa 'am cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa 'di brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is to be said that the effect is not produced by the presence or absence of the cause, or by a part of it.

original: 'di la brjod pa 'di du ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi don @26a * //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa 'di du ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi don @26a * //
translated: Here, this is said:üîΩThe effect, smoke, etc.,

original: lan cig kyang rgyu nye bar gnas pa rtsa bar gyur pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo thob par byed pa na du ba la sogs pa thams cad de lta bu'i rgyu can nyid du nges par byed do //
analyzed: lan cig kyang rgyu nye bar gnas pa rtsa bar gyur pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo thob par byed pa na du ba la sogs pa thams cad de lta bu'i rgyu can nyid du nges par byed do //
translated: having obtained its own nature by the mere presence of the cause, is ascertained as having such a cause.

original: gcig cig de med par 'byung na yang lan cig kyang de ltar gyur par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig cig de med par 'byung na yang lan cig kyang de ltar gyur par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if one were to occur without it, it would not be established as having occurred in that way even once.

original: des na 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pa la ltos nas du ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid gcig cig kyang me'i khyad par med par 'byung ba yin na du ba me'i khyad par gyi rgyu can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pa la ltos nas du ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid gcig cig kyang me'i khyad par med par 'byung ba yin na du ba me'i khyad par gyi rgyu can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in dependence on the reasoning to be explained, if the identity of smoke were to occur without the particular of fire, then smoke would not be the effect of the particular of fire.

original: 'on te yang cha shas kyis skyed par byed pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'on te yang cha shas kyis skyed par byed pa nyid yin na /
translated: But if it is the case that it generates by means of a part,

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: that is not so either.

original: gang gi phyir gang gis spyi'i cha ni der nus pa yin la khyad par gyi cha ma yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba'i chos gnas par 'gyur ba me'i spyi'i cha khyad par gyi cha las tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang gis spyi'i cha ni der nus pa yin la khyad par gyi cha ma yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba'i chos gnas par 'gyur ba me'i spyi'i cha khyad par gyi cha las tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the general part is capable of that, but the particular part is not, so the contradictory property would be established. The general part of fire is not different from the particular part,

original: rtsva las byung ba nyid dang me nyid gnyis phan tshun khyad par med pa'i phyir te snang ba tha dad par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsva las byung ba nyid dang me nyid gnyis phan tshun khyad par med pa'i phyir te snang ba tha dad par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the arising from grass and fire are not mutually different, because the appearance is not established as different.

original: des na rtsva las byung ba dang me cha med pa'i bdag nyid kyis rtsva las byung ba'i du ba cha med par skyed par byed do //
analyzed: des na rtsva las byung ba dang me cha med pa'i bdag nyid kyis rtsva las byung ba'i du ba cha med par skyed par byed do //
translated: Therefore, arising from grass and fire, by means of an indivisible nature, generates indivisible smoke arising from grass.

original: de bzhin du lo ma las byung ba las kyang lo ma las byung ba'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kho na las rang gi mtshan nyid 'byung ba na gang gis 'dir cha rnams chos 'gal ba la gnas pa'i phyir tha dad par 'gyur ba cha shas kyis skyed
analyzed: de bzhin du lo ma las byung ba las kyang lo ma las byung ba'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kho na las rang gi mtshan nyid 'byung ba na gang gis 'dir cha rnams chos 'gal ba la gnas pa'i phyir tha dad par 'gyur ba cha shas kyis skyed
translated: So too, smoke arises from leaves because it arises from leaves, and thus it arises from its own characteristics alone.

original: par byed pa nyid du ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: par byed pa nyid du ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could it be that it is generated by its parts, since the parts are different due to abiding in contradictory attributes?

original: bsam pa 'di nyid kyis na des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par bzung na zhes bshad pa yin te rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po yod na de lta bur gyur pa yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam pa 'di nyid kyis na des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par bzung na zhes bshad pa yin te rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po yod na de lta bur gyur pa yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This very thought is explained in the line ‚ÄúIf it is apprehended as different from that which generates it,‚Äù which means that if such an entity exists, then something that is such exists.

original: ji ltar rtsva'i bud shing du bskyed pa na sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa myu gu skyed pa de bzhin du lo ma'i bud shing las kyang des bskyed ba'i du ba skyed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar rtsva'i bud shing du bskyed pa na sa bon la sogs pa tshogs pa myu gu skyed pa de bzhin du lo ma'i bud shing las kyang des bskyed ba'i du ba skyed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: When fuel is generated from grass, a seed and so on generates a sprout. In the same way, smoke generated from leaf fuel is not generated by that.

original: 'on kyang du ba de de las skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang du ba de de las skye ba yin no //
translated: However, that smoke is generated from that.

original: de ji lta ba nyid kyang ma yin gyi 'on kyang khyad par gzhan dang ldan pa'i tshogs pa las khyad par gzhan dang ldan pa'i du ba nyid skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ji lta ba nyid kyang ma yin gyi 'on kyang khyad par gzhan dang ldan pa'i tshogs pa las khyad par gzhan dang ldan pa'i du ba nyid skye ba yin no //
translated: It is not just that, but rather smoke possessing a different attribute arises from a collection possessing a different attribute.

original: des na 'dir khyad par du byed pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa zhes brtsal bas na /
analyzed: des na 'dir khyad par du byed pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa zhes brtsal bas na /
translated: Therefore, when it is asked here, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature that is specified?‚Äù

original: bud shing khyad par du byed pa yin par brjod do //
analyzed: bud shing khyad par du byed pa yin par brjod do //
translated: Fuel is said to be the specified attribute.

original: tshogs pa der bud shing nyid khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa der bud shing nyid khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because fuel is the specified attribute in that collection.

original: des na du ba tsam la ltos te bud shing gi khyad par sbyor bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na du ba tsam la ltos te bud shing gi khyad par sbyor bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not that fuel is applied as the specified attribute in dependence on just smoke,

original: des med par 'byung ba ni de las skye bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes med kyang 'byung bar bshad do//
analyzed: des med par 'byung ba ni de las skye bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes med kyang 'byung bar bshad do//
translated: because that which arises without it is not ascertained to arise from it. Thus it is explained that it arises even without it.

original: @26b de bzhin du 'bar ba la sogs pa'i khyad par dag kyang nges par bya'o //
analyzed: @26b de bzhin du 'bar ba la sogs pa'i khyad par dag kyang nges par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the attributes of blazing and so on should be ascertained.

original: de tsam gyis skyed par byed pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te thams cad las khyad par thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis skyed par byed pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te thams cad las khyad par thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not that it is not a producer merely by that, because all particularities would arise from all.

original: gal te thams cad las khyad par thams cad skye na tshogs pa de dang de dag tu phan tshun tha dad pa'i rang bzhin cha med pa'i du ba nyid cha med pa'i me las skye ste des na khyad par de med kyang tshogs pa gzhan la du ba
analyzed: gal te thams cad las khyad par thams cad skye na tshogs pa de dang de dag tu phan tshun tha dad pa'i rang bzhin cha med pa'i du ba nyid cha med pa'i me las skye ste des na khyad par de med kyang tshogs pa gzhan la du ba
translated: If all particularities arise from all, then the particularity of smoke, which is a partless nature that is different from that collection, would arise from a partless fire. Therefore, even though that particularity does not exist, smoke would exist in another collection.

original: yod pas de med kyang yod pa'i phyir rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dang / me yod kyang du ba bzhin du khyad par de mi skye ba'i phyir de des bskyed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yod pas de med kyang yod pa'i phyir rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir dang / me yod kyang du ba bzhin du khyad par de mi skye ba'i phyir de des bskyed pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But since it does not exist, it is not a cause because it does not exist even though it exists. And because that particularity does not arise from that, even though fire exists, like smoke, it is not produced by that.

original: sreg pa'i nus pa tsam las ni du ba tsam skye la /
analyzed: sreg pa'i nus pa tsam las ni du ba tsam skye la /
translated: From the mere capacity to burn, mere smoke arises.üîΩFrom a particularity, a particularity arises.

original: khyad par las ni khyad par yin no zhes de ltar rnam par phye bas ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par las ni khyad par yin no zhes de ltar rnam par phye bas ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it be that way by making such a distinction?

original: brjod pa'i tshogs pa gzhan la ltos nas rnam par phye ba yin gyi dngos po de ni rnam par dbye ba'i rten ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa'i tshogs pa gzhan la ltos nas rnam par phye ba yin gyi dngos po de ni rnam par dbye ba'i rten ma yin no //
translated: It is distinguished in relation to other collections of words, but that entity is not the basis of the distinction.

original: khyad par med kyang tshogs pa gzhan la yod pa'i phyir khyad par de rgyu ma yin pa'i rtag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: khyad par med kyang tshogs pa gzhan la yod pa'i phyir khyad par de rgyu ma yin pa'i rtag pa yin gyi /
translated: Even though there is no difference, because it exists in another collection, that difference is not the cause of the entity.

original: dngos po de nyid la ni chos 'ga' zhig chos 'ga' la btang snyoms par rten pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: dngos po de nyid la ni chos 'ga' zhig chos 'ga' la btang snyoms par rten pa mi 'thad do //
translated: It is permanent. But it is not tenable that any entity is indifferent to any other entity.

original: gal te de lta na rtsva las byung ba'i bdag nyid khyad par yin yang der du ba'i rgyu nyid du grub pas gzhan du ji ltar yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na rtsva las byung ba'i bdag nyid khyad par yin yang der du ba'i rgyu nyid du grub pas gzhan du ji ltar yod ce na /
translated: If that is so, even though the nature of the grass is different, since it is established as the cause of smoke, how could it exist elsewhere?

original: 'di la bshad zin te dngos po la chos rnams phan tshun khyad par med pa'i phyir 'di ni 'di la'o zhes rnam par dbye ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la bshad zin te dngos po la chos rnams phan tshun khyad par med pa'i phyir 'di ni 'di la'o zhes rnam par dbye ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This has already been explained: because entities and attributes are not mutually different, it is not established that this is that.

original: 'on kyang bsal ba tha dad ba dag la de'i rgyur gyur ba'i tshogs pa rnams kyi tha dad pa'i rgyu rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rtogs nas khyad par de dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu sgrub par byed pa'i don du gnyer ba de lta bu'i
analyzed: 'on kyang bsal ba tha dad ba dag la de'i rgyur gyur ba'i tshogs pa rnams kyi tha dad pa'i rgyu rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rtogs nas khyad par de dang ldan pa'i 'bras bu sgrub par byed pa'i don du gnyer ba de lta bu'i
translated: However, in the case of distinct effects, one observes that the collection of causes that is the cause of those effects is distinct, and one infers that the effect that possesses that distinct feature is produced.

original: rgyu 'dzin pa'am khyad par can gyi 'bras bu dmigs pa las khyad par can gyi rgyu rjes su dpog pa la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu 'dzin pa'am khyad par can gyi 'bras bu dmigs pa las khyad par can gyi rgyu rjes su dpog pa la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Thus one apprehends the cause or observes the special effect and infers the special cause.

original: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i rjes su song ba'i rnam par dbye ba la ltos nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i rjes su song ba'i rnam par dbye ba la ltos nas ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not that the effect is dependent on the distinct features of its causes,

original: de med par 'gyur ba ni de las skye bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod la /
analyzed: de med par 'gyur ba ni de las skye bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod la /
translated: because if the effect does not exist, it is not ascertained that it arises from those causes.

original: cha med pa nyid cha med pa las skye ba las bsams nas ni bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par bzung nas bshad de /
analyzed: cha med pa nyid cha med pa las skye ba las bsams nas ni bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par bzung nas bshad de /
translated: The explanation that holds that the effect is distinct from the cause is stated with the intention that partless causes give rise to partless effects.

original: de bzhin du rdza mkhan las dbyibs kyi khyad par skye ba yang nges par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdza mkhan las dbyibs kyi khyad par skye ba yang nges par bya'o //
translated: So too, one should ascertain that the shape of the potter arises from the shape of the wheel.

original: mig la sogs pa shes pa skyed pa'i tshogs pa tsam la brten nas 'byung ba ma yin no zhes ni gzhan du bstan zin to //üîΩda ni 'bras bu rgyu med na mi 'byung ba'i chos dag kho nas go bar byed par @27a * //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa shes pa skyed pa'i tshogs pa tsam la brten nas 'byung ba ma yin no zhes ni gzhan du bstan zin to // da ni 'bras bu rgyu med na mi 'byung ba'i chos dag kho nas go bar byed par @27a * //
translated: It has been explained elsewhere that the eye, etc. do not arise in dependence on the mere assemblage that produces consciousness.üîΩNow, in the case of the explanation that effects are understood only by those things that are invariably concomitant with them,

original: bshad pa gang yin pa der yang cha shas kyis skye bar thal ba spong ba'i phyir rtags kyi bye brag gi khyad par can gyi spyi rnams bzung na yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: bshad pa gang yin pa der yang cha shas kyis skye bar thal ba spong ba'i phyir rtags kyi bye brag gi khyad par can gyi spyi rnams bzung na yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúbecause it is accepted that the universals that are qualified by the particulars of the reason are apprehended.‚Äù

original: go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po'i skabs yin pas /
analyzed: go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po'i skabs yin pas /
translated: This is because the context is the relation of the understood and the understander.

original: de nyid des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par dang ; ji skad bshad pa'i spyi rnams bzung na yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par dang ; ji skad bshad pa'i spyi rnams bzung na yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is accepted that the universals that are explained above are apprehended by the particulars that are produced by them.

original: rtags kyi spyi dngos po nyid dang / skye bo nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag kyang rtags kyi bye brag gi khyad par bzung nas te /
analyzed: rtags kyi spyi dngos po nyid dang / skye bo nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag kyang rtags kyi bye brag gi khyad par bzung nas te /
translated: The universal of the sign, the mere thing, the mere person, and so on, are also asserted to be the real referent of the reason, when they are apprehended as the particular of the sign.

original: khyad par can gyi rtags kyi khyad par rnams rtogs na gtan tshigs kyi dngos por 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi rtags kyi khyad par rnams rtogs na gtan tshigs kyi dngos por 'dod pa yin no //
translated: When the particular of the sign is understood, it is asserted to be the real referent of the reason.

original: 'di dag ni rtags kyi khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rtags kyi khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
translated: These are the particular of the sign,

original: rtags kyi bdag nyid kyis na rtags bzhin du de dag kyang khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags kyi bdag nyid kyis na rtags bzhin du de dag kyang khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are particularities like the sign itself, since they are the nature of the sign.

original: du ba la yod pa'i dngos po nyid ni bum pa la yod pa'i dngos po nyid las tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: du ba la yod pa'i dngos po nyid ni bum pa la yod pa'i dngos po nyid las tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The mere thing that exists in smoke is different from the mere thing that exists in a pot,

original: des na du ba la yod pa 'di bum pa la yod pa dang mi 'dra bar bzung na me bsgrub par rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na du ba la yod pa 'di bum pa la yod pa dang mi 'dra bar bzung na me bsgrub par rigs pa nyid do //
translated: so if one apprehends the mere thing that exists in smoke as different from the mere thing that exists in a pot, it is reasonable to establish fire.

original: gal te me med par yang 'byung ba'i dngos po nyid ji ltar me'i rgyu can du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te me med par yang 'byung ba'i dngos po nyid ji ltar me'i rgyu can du 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúHow could the mere thing that exists even without fire become the cause of fire?

original: dngos po nyid gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po nyid gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the mere thing is different,‚Äù

original: me ma yin pa las byung ba'i du ba yang gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: me ma yin pa las byung ba'i du ba yang gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir mtshungs par thal bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: It follows that smoke arising from something that is not fire is also similar, because it is different.

original: / mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not similar.

original: gang gi phyir 'ga' zhig gis 'khrul pa dang / mi 'khrul bar 'gyur ba dngos po nyid ces bya ba ni 'bras bu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'ga' zhig gis 'khrul pa dang / mi 'khrul bar 'gyur ba dngos po nyid ces bya ba ni 'bras bu ma yin gyi /
translated: Because of that, some say that the nature of things is called ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù and ‚Äúerroneous.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'o //
translated: However, it is only their own characteristics.

original: de yang du ba yin zhes dbang phyug sel ba dag gis bstan to //
analyzed: de yang du ba yin zhes dbang phyug sel ba dag gis bstan to //
translated: That is also taught by the refuters of ƒ™≈õvara, who say, ‚ÄúIt is smoke.‚Äù

original: khyad par la ltos par ni spyi tsam sgrub byed ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par la ltos par ni spyi tsam sgrub byed ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation that a mere generality is not established in dependence on a particular is:

original: spyi khyad par du ma byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no /
analyzed: spyi khyad par du ma byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no /
translated: ‚ÄúA generality that is not specified.‚Äù

original: rgyu gang zhig bsgrub par bya ba des ni rang gi 'bras bu la spyi'i chos khyad par gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa rnams nyid kyi rang bzhin bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gang zhig bsgrub par bya ba des ni rang gi 'bras bu la spyi'i chos khyad par gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa rnams nyid kyi rang bzhin bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: Whatever cause is to be established, that establishes its own effect, the generality that is the nature of the particular.

original: des na de lta bur gyur pa de dag gi sgrub par byed pa yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na de lta bur gyur pa de dag gi sgrub par byed pa yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, that which is such is the proof.

original: rgyus byas pa'i khyad par la ma brten par 'bras bu gzhan la yod pa'i rang bzhin la brten nas /
analyzed: rgyus byas pa'i khyad par la ma brten par 'bras bu gzhan la yod pa'i rang bzhin la brten nas /
translated: If a reason is posited in dependence on a nature that exists in another effect without depending on a difference that is produced by a cause,

original: gtan tshigs su byas na ni 'khrul pa nyid kyi phyir na de dag gtan tshigs su 'dod do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs su byas na ni 'khrul pa nyid kyi phyir na de dag gtan tshigs su 'dod do //
translated: then because it is mistaken, it is not asserted as a reason.

original: des na de ltar de'i rang bzhin de las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes 'brel pa bstan pa nyid kyis rang bzhin rtogs pa'i @27b 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi bsgrub par bya ba'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na de ltar de'i rang bzhin de las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes 'brel pa bstan pa nyid kyis rang bzhin rtogs pa'i @27b 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi bsgrub par bya ba'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in that way, because it arises from that nature, the statement of the relation itself teaches the difference of the probandum of the reason that is the effect of realizing the nature.

original: gal te de las skyes pa'i phyir zhes rgol ba bkod pa sngon du 'gro bas bshad nas /
analyzed: gal te de las skyes pa'i phyir zhes rgol ba bkod pa sngon du 'gro bas bshad nas /
translated: If it is argued that ‚Äúit is because it arises from that,‚Äù then after the statement of the objection is stated,

original: da ni de ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin nyid bshad kyang bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir rang bzhin yod tsam dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: da ni de ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin nyid bshad kyang bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir rang bzhin yod tsam dang zhes smos so //
translated: Now, it is said that ‚Äúbecause it is of that nature,‚Äù the nature of a reason is explained. However, in order to indicate the probandum, it says ‚Äúmere existence of the nature.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin de rang gi ngo bo nyid la dngos po gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin de rang gi ngo bo nyid la dngos po gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: That nature is a reason that is an existent entity in relation to its own nature.

original: rang bzhin de yang yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin de yang yod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, that nature is related to mere existence.

original: yod tsam nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: yod tsam nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: It is engaged in mere existence.

original: gang zhig yod pa'i zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig yod pa'i zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat exists?‚Äù

original: skabs kyi dngos po nyid yod pa'i zhes bya bar rtogs so //
analyzed: skabs kyi dngos po nyid yod pa'i zhes bya bar rtogs so //
translated: It is understood that ‚Äúthe existent entity of the context‚Äù exists.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te gang zhig dngos po yod pa tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa de lta bu'i rang gi bdag nyid la dngos po gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te gang zhig dngos po yod pa tsam gyi rjes su 'jug pa de lta bu'i rang gi bdag nyid la dngos po gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: That nature is a reason that is an existent entity in relation to its own nature, which is engaged in mere existence of an entity.

original: dngos po ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de yod pa ni rang gi bdag nyid med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te yod na gdon mi za bar de'i rang bzhin yod par 'gyur ro zhes nges bas na dngos po yod na rang bzhin yod pa yin no
analyzed: dngos po ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de yod pa ni rang gi bdag nyid med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir te yod na gdon mi za bar de'i rang bzhin yod par 'gyur ro zhes nges bas na dngos po yod na rang bzhin yod pa yin no
translated: Because a thing is its essence, if it exists, it is not nonexistent by its own nature, because if it exists, it is without doubt that its essence exists.

original: // gal te 'di lta bu'i don 'di ni rang bzhin 'brel pa brjod pa nyid kyis nges pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: // gal te 'di lta bu'i don 'di ni rang bzhin 'brel pa brjod pa nyid kyis nges pa ma yin nam /
translated: If you think that the meaning of this is not ascertained by the mere statement of the relation of essence,

original: des na 'di nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa des na 'di brjod pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'di nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa des na 'di brjod pas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: then since it is to be established, what is the point of stating it?

original: de ni bden te /
analyzed: de ni bden te /
translated: That is true,

original: de nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs kyi de'i bdag nyid ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs kyi de'i bdag nyid ni zhes smos so //
translated: but for that very reason, the reason is stated as ‚Äúbecause of being its essence.‚Äù

original: 'di'i rang bzhin 'brel pa ni rnam pa 'di lta bu'i dngos po la yin par rigs pa de'i phyir de nyid bsgrub par bya bar 'thad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin 'brel pa ni rnam pa 'di lta bu'i dngos po la yin par rigs pa de'i phyir de nyid bsgrub par bya bar 'thad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the relation of essence is appropriate in this way for a thing, it is tenable that it is to be established.

original: gal te de lta na 'o na ci'i don du 'di bkod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'o na ci'i don du 'di bkod ce na /
translated: If that is so, then for what purpose is it stated?

original: gzhan la rag las pa'i ni ma yin te zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pa'i ni ma yin te zhes smos so //
translated: But it is not dependent on another.

original: de ltar rnam pa thams cad du go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa nyid du 'gyur bar smra ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin bstan pas bsal ba de bzhin du de'i bdag nyid bstan pas de dang 'gal ba go bar byed par brjod pa bkagüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa thams cad du go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa nyid du 'gyur bar smra ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin bstan pas bsal ba de bzhin du de'i bdag nyid bstan pas de dang 'gal ba go bar byed par brjod pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the assertion that the object and subject of perception are in a relation of the perceived and the perceiver in every respect is refuted by the teaching of the nature of cause and effect. In the same way, the teaching of identity is said to refute the contradiction with that.

original: des na gang dag gzhan la rag las pa'i phyir des stong yang ngo bo yod pas de'i bdag nyid du ma grub kyang go bar byed pa nyid du smra ba de dag 'di ltar bsal bar bya ba yin te 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan par smra ba rnams
analyzed: des na gang dag gzhan la rag las pa'i phyir des stong yang ngo bo yod pas de'i bdag nyid du ma grub kyang go bar byed pa nyid du smra ba de dag 'di ltar bsal bar bya ba yin te 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan par smra ba rnams
translated: Therefore, those who say that the object is the perceiver because it is dependent on another, although it is empty of that, and because of the existence of its own nature, although it is not established as having that nature, are refuted in the following way: Just as those who say that destruction has a cause

original: kyis byas pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: kyis byas pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: say that it is produced.

original: mi rtag pa nyid de phyis 'byung na yod kyang de'i rang bzhin ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid de phyis 'byung na yod kyang de'i rang bzhin ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If impermanence occurs later, although it exists, it would not be the nature of that.

original: des na de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'di byas pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba ma @28a * //
analyzed: des na de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'di byas pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba ma @28a * //
translated: Therefore, since it is not of the nature of that, it is not to be established by the probandum.

original: yin no // des na gzhan la rag las pa yin na de'i bdag nyid med par 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan tshigs nyid du mi rigs pa na /
analyzed: yin no // des na gzhan la rag las pa yin na de'i bdag nyid med par 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan tshigs nyid du mi rigs pa na /
translated: Therefore, if it is dependent on another, it would not be of the nature of that, and so it is not reasonable as a logical reason.

original: rang bzhin 'brel pa'i rten nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel pa'i rten nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the relation is to be established as the basis.

original: de ltar smra ba ni de'i bdag nyid las byas pa go bar byed pa smra ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar smra ba ni de'i bdag nyid las byas pa go bar byed pa smra ba ni ma yin te /
translated: One who speaks thus does not speak of understanding the nature of that from the probandum.

original: de'i phyir de ji ltar de med pa nyid kyis 'di bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa dgag ces dogs na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ji ltar de med pa nyid kyis 'di bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin pa dgag ces dogs na /
translated: Therefore, how can that be negated as the probandum by the absence of that?

original: byas pa nyid yod pa na 'di med na go bar byed pa nyid du mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir de yod na yod par ma gyur pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: byas pa nyid yod pa na 'di med na go bar byed pa nyid du mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir de yod na yod par ma gyur pa'i zhes smos so //
translated: In order to show that if the probandum exists, it is not reasonable to understand it as the absence of that, he says, ‚ÄúIf it exists, it would not be nonexistent.‚Äù

original: byas pa nyid la sogs pa de la go bar byed pa nyid du 'dod pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de yod na /
analyzed: byas pa nyid la sogs pa de la go bar byed pa nyid du 'dod pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de yod na /
translated: If the nature that is asserted to be the understanding of the probandum, such as being produced, exists,

original: gzhan la rag las pa'i phyir yod par ma gyur pa'i phyis 'byung ba la ni nges pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pa'i phyir yod par ma gyur pa'i phyis 'byung ba la ni nges pa med do //
translated: But when the effect is not yet existent, because it depends on something else, it is not certain that it will occur later.

original: gtan tshigs ni de yod na de gdon mi za bar yod pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba nges par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni de yod na de gdon mi za bar yod pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba nges par byed pa yin no //
translated: The reason is that when it exists, the probandum is ascertained because it is invariably concomitant with it.

original: de gang gi tshe gtan tshigs yod kyang yod par ma gyur na /
analyzed: de gang gi tshe gtan tshigs yod kyang yod par ma gyur na /
translated: But when the reason exists, the probandum is not yet existent.

original: 'o na 'dis nges par gang la brten nas phyis 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na 'dis nges par gang la brten nas phyis 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Then, in dependence on what will it occur later?

original: de ni de re zhig de med par yod par 'gyur te de'i tshe bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni de re zhig de med par yod par 'gyur te de'i tshe bzhin no //
translated: It would exist without it, just as it does when it does not yet exist.üîΩTherefore, it is not certain that it exists, because it does not occur later as it did before.üîΩBut if it is not certain that it exists, then it is not certain that it will occur later.

original: des na de yang yod la phyis kyang sngar bzhin mi 'byung ba'i phyir 'di nges pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na de yang yod la phyis kyang sngar bzhin mi 'byung ba'i phyir 'di nges pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: But if it is not certain that it exists, then it is not certain that it will occur later.üîΩBut if it is not certain that it exists, then it is not certain that it will occur later.üîΩBut if it is not certain that it exists, then it is not certain that it will occur later.üîΩBut if it is not certain that it exists, then it is not certain that it will occur later.üîΩBut if it is not certain that it exists, then it is not certain that it will occur later.üîΩBut if it is not certain that it exists, then it is not certain that it will occur later.üîΩBut if it is not certain that it exists, then it is not certain that it will occur later.üîΩBut if it is not certain that it exists, then it is not certain that it will occur later.üîΩBut if it is not certain that it exists, then it is not certain that it will occur later.üîΩBut if it is not certain that it exists, then it is not certain that it will occur later.üîΩBut if it is not certain that it exists, then it is not certain that it will occur later.üîΩBut if it is not certain that it exists, then it is not certain that it will occur later.üîΩBut if it is not certain that it exists, then it is not certain that it will occur later.üîΩBut if it is not certain that it exists, then it is not certain that it will occur later.üîΩBut if it is not certain that it exists, then it is not certain that it will occur later.

original: 'o na yod par 'gyur ba yang dgag pa med pa nyid do zhe na med mod /üîΩnges pa med na rjes su dpag pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir the tshom nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na yod par 'gyur ba yang dgag pa med pa nyid do zhe na med mod /üîΩnges pa med na rjes su dpag pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir the tshom nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is not certain that it exists, then it is not certain that it will occur later.üîΩBut if it is not certain that it exists, then it is not certain that it will occur later

original: gzhan yang gang la rag las nas 'di yod par 'gyur ba de nyid las yod pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang la rag las nas 'di yod par 'gyur ba de nyid las yod pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, since that which exists in dependence on something else does not arise from that very thing,

original: de ji ltar phyis kyang yod par 'gyur zhes bshad pa ni rgyu rnams ni zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ji ltar phyis kyang yod par 'gyur zhes bshad pa ni rgyu rnams ni zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: how could it exist later?

original: rgyu rnams ni 'bras bu la 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni 'bras bu la 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: The cause is mistaken with regard to the effect.

original: 'bras bu med kyang 'byung ba yin te gdon mi za bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu med kyang 'byung ba yin te gdon mi za bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Even though the effect does not exist, the cause arises; it is not necessarily an agent.

original: da ni 'brel pa rtogs pa med pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs las tha dad par byed pa med par mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa /
analyzed: da ni 'brel pa rtogs pa med pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs las tha dad par byed pa med par mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa /
translated: Now, since the relation is not understood, the proof of the probandum is stated, preceded by the statement of the nature of non-apprehension of the absence of an agent, which is made distinct from the natural reason.

original: tshad ma rnams ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: tshad ma rnams ni zhes smos so //
translated: The valid cognitions, etc.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung gi tshad ma rnams mi 'jug pa mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung gi tshad ma rnams mi 'jug pa mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The valid cognitions of direct perception, inference, and scripture do not operate. Non-apprehension is the non-operation.

original: 'di ni 'di'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs las khyad par yin no zhes gtan tshigs kyi khyad par ston par byed pa /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs las khyad par yin no zhes gtan tshigs kyi khyad par ston par byed pa /
translated: This is the difference between this and the natural reason.

original: ni'i sgras rnam par dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: ni'i sgras rnam par dbye ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù indicates the distinction of the reason.

original: chad ma 'jug pa @28b nyid kyis rtogs pa'i mi dmigs pa de ni mi dmigs pa yin no zhes 'grel par bshad do //
analyzed: chad ma 'jug pa @28b nyid kyis rtogs pa'i mi dmigs pa de ni mi dmigs pa yin no zhes 'grel par bshad do //
translated: The Commentary explains that non-apprehension is the non-engagement of the mind in regard to an object that is capable of producing an apprehension.

original: tshad ma nyid dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir de ldog pa med pa ni mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir de ldog pa med pa ni mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Since valid cognition is the apprehension of an object, the non-engagement of that is non-apprehension.

original: rang gi ngo bo bstan nas bsgrub par bya ba bshad pa ni /üîΩmed la mi 'jug 'bras bu can //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo bstan nas bsgrub par bya ba bshad pa ni / med la mi 'jug 'bras bu can //
translated: Having explained its nature, he explains the probandum:

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is the non-engagement of valid cognition in regard to the absent.

original: gang du tshad ma 'di dag mi 'jug pa de nyid la de mi dmigs pa de'i byed pa 'jug par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang du tshad ma 'di dag mi 'jug pa de nyid la de mi dmigs pa de'i byed pa 'jug par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Where these valid cognitions do not engage, there is the non-apprehension of that, and the activity of that is said to engage.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs par gyur ba de nyid med la zhes yul nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs par gyur ba de nyid med la zhes yul nyid du bstan to //
translated: Therefore, that very non-apprehension is taught to be the object of the absent.

original: de yang don yod pa ni dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa med na yod pa med pas med pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de yang don yod pa ni dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa med na yod pa med pas med pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Moreover, since the existent object is the referent, if the referent does not exist, the existent does not exist, and thus it is said to be nonexistent.

original: gang gi phyir de med pa yin pa des na med pa de la mi 'jug pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin te mi 'jug pa sgrub par byed pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de med pa yin pa des na med pa de la mi 'jug pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin te mi 'jug pa sgrub par byed pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Since it is nonexistent, the non-engagement in that nonexistent is its effect, and the establishment of non-engagement is its effect.

original: 'jug na ni don gdon mi za bar rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba mi ldog ste /
analyzed: 'jug na ni don gdon mi za bar rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba mi ldog ste /
translated: If there were engagement, the arising of conceptualization with regard to the object would not cease.

original: mthong ba don gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu 'dod pas 'byung ba'i g-yo ba brtsams pa la ni gdon mi za bar 'di 'di lta bu'o snyam pa'i rtog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba don gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu 'dod pas 'byung ba'i g-yo ba brtsams pa la ni gdon mi za bar 'di 'di lta bu'o snyam pa'i rtog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when one begins the movement that is desired as the effect to be accomplished by the object seen, there would necessarily be the conceptualization thinking ‚Äúthis is like that.‚Äù

original: des na gal te 'jug pa zhes bya ba 'byung ba las gyur pa'i byed pa brjod pa de lta na yang 'jug pa bkag pa dang / de med na mi 'byung ba'i sgra bkag pa byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gal te 'jug pa zhes bya ba 'byung ba las gyur pa'i byed pa brjod pa de lta na yang 'jug pa bkag pa dang / de med na mi 'byung ba'i sgra bkag pa byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even if what is called engagement is expressed as an action that arises from the object, still the negation of engagement and the negation of the sound that does not arise without it would be accomplished.

original: 'jug pa la ni don yod par dogs pa'i rtsa ba can yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa la ni don yod par dogs pa'i rtsa ba can yin te /
translated: and the engagement has the root of the doubt of the existence of the object.

original: des na 'jug pa bkag na de las 'jug pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa de'i rtsa ba can gyi sgra yang bkag par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na 'jug pa bkag na de las 'jug pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa de'i rtsa ba can gyi sgra yang bkag par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the engagement is refuted, the word which has the root of that conception is also refuted, just like the engagement.

original: de nyid kyis na yod pa'i shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'grel pa bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na yod pa'i shes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'grel pa bshad do //
translated: By that very fact, the commentary on ‚Äúthe cognition of existence, etc.‚Äù is explained.

original: tha snyad ces bya ba ni don du gnyer bas 'byung ba bskyed ba'o//
analyzed: tha snyad ces bya ba ni don du gnyer bas 'byung ba bskyed ba'o//
translated: ‚ÄúConvention‚Äù is the production of the origin of the desire for the object.

original: ci tshad ma med na yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa 'gog ce na /
analyzed: ci tshad ma med na yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa 'gog ce na /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúIf there is no valid cognition, is the cognition of existence, etc. refuted?,‚Äù

original: de dag ni dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: de dag ni dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: it is said that they are preceded by the object.

original: da ni 'tshe ba la sogs pa spong ba la sogs pa la yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhe na de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma rnams zhes smos pa ste /
analyzed: da ni 'tshe ba la sogs pa spong ba la sogs pa la yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhe na de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma rnams zhes smos pa ste /
translated: Now, if one says, ‚ÄúOne will not engage in the abandonment of harm, etc.,‚Äù for that very reason, the words ‚Äúthe valid cognitions‚Äù are stated.

original: de la lud las dmigs pa yod pa'i phyir dang / de yang rnam pa 'di lta bu'i don la tshad ma yin pa dang / rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol du gyur pa ma yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: de la lud las dmigs pa yod pa'i phyir dang / de yang rnam pa 'di lta bu'i don la tshad ma yin pa dang / rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol du gyur pa ma yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: because the fuel is the object of the perception, because that perception is valid with respect to the object of that form, and because it is not extraneous to inference.

original: gal te mdo las me la zhes don med pa tsam rgyu nyid du brjod pa ma yin nam /üîΩde ji ltar na dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i @29a * //
analyzed: gal te mdo las me la zhes don med pa tsam rgyu nyid du brjod pa ma yin nam / de ji ltar na dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i @29a * //
translated: But isn‚Äôt it meaningless to say that mere nonexistence is the cause, as the s≈´tra does when it says ‚Äúbecause of fuel‚Äù?

original: phyir zhes bstan ce na /
analyzed: phyir zhes bstan ce na /
translated: How can it be shown that the perception of fuel precedes the perception of fire?

original: de ltar 'di ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn this way . . . ‚Äù

original: rnam pa 'dis yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa dgag pa'i 'bras bu can 'di ni yod pa dang med pa dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi 'dra ba khyad par med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa dgag pa'i 'bras bu can 'di ni yod pa dang med pa dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi 'dra ba khyad par med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: This argument, which has the effect of refuting the cognition of existence, etc., is similar to the arguments refuting existence and nonexistence and establishing existence and nonexistence.

original: yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs ni ji skad bshad pa nyid la med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs ni ji skad bshad pa nyid la med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The argument of the cognition of existence, etc., has been explained. The argument establishing the cognition of nonexistence, etc., will be explained.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: ji skad bshad pa'i rgyu nyid sbyor byed du bya ste ji skad bshad pa'i shes pa la sogs pa 'gog pa'i 'bras bu can du bstan to //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i rgyu nyid sbyor byed du bya ste ji skad bshad pa'i shes pa la sogs pa 'gog pa'i 'bras bu can du bstan to //
translated: The very cause that was explained should be taken as the reason, and it is shown that the effect of the cessation of the consciousness, etc., that were explained is the same.

original: 'di gcig pur ni ma zad de 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bar du yang yin no //
analyzed: 'di gcig pur ni ma zad de 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bar du yang yin no //
translated: Not only that, but it is also as will be explained.

original: 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa na rgyu nyid du bstan pa'i med pa ji skad bshad pa'i rgyu'i rtsa ba nyid du ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gzhung 'dzugs pa na rgyu nyid du bstan pa'i med pa ji skad bshad pa'i rgyu'i rtsa ba nyid du ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When this is being established, the root of the cause that was explained as the reason for nonexistence is shown to be the same as the nonexistence that was explained as the reason.

original: dmigs pa ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni yod pa yin te /
translated: The object exists,

original: dmigs pa de las yod pa'i shes pa dang sgra dang tha snyad 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa de las yod pa'i shes pa dang sgra dang tha snyad 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the existent consciousness, word, and convention operate in regard to that object.

original: yod pa'i don gyi rang bzhin nyid yin gyi dmigs pa ni ma yin te don dang dmigs pa tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir phan tshun yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i don gyi rang bzhin nyid yin gyi dmigs pa ni ma yin te don dang dmigs pa tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir phan tshun yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the existent object is not the object, because the object and the existent are not mutually existent, because the object and the existent are different.

original: de lta mod kyi dmigs pa yod par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi dmigs pa yod par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, the object is said to exist.

original: des na tshig gi don gzhan gyas gzhan la brjod pa 'di ni nye bar btags pa las yin no //
analyzed: des na tshig gi don gzhan gyas gzhan la brjod pa 'di ni nye bar btags pa las yin no //
translated: Therefore, this expression of one thing in terms of another is a metaphorical expression.

original: yod pa la gnas pa'i nye bar btags pa de yang mi dmigs pa la yin te de la dmigs pa nyid kyis yod do snyam du shes pa 'jug pa'i phyir dang / de ltar rtogs pa de'i dbang du byas te tha snyad 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa la gnas pa'i nye bar btags pa de yang mi dmigs pa la yin te de la dmigs pa nyid kyis yod do snyam du shes pa 'jug pa'i phyir dang / de ltar rtogs pa de'i dbang du byas te tha snyad 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And this metaphorical expression of existence is based on non-apprehension, because the cognition that ‚Äúit exists‚Äù occurs through the apprehension of that, and because conventions are employed in consideration of that cognition.

original: dmigs pa de yang gang yin zhen /
analyzed: dmigs pa de yang gang yin zhen /
translated: What is that apprehension?

original: dngos po rung ba'i mtshan nyid ces smos so //üîΩrnam par shes pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin gyi dngos po'am /
analyzed: dngos po rung ba'i mtshan nyid ces smos so // rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin gyi dngos po'am /
translated: It is said to be the nature of a suitable object.üîΩThe nature of an object that is the domain of consciousness is not consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin gyi dngos po ni rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin gyi dngos po ni rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
translated: because the nature of an object that is the domain of consciousness is not consciousness,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni tha dad pa la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni tha dad pa la brten pa yin no //
translated: because the relation of cause and effect is based on difference.

original: des na 'di yang khyad par can gyi yul yod pa dmigs pa la nye bar btags nas bstan pa yin no ;
analyzed: des na 'di yang khyad par can gyi yul yod pa dmigs pa la nye bar btags nas bstan pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, this is also taught as a metaphorical expression of the existence of a special object that is apprehended.

original: / des na dmigs pa yod pa nyid dang / yod pa nyid dmigs pa yin no zhes gnyi ga nye bar btags nas brjod do //
analyzed: / des na dmigs pa yod pa nyid dang / yod pa nyid dmigs pa yin no zhes gnyi ga nye bar btags nas brjod do //
translated: Therefore, both the existence of the object and the existence of the apprehension of the object are designated and spoken of.

original: de'i rten can gyi shes pa 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i don dngos nyid do //
analyzed: de'i rten can gyi shes pa 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i don dngos nyid do //
translated: The statement, ‚Äúthe engagement of consciousness which has that as its basis‚Äù refers to the actual object of apprehension.

original: gang dag bya ba ni byed pa po dang las la gnas pa'i phyir dmigs pa gnyi gar bstan to zhes @29b zer ba de dag ni dum bu nyid yin gyi rtog gi ni ma yin no //üîΩshes pa ni bya ba'am /
analyzed: gang dag bya ba ni byed pa po dang las la gnas pa'i phyir dmigs pa gnyi gar bstan to zhes @29b zer ba de dag ni dum bu nyid yin gyi rtog gi ni ma yin no // shes pa ni bya ba'am /
translated: Those who say that the object of apprehension is taught as both because the action is based on the agent and the object are only partially correct, but not completely so.üîΩConsciousness is neither an action nor a quality of an entity.

original: dngos po'i chos ma yin la yul las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i chos ma yin la yul las kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it an object.

original: des na 'di ni gzhan gyi lugs kyi dri mas bsgyur ba tsam du zad do //üîΩgang gi phyir dmigs pa yod pa yin pa de'i phyir ma dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'di ni gzhan gyi lugs kyi dri mas bsgyur ba tsam du zad do // gang gi phyir dmigs pa yod pa yin pa de'i phyir ma dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, this is merely a contamination of another‚Äôs system.üîΩSince the object of apprehension exists, therefore the nonexistence of the nonapprehension of that is established.

original: gang dag de ltar gyur ba de dag kyang med pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni mi dmigs pa ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: gang dag de ltar gyur ba de dag kyang med pa yin no zhes bshad pa ni mi dmigs pa ni zhes smos so //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThose that are like that do not exist,‚Äù refers to nonapprehension.

original: mi dmigs pa ni med pa yin la de yang med pa rnams kyi med pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni med pa yin la de yang med pa rnams kyi med pa yin no //
translated: Non-observation is non-existence, and that is the non-existence of non-existents.

original: des na 'dir don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na 'dir don 'di yin te /
translated: So the meaning here is this:

original: gang dag ma dmigs pa de dag ni med pa yin la de yang dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag ma dmigs pa de dag ni med pa yin la de yang dmigs pa nyid yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those that are not observed are non-existent, and that non-existence is the existence of the very observation.

original: yod pa de yang yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa de la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa de yang yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa de la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that existence is based on the existence of the consciousness, etc.

original: des na 'di dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs su rang gi rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir yod pa la sogs pa 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs su rang gi rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir yod pa la sogs pa 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the existence, etc. are refuted by the reason that will be stated here, because they lack their own reasons.

original: gal te de lta na yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa rnams dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan med pa tsam gyis dgag pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa rnams dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan med pa tsam gyis dgag pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then since the consciousness of existence, etc. must have an object, the refutation is established by the mere absence of a reason.

original: rang gi rgyu mtshan med pa nyid rgyu mtshan yod pa 'gog pa la rigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu mtshan med pa nyid rgyu mtshan yod pa 'gog pa la rigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mere absence of one‚Äôs own reason is a reason that refutes the existence of a reason.

original: des na mi dmigs pa med pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: des na mi dmigs pa med pas ci zhig bya /
translated: So what is the use of non-observation?

original: med pa nyid med pa yin mod /
analyzed: med pa nyid med pa yin mod /
translated: Non-existence is non-existence.

original: de lta na yang rgyu med na 'bras bu med par 'grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang rgyu med na 'bras bu med par 'grub pa kho na'o //
translated: But even so, it is established that if the cause does not exist, the effect does not exist.

original: de bzhin du gnyi ga ltar nye bar btags nas bstan pa yang med par 'gyur ro zhe na 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyi ga ltar nye bar btags nas bstan pa yang med par 'gyur ro zhe na 'di la brjod pa /
translated: In the same way, it would be impossible to teach that both exist and that both do not exist.

original: ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi med pa gang yin pa de ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi med pa gang yin pa de ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin la /
translated: We reply: The nonexistence that is the characteristic of cessation is not the probandum,

original: sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: nor is it the proof.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis dngos po gzhan nyid dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir de bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis dngos po gzhan nyid dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir de bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: But because the other entity is a nonentity in the manner to be explained, it is the probandum and the proof.

original: gang gi tshe shes pa nyid 'di shes pa gzhan med pa yin pa de'i tshe de dngos po med par yang yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes pa nyid 'di shes pa gzhan med pa yin pa de'i tshe de dngos po med par yang yin par 'gyur te /
translated: When consciousness itself is the absence of another consciousness, then it is a nonentity.

original: rigs pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reasoning is the same.

original: dngos po gzhan don dngos po med pa nyid na yang shes pa dngos po med pa yang de nyid yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan don dngos po med pa nyid na yang shes pa dngos po med pa yang de nyid yin par 'gyur te /
translated: When the other entity is a nonentity, then consciousness is also a nonentity.

original: des na shes pa dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs pa grub pa yin la shes pa med par grub pa'i phyir de logs su bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na shes pa dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs pa grub pa yin la shes pa med par grub pa'i phyir de logs su bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the non-apprehension of the characteristics of consciousness and the object of consciousness is established, and since the non-existence of consciousness is established, it is not to be established separately.

original: des na don dam pa 'di tsam zhig gnyi gar btags pa don dam pa ma yin pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na don dam pa 'di tsam zhig gnyi gar btags pa don dam pa ma yin pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this much of the ultimate is taught as the ultimate that is imputed to both.

original: don dang shes pa dag @30a * //
analyzed: don dang shes pa dag @30a * //
translated: If the object and consciousness

original: tha dad pa med par btags na ni shes pa med pa yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: tha dad pa med par btags na ni shes pa med pa yin pa bzhin du /
translated: are imputed as non-different, then just as consciousness does not exist,

original: shes pa med pa yang yin par 'grub ste des na shes pa dang shes pa dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs pa 'grub bo /
analyzed: shes pa med pa yang yin par 'grub ste des na shes pa dang shes pa dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid mi dmigs pa 'grub bo /
translated: it is established that the object also does not exist. Therefore, the non-apprehension of the characteristics of consciousness and the object of consciousness is established.

original: don kyang shes pa nyid yin pas na shes pa med pa bzhin du don na med pa yang shes pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don kyang shes pa nyid yin pas na shes pa med pa bzhin du don na med pa yang shes pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the object is also consciousness itself, just as consciousness does not exist, the object also does not exist, because the object is consciousness.

original: de bzhin du don med pa don yin pa ltar don med pa shes pa med pa yang yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa grub na grub pa'i phyir don med pa logs su bsgrub par bya ba grub bo //üîΩdes na rigs pas grub pa'i dngos po 'di bstan pa'i phyir don shes pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du don med pa don yin pa ltar don med pa shes pa med pa yang yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa grub na grub pa'i phyir don med pa logs su bsgrub par bya ba grub bo // des na rigs pas grub pa'i dngos po 'di bstan pa'i phyir don shes pa yin la /
translated: Likewise, since the nonexistence of objects is the nonexistence of consciousness, if nonapprehension is established, then nonexistence is established. Therefore, it is established that nonexistence does not need to be established separately.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that this is a logically established entity, he says, ‚ÄúThe object exists as consciousness, and consciousness exists as the object.‚Äù

original: shes pa yang don yin no zhes dngos po ma yin pa bstan te /
analyzed: shes pa yang don yin no zhes dngos po ma yin pa bstan te /
translated: He demonstrates that they are not entities,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis de bstan pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis de bstan pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the method for demonstrating them in the manner explained above.

original: des na de ltar rang bzhin gyis bskal pa rnams la yang yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: des na de ltar rang bzhin gyis bskal pa rnams la yang yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa 'gog pa yin te /
translated: Thus, in this way, he refutes the existence of consciousness and so on even in the absence of intrinsic nature,

original: rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no reason for them to exist.

original: 'di med pa ni dmigs pa yod pa yin pa'i phyir dang de yang 'dir med pa'i phyir gyi med pa nyid ni ma yin no //üîΩ'chad par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs la ni mi dmigs pa med pa nyid kyi med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di med pa ni dmigs pa yod pa yin pa'i phyir dang de yang 'dir med pa'i phyir gyi med pa nyid ni ma yin no //üîΩ'chad par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs la ni mi dmigs pa med pa nyid kyi med pa yin no //
translated: The nonexistence of this is the existence of the object, and that does not exist here, but it is not that it does not exist at all.üîΩThe nonexistence of this is the nonexistence of nonapprehension, which is the reason that will be explained below.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'di med pa nyid ma yin zhing mi dmigs pa med pa yin /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'di med pa nyid ma yin zhing mi dmigs pa med pa yin /
translated: Well then, how is it that it is not non-existent and that non-apprehension is not non-existent?

original: brjod pa / yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa dgag pa tsam sgrub pa la ni rgyu mtshan med pa tsam gyis de med par bstan pa'i phyir de'i rgyu mtshan tsam las dmigs pa yod pa'i rang bzhin du bstan gyi /
analyzed: brjod pa / yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa dgag pa tsam sgrub pa la ni rgyu mtshan med pa tsam gyis de med par bstan pa'i phyir de'i rgyu mtshan tsam las dmigs pa yod pa'i rang bzhin du bstan gyi /
translated: We reply: In the proof of the mere negation of existent cognition, etc., the mere absence of a reason is taught to be its non-existence, and therefore its mere reason is taught to be the nature of the apprehension of its existence.

original: de med na don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be meaningless if it did not exist.

original: de yod pa dang mi 'khrul pas ni pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yod pa dang mi 'khrul pas ni pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it is not existent, because it is not mistaken.

original: yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ni de'i rang bzhin la /
analyzed: yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ni de'i rang bzhin la /
translated: Because it is the cause of existent cognition, etc., it is their nature.

original: de med pa yang med pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de med pa yang med pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: And because it does not exist, it is the nature of non-existence.

original: dngos po med pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rgyu mtshan med pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rgyu mtshan med pa nyid do //
translated: It is not a non-entity, but rather the mere absence of a reason.

original: de ni mi dmigs pa gnyi ga la yang khyad par med pa'i phyir de bzhin du med pa'i 'bras bu yang khyad par med do //
analyzed: de ni mi dmigs pa gnyi ga la yang khyad par med pa'i phyir de bzhin du med pa'i 'bras bu yang khyad par med do //
translated: Since there is no difference between the two in that regard, the effect of non-existence is also not different.

original: med pa sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs la ni rnam pa de lta bu'i dmigs pa yod pa dang 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir dang / yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de med pa'i bdag nyid med pa'i rang bzhin nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: med pa sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs la ni rnam pa de lta bu'i dmigs pa yod pa dang 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir dang / yod pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de med pa'i bdag nyid med pa'i rang bzhin nyid du brjod do //
translated: The reason proving nonexistence has such an object and is nonerroneous, and it is the cause of the cognition of existence, etc., so it is said to be the nature of the absence of that nonexistence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di gnyi ga sgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di gnyi ga sgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: For this reason, both are to be established.

original: yang gang du yod pa shes pa la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir de yod par brjod ce na /
analyzed: yang gang du yod pa shes pa la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir de yod par brjod ce na /
translated: But if it is asked, ‚ÄúWhere is it said that the existence of that is because of nonerroneous cognition of existence?‚Äù

original: dngos po rung ba nye bar @30b btags par ro //
