analyzed: dngos po rung ba nye bar @30b btags par ro //
translated: It is said in the case of the proper object.

original: gzhan du ni dngos po tsam nye bar btags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni dngos po tsam nye bar btags par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be said that the mere object is the proper object.

original: shes pa la mi 'khrul pa de ltar bstan na ni de med na dngos po med par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa la mi 'khrul pa de ltar bstan na ni de med na dngos po med par nges pa yin no //
translated: If it is taught that it is nonerroneous cognition, then it is certain that if it does not exist, the object does not exist.

original: de'i phyir der mi dmigs pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir der mi dmigs pa med pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is correct to say that in that case, there is no nonapprehension of nonexistence.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i bye brag gi mi dmigs pa snga ma las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin gyi mi dmigs pa yang bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i bye brag gi mi dmigs pa snga ma las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin gyi mi dmigs pa yang bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the non-apprehension of nature, which is different from the previously mentioned non-apprehension of the particular of the probandum, he says:

original: tshad ma rnams mi 'jug pa las la la med pa'i shes pa 'bras bu can yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma rnams mi 'jug pa las la la med pa'i shes pa 'bras bu can yin no //
translated: The cognition of non-existence, which is the result of the non-engagement of the means of valid cognition, is in some cases.

original: tshad ma rnams mi 'jug pa ni mi dmigs pa yin no zhes brjod zin to //
analyzed: tshad ma rnams mi 'jug pa ni mi dmigs pa yin no zhes brjod zin to //
translated: The non-engagement of the means of valid cognition is non-apprehension, as has already been said.

original: 'di dag las la la ni med pa'i shes pa grub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag las la la ni med pa'i shes pa grub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Of these, in some cases it establishes the cognition of non-existence.

original: med pa'i shes pa ji lta bu sgrub par byed pa de ltar bstan pas gtan tshigs kyi bye brag la ltos nas khyad par can du ston par byed do //
analyzed: med pa'i shes pa ji lta bu sgrub par byed pa de ltar bstan pas gtan tshigs kyi bye brag la ltos nas khyad par can du ston par byed do //
translated: In whatever way the cognition of non-existence is established, in that way it is demonstrated, and it demonstrates the particular by relying on the particular of the reason.

original: gtan tshigs kyi bye brag ni gtan tshigs gzhan la ldog pa ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi bye brag ni gtan tshigs gzhan la ldog pa ste /
translated: The particular of the reason is the exclusion of another reason,

original: de la ltos nas so //
analyzed: de la ltos nas so //
translated: in reliance on which.

original: gtan tshigs ni 'di nyid de 'di nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni 'di nyid de 'di nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The reason is just this, because this is the context.

original: / bye brag kyang tshad ma rnams mi 'jug pa nyid las so //
analyzed: / bye brag kyang tshad ma rnams mi 'jug pa nyid las so //
translated: The particular is also due to the non-engagement of the means of valid cognition.

original: des na tshad ma rnams mi 'jug pa gzhan las bye brag tu gyur pa la brten nas mi 'jug pa la la med pa shes pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na tshad ma rnams mi 'jug pa gzhan las bye brag tu gyur pa la brten nas mi 'jug pa la la med pa shes pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the non-engagement of valid cognitions is established as the knowledge of non-existence based on the distinction from other non-engagements.

original: bye brag de yang de dag las khyad par dang ldan pa yin na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bye brag de yang de dag las khyad par dang ldan pa yin na 'gyur ro //
translated: And that distinction is a particularity that is possessed by those [valid cognitions].

original: de'i shugs kyis thob pa'i 'bras bu ni 'grel pa de'i bye brag ni khyad par te gzhan bstan to //
analyzed: de'i shugs kyis thob pa'i 'bras bu ni 'grel pa de'i bye brag ni khyad par te gzhan bstan to //
translated: The effect that is indirectly obtained is the distinction of that commentary, which is taught as something else.

original: khyad par yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa can yin no //
analyzed: khyad par yang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa can yin no //
translated: And that particularity is that which has the characteristic of being perceived.

original: des na gal te tshad ma rnams mi 'jug pa la zhes bya bas nges pa'i tshad ma log pa mi rtogs kyi /
analyzed: des na gal te tshad ma rnams mi 'jug pa la zhes bya bas nges pa'i tshad ma log pa mi rtogs kyi /
translated: Therefore, if it is said that the valid cognitions do not engage, the cessation of the ascertained valid cognition is not understood.

original: 'on kyang gcig pa 'ga' zhig mi 'jug pa yin no zhes thams cad la rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta na yang ji skad brjod pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i mngon sum gcig pu nyid 'ga' zhig mi 'jug pa yin par 'gyur gyi rjes su dpag pa dang
analyzed: 'on kyang gcig pa 'ga' zhig mi 'jug pa yin no zhes thams cad la rtogs par 'gyur ba de lta na yang ji skad brjod pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i mngon sum gcig pu nyid 'ga' zhig mi 'jug pa yin par 'gyur gyi rjes su dpag pa dang
translated: But if one understands that in all cases, it is only some of the instances of a single type that do not engage, then even though it is only some of the instances of a single type of direct perception that are qualified as stated that do not engage, it is not the case that inference and

original: lung gnyis ni ma yin pas de nyid de nyid de yang gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: lung gnyis ni ma yin pas de nyid de nyid de yang gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: scripture do not. Therefore, that is the reason.

original: la la zhes bya ba 'dir mi dmigs pa zhes bya bar ni 'brel pa rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: la la zhes bya ba 'dir mi dmigs pa zhes bya bar ni 'brel pa rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical to connect some here with non-observation,

original: mdor ni mdos zin pa'i tshig nyid dang 'brel par rigs kyi gzhan dang ma yin pas ji skad brjod pa nyid bshad pa'i tshul yin no //
analyzed: mdor ni mdos zin pa'i tshig nyid dang 'brel par rigs kyi gzhan dang ma yin pas ji skad brjod pa nyid bshad pa'i tshul yin no //
translated: because it is logical to connect it with the very words of the s≈´tra, not with anything else. Therefore, the method of explanation is just as stated.

original: mdo tshig go rims bzhin bkrol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo tshig go rims bzhin bkrol ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the words of the s≈´tra are explained in order,

original: gtan tshigs ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni zhes smos so //
translated: it says, The reason is...

original: skabs kyi gtan tshigs ni @31a * //
analyzed: skabs kyi gtan tshigs ni @31a * //
translated: The reason in the context

original: med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa sgrub pa'i tshad ma rnams ldog pa yin la /
analyzed: med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa sgrub pa'i tshad ma rnams ldog pa yin la /
translated: is that the valid knowledges that prove the consciousness without external objects and so on are reversed.

original: de yang mi dmigs pa yin la zhes sngar bkrol zin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: de yang mi dmigs pa yin la zhes sngar bkrol zin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i zhes smos so //
translated: Since it has already been explained that non-apprehension is also non-apprehension of that, he says ‚Äúnon-apprehension of that.‚Äù

original: bye brag gi sgra'i don bshad pa ni /
analyzed: bye brag gi sgra'i don bshad pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúdistinction‚Äù is explained.

original: bye brag ni zhes bya ba ste ji skad bshad ma thag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bye brag ni zhes bya ba ste ji skad bshad ma thag pa bzhin no //
translated: ‚Äú Distinction‚Äù is as just explained.

original: des na gtan tshigs bye brag la ltos nas zhes bya ba'i don ni bdag nyid kyi khyad par la ltos nas zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs bye brag la ltos nas zhes bya ba'i don ni bdag nyid kyi khyad par la ltos nas zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúthe reason depends on a distinction‚Äù is ‚Äúthe reason depends on a particular of itself.‚Äù

original: gal te dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa dang 'brel pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i khyad par ma yin gyi 'on kyang don gyis yin no //
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa dang 'brel pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i khyad par ma yin gyi 'on kyang don gyis yin no //
translated: If the non-apprehension of that which is related to the nature of apprehension is not the distinction of non-apprehension, then it is by implication.

original: mi dmigs pas ni de lta bu'i don dang 'brel pa yin te /üîΩde nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i zhes bshad pa yin na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pas ni de lta bu'i don dang 'brel pa yin te / de nyid kyi phyir dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i zhes bshad pa yin na /
translated: Non-apprehension is related to such an object.üîΩTherefore, it is explained as ‚Äúthat which is related to the nature of apprehension.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa dang 'brel pa'i dmigs pa zhes brjod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa dang 'brel pa'i dmigs pa zhes brjod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is the apprehension of that which is related to the nature of apprehension,

original: de ni bden te /
analyzed: de ni bden te /
translated: that is true.

original: mi dmigs pas ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i don khyad par can nyid med par bsgrub par nus kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pas ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i don khyad par can nyid med par bsgrub par nus kyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Non-apprehension can prove the non-existence of a special object which is characterized by apprehension, but not anything else.

original: des na don nyid mi dmigs pa'i khyad par du bkod do //
analyzed: des na don nyid mi dmigs pa'i khyad par du bkod do //
translated: Therefore, the special object itself is stated as the non-apprehension.

original: des na khyad par rab tu sbyar ba ni don la gnas pa nyid du yang bsgrub par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: des na khyad par rab tu sbyar ba ni don la gnas pa nyid du yang bsgrub par nus pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the application of the special is also able to prove the existence of the object.

original: dper na phyogs kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i bum pa med pa de /
analyzed: dper na phyogs kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i bum pa med pa de /
translated: For example, in a certain special place, the non-existence of a pot which is characterized by apprehension,

original: ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: is because of non-apprehension.

original: des na khyad par 'di ni don la brten pa nyid yin pa'i phyir don la brten pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: des na khyad par 'di ni don la brten pa nyid yin pa'i phyir don la brten pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Therefore, this special is based on the object itself, and thus is taught as being based on the object.

original: bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa ni yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs la brten pa nyid du nye bar sbyar te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba bstan pa ni yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs la brten pa nyid du nye bar sbyar te /
translated: The demonstration of the probandum is applied as being based on the reason, because it is not a part.

original: de ltar brjod pas kyang de lta bur gyur pa nyid dang 'brel pa nyid kyis de ltar rtogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar brjod pas kyang de lta bur gyur pa nyid dang 'brel pa nyid kyis de ltar rtogs pa nyid de /
translated: And by saying this, it is just that which is related to that, and it is just that which is understood.

original: des na skyon med do //
analyzed: des na skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault.

original: da ni med ces bya ba la sogs pa gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni med ces bya ba la sogs pa gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to state the treatise beginning with ‚Äúnon-existence,‚Äù

original: 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says ‚Äúhere‚Äù and so on.

original: med pa ni med par shes pa de /
analyzed: med pa ni med par shes pa de /
translated: Non-existence is the cognition of non-existence.

original: gal te de grub pa 'di'i 'bras bu yin na 'dir de med pa sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de grub pa 'di'i 'bras bu yin na 'dir de med pa sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is the effect of this establishment, then here it would establish non-existence.

original: 'on te shes pa de rang gi ngo bos 'bras bu yin gyi yul grub pa'i sgo nas ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa de rang gi ngo bos 'bras bu yin gyi yul grub pa'i sgo nas ma yin na /
translated: But if that cognition is the effect by its own nature, not by the door of establishing the object,

original: 'dir de tsam zhig bsgrub bya yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir de tsam zhig bsgrub bya yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then here that alone would be the probandum.

original: med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not non-existence.

original: des na tha snyad bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na tha snyad bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would establish a convention.

original: des na 'dir ji ltar shes pa zhes rang nyid kyis btags nas rang gi @31b phyogs gzhag pa'i phyir 'di brjod do //
analyzed: des na 'dir ji ltar shes pa zhes rang nyid kyis btags nas rang gi @31b phyogs gzhag pa'i phyir 'di brjod do //
translated: Therefore, here he says this in order to posit his own position, having designated it himself as ‚Äúcognition.‚Äù

original: shes pa med pas don med pa sgrub par byed na /
analyzed: shes pa med pas don med pa sgrub par byed na /
translated: If one establishes the non-existence of the object by the non-existence of cognition,

original: shes pa med pa de yang med pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir shes pa med pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: shes pa med pa de yang med pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir shes pa med pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par 'gyur ram /
translated: And since that non-cognition is not different from non-existence, would it be established by another non-cognition?

original: yang na de med kyang grub pa de don med pa bsgrub pa /
analyzed: yang na de med kyang grub pa de don med pa bsgrub pa /
translated: Or, even if it does not exist, the establishment of that would be the establishment of a non-existent object.

original: de la dang po khas len na shes pa med pa ma grub pa 'di nyid ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dang po khas len na shes pa med pa ma grub pa 'di nyid ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: If one accepts the first, since this non-established non-cognition is not a proof, it should be established by another non-apprehension.

original: de la de ltar brgal zhing brtags pa na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la de ltar brgal zhing brtags pa na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, when one engages in such investigation, there would be an infinite regress.

original: rtogs pa yang thug pa yod na 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa yang thug pa yod na 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if there were a limit to realization, it would not be realization.

original: de smras pa ni dmigs pa med pa yang zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩmi dmigs pa rtogs na med pa rtogs par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: de smras pa ni dmigs pa med pa yang zhes bya ba yin no // mi dmigs pa rtogs na med pa rtogs par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: That is what is said by even the non-apprehension of non-apprehension.üîΩIf non-apprehension is realized, non-existence would be realized.

original: mi dmigs pa yang rang sgrub par byed pa'i mi dmigs pa rtogs na yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa yang rang sgrub par byed pa'i mi dmigs pa rtogs na yin no //
translated: And non-apprehension is when the non-apprehension that establishes itself is realized.

original: gzhan de yang de bzhin pas 'ga' yang rtogs pa mthar thug pa med pa'i phyir rtsa ba yang mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan de yang de bzhin pas 'ga' yang rtogs pa mthar thug pa med pa'i phyir rtsa ba yang mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the other is also like that, there is no final realization of anything, and so the root is not realized.

original: 'on te yang phyogs gnyis pa yin na ji ltar med par khyad par med kyang 'di grub pa de bzhin du don med pa yang yin pas mi dmigs pa don med do zhes bshad pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te yang phyogs gnyis pa yin na ji ltar med par khyad par med kyang 'di grub pa de bzhin du don med pa yang yin pas mi dmigs pa don med do zhes bshad pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: But if the second position is accepted, then just as nonexistence is not distinguished, so too the objectless is established, and so it is explained that the objectless nonapprehension is pointless.

original: gang gis thug pa med par 'gyur ba mi dmigs pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang mngon sum gyis grub pa des dngos po ngo bo med par sgrub pa yin te du bas me bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gis thug pa med par 'gyur ba mi dmigs pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang mngon sum gyis grub pa des dngos po ngo bo med par sgrub pa yin te du bas me bzhin no //
translated: But the objectless nonapprehension is not established by another nonapprehension that would lead to an infinite regress, but rather it is established by perception, and by that the essencelessness of things is established, just as fire is established by smoke.

original: 'di smras pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di smras pa ni ci ste zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is what is said in the line ‚ÄúIf you say that nonapprehension is established by perception. . . . ‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa ni mngon sum gyis grub la /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni mngon sum gyis grub la /
translated: Nonapprehension is established by perception,

original: dngos po bzhin du mngon sum gyis rang bzhin med pa ni rtogs par mi nus pas 'di mngon sum gyis grub pa'i tshul gang yin pa de brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po bzhin du mngon sum gyis rang bzhin med pa ni rtogs par mi nus pas 'di mngon sum gyis grub pa'i tshul gang yin pa de brjod pa ni /
translated: Since the absence of intrinsic reality cannot be realized by direct perception, as can an entity, the way in which it is established by direct perception is stated.

original: bum pa la sogs pa de dang mi mthun pa las gzhan dmigs pas mi dmigs pa grub pas te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa de dang mi mthun pa las gzhan dmigs pas mi dmigs pa grub pas te /
translated: Since a vase, etc., is observed as different from what is not itself, its non-observation of what is different is established.

original: de ltar rnam pa 'dis mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyis grub bo //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa 'dis mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyis grub bo //
translated: Thus, by this method, non-observation is established by direct perception.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: bum pa dmigs pas stong pa'i phyogs dmigs pa med pa mngon sum gyi rnam par 'jog pa yin no zhes so //
analyzed: bum pa dmigs pas stong pa'i phyogs dmigs pa med pa mngon sum gyi rnam par 'jog pa yin no zhes so //
translated: The position that is empty of the observation of a vase is posited as the non-observation of the object of non-observation by direct perception.

original: de 'gog pa ni de bzhin du ste rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de 'gog pa ni de bzhin du ste rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Its refutation is similar, in two ways.

original: rnam pa de nyid brjod pa ni bum pa la sogs pa dgag par bya ba las gzhan shes par bya ba phyogs yod kyang med pa ci ste mi 'grub ji ltar dmigs pa gzhan myong ba las dmigs pa med par nges pa de @32a * //
analyzed: rnam pa de nyid brjod pa ni bum pa la sogs pa dgag par bya ba las gzhan shes par bya ba phyogs yod kyang med pa ci ste mi 'grub ji ltar dmigs pa gzhan myong ba las dmigs pa med par nges pa de @32a * //
translated: The statement of that method is: ‚ÄúEven though the place, which is different from the object of negation, such as a vase, etc., is existent, why is non-existence not established? How is the ascertainment of non-observation from the experience of the observation of another object established?

original: bzhin du dngos po gzhan myong ba las kyang de las gzhan med par ji ltar 'grub par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: bzhin du dngos po gzhan myong ba las kyang de las gzhan med par ji ltar 'grub par mi 'gyur /
translated: Likewise, how could it be established that there is no other object experienced than that one?

original: smras pa / rgol ba dang lan 'di gnyis ka yang ma 'brel te /
analyzed: smras pa / rgol ba dang lan 'di gnyis ka yang ma 'brel te /
translated: Objection: Both the objection and the response are irrelevant.

original: dmigs pa yang gzhan myong yang /
analyzed: dmigs pa yang gzhan myong yang /
translated: The object is different from the experience,

original: dmigs pa gzhan dag med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa gzhan dag med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but it is not established that there is no other object.

original: shes pa las yul du ma byas pa'i don gnas pa ni med de des na gal te phyogs dmigs pa myong ba na phyogs dmigs pa nyid myong bar 'gyur ba nyid mngon sum gyis grub mod /üîΩde las gzhan dmigs pa med pa gang gis grub shes pa dmigs pas na ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa las yul du ma byas pa'i don gnas pa ni med de des na gal te phyogs dmigs pa myong ba na phyogs dmigs pa nyid myong bar 'gyur ba nyid mngon sum gyis grub mod / de las gzhan dmigs pa med pa gang gis grub shes pa dmigs pas na ma yin te /
translated: There is no object that is not taken as an object by consciousness. Therefore, if the position is that when the object is experienced, the object is experienced, then it is certainly established by direct perception.

original: rang gi bdag nyid mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdon bzhin du dmigs pa gzhan gyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid mthar thug pa'i phyir ro // don bzhin du dmigs pa gzhan gyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: But how is it established that there is no other object than that? It is not established by consciousness, because consciousness is limited to itself.üîΩIt is not established by another object, because, like the object, it does not exist essentially.

original: don bzhin du rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pas dmigs pa'i yul nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don bzhin du rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pas dmigs pa'i yul nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not established by the object itself, because, like the object, it does not exist essentially. Therefore, it does not exist as an object of experience.

original: nges pa'i shes pa gzhan myong na gzhan med pas 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: nges pa'i shes pa gzhan myong na gzhan med pas 'grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that the experience of another ascertainment establishes the nonexistence of another,

original: nges pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na gal te rang gi ngo bo nyid tsam nyid yin te /
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na gal te rang gi ngo bo nyid tsam nyid yin te /
translated: what is this so-called ascertainment? If it is the mere intrinsic nature,

original: de grub kyang med pa la ci phan /
analyzed: de grub kyang med pa la ci phan /
translated: then what use is it to establish it if it does not exist?

original: dmigs pa gzhan med pa de nyid ngo bo yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa gzhan med pa de nyid ngo bo yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the nonexistence of another object is its intrinsic nature,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de'i ngo bo dmigs pa log pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo dmigs pa log pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its intrinsic nature is the mere cessation of the object.

original: dmigs pa gzhan ni dmigs pa log pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa gzhan ni dmigs pa log pa ma yin no //
translated: The other object is not the cessation of the object.üîΩIf you say that it is the mere absence of intrinsic nature and the object has intrinsic nature, how can it be the nonexistence of another?

original: de ni ngo no nyid med pa tsam yin la dmigs pa ni ngo bo nyid yin pas de ji ltar gzhan med pa yin 'on te de nges pa nyid ni med pa'i khyad par can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni ngo no nyid med pa tsam yin la dmigs pa ni ngo bo nyid yin pas de ji ltar gzhan med pa yin 'on te de nges pa nyid ni med pa'i khyad par can yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that ascertainment itself is the particular nonexistence,

original: de lta na yang khyad par la mngon sum gyi byed pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de lta na yang khyad par la mngon sum gyi byed pa med pa nyid de /
translated: then even in that case, direct perception does not function with regard to the particular.

original: de la yul du bya ba med pas de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yul du bya ba med pas de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not take that as its object, it is not its object.

original: de'i phyir gang la brten nas dmigs pa 'jug pa de dngos po gzhan yod pa dang med pa'am the tshom za ba la mi ltos kho nar 'dir nges par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang la brten nas dmigs pa 'jug pa de dngos po gzhan yod pa dang med pa'am the tshom za ba la mi ltos kho nar 'dir nges par byed do //
translated: Therefore, in this case, we ascertain that the occurrence of the object of apprehension does not depend on the existence or nonexistence or doubt of another entity.

original: yul ma yin pa la ni rdul tsam yang 'gro ba med pa'i phyir myong ba'i rang gi ngo bo nges pa na gzhan dmigs pa na mi dmigs pa'am gzhan yod pas med pa 'grub par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: yul ma yin pa la ni rdul tsam yang 'gro ba med pa'i phyir myong ba'i rang gi ngo bo nges pa na gzhan dmigs pa na mi dmigs pa'am gzhan yod pas med pa 'grub par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Since not even a particle of the nonobject goes anywhere, when the nature of the experience is ascertained, how could the establishment of the nonexistence of the other through the nonapprehension of the other or through the existence of the other occur?

original: shugs zhes bya ba yul du ma byas pa rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i tshad ma'i byed pa yang tshad ma dang ldan pas khas blang bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shugs zhes bya ba yul du ma byas pa rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i tshad ma'i byed pa yang tshad ma dang ldan pas khas blang bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: The activity of the valid knowledge that posits the nonobject, which is not an object, cannot be accepted as the activity of valid knowledge because it is not valid knowledge.

original: des na 'di brjod dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'di brjod dgos so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, this must be stated.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'di la dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po gzhan ldog pa tsam yin pa'i phyir @32b tshad ma'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po gzhan ldog pa tsam yin pa'i phyir @32b tshad ma'i yul ma yin te /
translated: In this regard, the so-called nonentity is merely the opposite of another entity. Therefore it is not the object of valid knowledge.

original: bum pa med do zhes bya ba de med pa ni dngos po 'ga'i yang mthar thug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa med do zhes bya ba de med pa ni dngos po 'ga'i yang mthar thug pa ma yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe pot does not exist‚Äù does not refer to the ultimate reality of any entity.

original: des na ji ltar ngo bo med pas na de yod na 'ga' yang 'byung ba med pa'i phyir dang rgyu'i rang bzhin yang de lta bu yin pa'i phyir 'di la rgyu'i rang bzhin mi srid pa de bzhin du de las tshad ma yang ldog pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na ji ltar ngo bo med pas na de yod na 'ga' yang 'byung ba med pa'i phyir dang rgyu'i rang bzhin yang de lta bu yin pa'i phyir 'di la rgyu'i rang bzhin mi srid pa de bzhin du de las tshad ma yang ldog pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, just as the nature of a cause is impossible in the absence of an entity, because nothing can arise if it does not exist, and because the nature of a cause is like that, in the same way, a valid cognition is also impossible in the absence of an entity.

original: don dam pa'am kun rdzob tu yang rung ste tshad ma zhes bya ba ni gsal bar byed pa la brjod do //
analyzed: don dam pa'am kun rdzob tu yang rung ste tshad ma zhes bya ba ni gsal bar byed pa la brjod do //
translated: A valid cognition is said to be a revealer, whether in the ultimate sense or in the conventional sense.

original: gang la bdag nyid 'ga' zhig yod pa de /
analyzed: gang la bdag nyid 'ga' zhig yod pa de /
translated: That which has some nature of its own

original: de'i bdag nyid du gsal ba de ni gsal ba nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du gsal ba de ni gsal ba nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: is revealed as having that nature.

original: 'di la ni dngos po'i ngo bo med pas ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir 'di gang gis gsal ba yin des na 'di la gzhal bya nyid ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'di la ni dngos po'i ngo bo med pas ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir 'di gang gis gsal ba yin des na 'di la gzhal bya nyid ci zhig yod /
translated: But since this has no nature of its own, it is nothing at all. So what is revealed by it? Therefore, how can it be an object of cognition?

original: des na ji ltar 'di la rgyu med pa de bzhin du tshad ma yang med do //
analyzed: des na ji ltar 'di la rgyu med pa de bzhin du tshad ma yang med do //
translated: So just as it has no cause, in the same way, it has no valid cognition either.

original: 'o na ji ltar bum pa med do zhe'am /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar bum pa med do zhe'am /
translated: Well then, how do you posit the absence of a pot?

original: dbang phyug dang gtso bo dang bdag med do zhes rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: dbang phyug dang gtso bo dang bdag med do zhes rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Or the absence of God, or primal substance, or self?

original: de rnam par gzhag pas kyang cir yang byar med do //
analyzed: de rnam par gzhag pas kyang cir yang byar med do //
translated: But what purpose is served by positing them?

original: dgos pa'i yan lag nyid kyis rnam par 'jog pa'am de lta bu ni yan lag ma yin yang yod pa yin no zhes rang gi ngo bo yod pas rnam par 'jog grang na /
analyzed: dgos pa'i yan lag nyid kyis rnam par 'jog pa'am de lta bu ni yan lag ma yin yang yod pa yin no zhes rang gi ngo bo yod pas rnam par 'jog grang na /
translated: If you posit them because they are needed, or because they exist even though they are not needed, then you posit them because they have an intrinsic reality.

original: de ni dngos po med pa la med do //üîΩde'i phyir de ltar rnam par gzhag par 'os pa'i yod pa dgos pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de ni dngos po med pa la med do // de'i phyir de ltar rnam par gzhag par 'os pa'i yod pa dgos pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa'am /
translated: But that is not the case for non-things.üîΩTherefore, the existence that is suitable to be posited in this way is either needed as a component of a purpose or it is the intrinsic reality itself that generates the valid knowledge that apprehends itself.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis rang gi bdag nyid 'dzin pa'i tshad ma skyed par byed pa gang yin pa de dag nyid bum pa 'di la yod do //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis rang gi bdag nyid 'dzin pa'i tshad ma skyed par byed pa gang yin pa de dag nyid bum pa 'di la yod do //
translated: That is what exists in this pot.

original: sems 'dod chags dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: sems 'dod chags dang bral ba'am /
translated: The mind is free from attachment.

original: 'jig rten gzhan yod do zhes tshad mas yul du byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan yod do zhes tshad mas yul du byed do //
translated: The other world exists.

original: gang dag yod pa ma yin pa de dag ni ji ltar gnas bzhin pa'i ngo bo rtogs pa la mi gnas shing shes par 'dod par 'os pa ma yin pas de dag ji ltar yang rnam par gzhag par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang dag yod pa ma yin pa de dag ni ji ltar gnas bzhin pa'i ngo bo rtogs pa la mi gnas shing shes par 'dod par 'os pa ma yin pas de dag ji ltar yang rnam par gzhag par mi rung ngo //
translated: But if they do not exist, then it is not right to assert that they are known or that they are perceived as having the nature of existing. Therefore, they cannot be established in any way.

original: de'i phyir yod pa nyid rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa nyid rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, existence is what is to be established.

original: gzhan du ni 'jal bar byed pa las tshad ma btang snyoms pa nyid pas rang gi ngo bo can rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni 'jal bar byed pa las tshad ma btang snyoms pa nyid pas rang gi ngo bo can rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Otherwise, the measure of the measure would be abandoned, and it would not have its own nature.

original: dngos po med pa ni ngo bo med do zhes bya ba de nyid ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na ci ngo bo med par rnam par gzhag pa na rnam par gnas pa cung zhig yod dam gal te de lta na ni ngo bo med pa nyid duüîΩrnam par gnas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni ngo bo med do zhes bya ba de nyid ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na ci ngo bo med par rnam par gzhag pa na rnam par gnas pa cung zhig yod dam gal te de lta na ni ngo bo med pa nyid du rnam par gnas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: How can it be established that a non-entity has no nature? If, when it is established as having no nature, it has some nature, then it would not be established as having no nature.

original: @33a * // bdag nyid de nyid ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @33a * // bdag nyid de nyid ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that very nature is its own nature.

original: ci yang gnas pa med na yang ngo bo med pa nyid du ji ltar rnam par gzhag ces bya ba'i brgal ba ci zhig /'o na ji ltar rang gi ngo bo med pa nyid dngos po med pa yin zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci yang gnas pa med na yang ngo bo med pa nyid du ji ltar rnam par gzhag ces bya ba'i brgal ba ci zhig /'o na ji ltar rang gi ngo bo med pa nyid dngos po med pa yin zhes brjod ce na /
translated: What is the objection? Well, if you say that the absence of intrinsic reality is a non-thing,

original: de skad brjod par zad kyi de tsam gyis tshad ma'i yul nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de skad brjod par zad kyi de tsam gyis tshad ma'i yul nyid ma yin te /
translated: we reply that you are merely saying that, but that does not make it an object of knowledge.

original: dper na rtag pa ni ldog pa med pa'i rang bzhin can dus gsum dang 'brel pa yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rtag pa ni ldog pa med pa'i rang bzhin can dus gsum dang 'brel pa yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like saying that the permanent has the nature of non-cessation and is related to the three times.

original: de ni tshad ma'i yul ma yin la /
analyzed: de ni tshad ma'i yul ma yin la /
translated: That is not an object of knowledge.

original: rnam par gzhag pa yang med de /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa yang med de /
translated: Nor is it a positable object.

original: de lta bu mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such a thing is impossible.

original: brjod pa 'gal ba yang ma yin te rigs pa ston pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa 'gal ba yang ma yin te rigs pa ston pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it a contradiction, because it is merely a teaching of reasoning.

original: gang dag dngos po med pa rang bzhin gzhan dang ldan pa yin no snyam du rmongs pa de dag la rigs pa 'di brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag dngos po med pa rang bzhin gzhan dang ldan pa yin no snyam du rmongs pa de dag la rigs pa 'di brjod pa yin no //
translated: This reasoning is stated for those confused people who think that the absence of intrinsic reality is something that possesses another intrinsic reality.

original: dngos po ldog par khas len na de nyid dngos po med pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po ldog par khas len na de nyid dngos po med pa yin te /
translated: If you accept that an entity is stopped, then that itself is a nonentity.

original: gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: What would another do?

original: de ni don gzhan nyid du 'gyur gyi dngos po med pa ni ma yin te ldog pa ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde khas mi len na yang de nyid yod pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig /'di la yang ngo bo cung zad yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni don gzhan nyid du 'gyur gyi dngos po med pa ni ma yin te ldog pa ni gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro // de khas mi len na yang de nyid yod pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig /'di la yang ngo bo cung zad yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That would be a different object, but it would not be a nonentity, because stopping is different.üîΩIf you do not accept that, then since that itself exists, what is this so-called nonentity?

original: de med do zhes bya ba de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med do zhes bya ba de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here also, it does not have the slightest essence, because it is just that, the nonexistence of that.

original: des na dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhal bya ma yin la /
analyzed: des na dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba 'di ni gzhal bya ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, this so-called nonapprehension is not an object of comprehension.

original: don dngos po med pa yang gzhal bya ma yin no //
analyzed: don dngos po med pa yang gzhal bya ma yin no //
translated: And a nonentity is also not an object of comprehension.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis 'byung ba'i tshad ma ni yod pa nyid las skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis 'byung ba'i tshad ma ni yod pa nyid las skyes pa yin la /
translated: A valid cognition that arises by its own intrinsic nature arises from existence.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis 'byung ba ma yin pas kyang yod pa nyid yod do zhes 'jal bar byed do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis 'byung ba ma yin pas kyang yod pa nyid yod do zhes 'jal bar byed do //
translated: And that which does not arise by its own intrinsic nature comprehends that existence exists.

original: med pa gang yin pa de'am de med pa ni tshad ma skyed pa'am yod do zhes gzhal bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa gang yin pa de'am de med pa ni tshad ma skyed pa'am yod do zhes gzhal bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: That which is nonexistent, or the nonexistence of that, does not generate a valid cognition, nor is it to be evaluated as existent.

original: de ni med do zhes gzhal bar bya ba yin no zhe na /üîΩde 'am de med pa cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir gang zhig gzhal bar bya /
analyzed: de ni med do zhes gzhal bar bya ba yin no zhe na / de 'am de med pa cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir gang zhig gzhal bar bya /
translated: But it is to be evaluated as nonexistent!üîΩSince that or the nonexistence of that does not exist in the least, what is to be evaluated?

original: des na gang yang med pa de ni der dngos po'am dngos po med pa ji ltar yang gzhal bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gang yang med pa de ni der dngos po'am dngos po med pa ji ltar yang gzhal bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is nonexistent, how could it be evaluated as an existent or nonexistent entity?

original: des na bum pas stong pa'i phyogs su dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i bum pa yal bar dor te /
analyzed: des na bum pas stong pa'i phyogs su dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i bum pa yal bar dor te /
translated: Thus, in a place empty of a pot, the pot, which is endowed with an object, is disregarded.

original: phyogs dang de'i dmigs pa nyid gzhal bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phyogs dang de'i dmigs pa nyid gzhal bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The place and its object are to be evaluated.

original: gal te bum pa med par the tshom za na des dben pa'i phyogs nyid nges par @33b mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bum pa med par the tshom za na des dben pa'i phyogs nyid nges par @33b mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But if one doubts the nonexistence of the pot, wouldn‚Äôt the place itself, which is devoid of that, be ascertained?

original: des dben pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / gal te phyogs kyi rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des dben pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / gal te phyogs kyi rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
translated: What is this called ‚Äúdevoid of that‚Äù? If it is the nature of the place,

original: nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: nges pa nyid do //
translated: it is just ascertained.

original: 'o na te bum pas stong pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na te bum pas stong pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the emptiness of the pot is the non-existence of the pot,

original: de ni nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: that is not certain, because

original: ma nges pa ni nyes pa ma yin te yul ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma nges pa ni nyes pa ma yin te yul ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: it is not a fault to be uncertain, since it is not the object.

original: 'o na ji ltar mi dmigs pa las dngos po med pa 'grub ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar mi dmigs pa las dngos po med pa 'grub ce na /
translated: But how is the non-existence of a thing established from non-apprehension?

original: brjod pa / gal te de lta yin pa de lta na yang 'di ni shes pa rnams kyi yod pa'i don nges na 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa / gal te de lta yin pa de lta na yang 'di ni shes pa rnams kyi yod pa'i don nges na 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: We reply: Even if that is so, it is certain that the existence of an object is known by cognitions.

original: gang gi tshe med pa med kyang 'bras bu dang ldan par dmigs par dran par gyur pa de'i 'bras bu la 'dod pa dang sdang ba dag gis 'di na bum pa yod dam zhes chu bcu ba dang dogs pa med par 'gro bar 'dod pas tshol ba de'i
analyzed: gang gi tshe med pa med kyang 'bras bu dang ldan par dmigs par dran par gyur pa de'i 'bras bu la 'dod pa dang sdang ba dag gis 'di na bum pa yod dam zhes chu bcu ba dang dogs pa med par 'gro bar 'dod pas tshol ba de'i
translated: When one remembers that a result is apprehended as being existent, even though it is not existent, then one who desires the result, whether with desire or aversion, will seek it, thinking, ‚ÄúIs the pot here?‚Äù or ‚ÄúIs it not?‚Äù

original: tshe bum pa dngos po med pa'i yul rtogs pa la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe bum pa dngos po med pa'i yul rtogs pa la ltos pa yin no //
translated: At that time, the apprehension of the non-existent pot depends on the object.

original: the tshom za ba dang phyin ci log la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: the tshom za ba dang phyin ci log la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of doubt and error.

original: des na rtogs pa la ltos pa 'di ni rtogs pa po rnams kyis byas pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rtogs pa la ltos pa 'di ni rtogs pa po rnams kyis byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this dependence on realization is done by the realizer.

original: bum pa med do zhes ma rtogs par dogs pa med par mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang / 'di ni rdul ma yin no zhes nya phyis mi nges pa'i phyir dang / mtho yor yin gyi skyes bu ni ma yin no zhes the tshom za ba med pa'i phyir de rtogs pa la ltos pa nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: bum pa med do zhes ma rtogs par dogs pa med par mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang / 'di ni rdul ma yin no zhes nya phyis mi nges pa'i phyir dang / mtho yor yin gyi skyes bu ni ma yin no zhes the tshom za ba med pa'i phyir de rtogs pa la ltos pa nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa dang /
translated: Because one does not engage in the absence of a pot without realizing the absence of a pot, because one does not ascertain a mother-of-pearl shell as not being a piece of silver, and because one does not doubt that a cairn is a man, the absence of a pot and so on are established by their very dependence on realization.

original: de rtogs pas rnam par gzhag par bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: de rtogs pas rnam par gzhag par bya bar brjod do //
translated: They are said to be established by the realization of that.

original: 'di ltar 'di dag gi dngos po med par rtogs pa ni dngos po gzhan du rnam par gnas pa'i gzhi can yin gyi dngos po rtogs pa ltar rang dbang du rang gi yul la 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dag gi dngos po med par rtogs pa ni dngos po gzhan du rnam par gnas pa'i gzhi can yin gyi dngos po rtogs pa ltar rang dbang du rang gi yul la 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the realization of the absence of these things is based on the presence of other things, but it is not that they engage their objects independently, as if they were realizing things.

original: ji ltar rang gi rgyus bskyed pa'i rtogs pas bum pa rtogs pa de bzhin du dngos po med pa yang med pa'i rtogs pa rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi rgyus bskyed pa'i rtogs pas bum pa rtogs pa de bzhin du dngos po med pa yang med pa'i rtogs pa rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as a pot is understood through the understanding of its cause, so too a non-entity is not understood through the understanding of non-existence.

original: gal te 'di na bltar rung ba'i bum pa yod na snang ba kho nar 'gyur na snang ba ni med do zhes rang dbang du mthong ba med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di na bltar rung ba'i bum pa yod na snang ba kho nar 'gyur na snang ba ni med do zhes rang dbang du mthong ba med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If a pot that can be seen here were to exist, it would surely be seen. But it is not seen. It is not established that there is no seeing without independent seeing.

original: phyogs de'i shes pa dag dngos po med pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyogs de'i shes pa dag dngos po med pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the cognitions of that place are not established as non-entities.

original: de tsam gyi mthar thug pa de'i mngon sum gyis de ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyi mthar thug pa de'i mngon sum gyis de ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the ultimate of mere non-seeing does not realize that through direct perception.

original: de'i tha snyad kyi rten yin pa'i phyir de dag dngos po med pa nyid do zhes nye bar btags pa tsam las dngos po de nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tha snyad kyi rten yin pa'i phyir de dag dngos po med pa nyid do zhes nye bar btags pa tsam las dngos po de nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the basis for the convention of that, they are merely imputed as non-entities. There is no non-existence of that entity itself.

original: gang gi phyogs dag pa dmigs pa bum pa dang bcas pa'i @34a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyogs dag pa dmigs pa bum pa dang bcas pa'i @34a * //
translated: In the case of the pure side, the object of observation is accompanied by a pot.

original: phyogs dmigs pa yin na bum pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs dmigs pa nyid du myong bar 'gyur ba zhig na phyogs tsam dmigs par myong ba yin no zhes dmigs pa gnyis gzhan nyid du nges pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: phyogs dmigs pa yin na bum pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs dmigs pa nyid du myong bar 'gyur ba zhig na phyogs tsam dmigs par myong ba yin no zhes dmigs pa gnyis gzhan nyid du nges pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the place were the object of the perception, then the place together with the pot would be the object of the perception. But it is only the place that is perceived. Thus, the two objects of perception are ascertained to be different.

original: nye bar mkho ba'i snying po can dgag pa'i don rtogs pa bzhin du med pa'i tha snyad byed pa nyid kyis mthar phyin par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: nye bar mkho ba'i snying po can dgag pa'i don rtogs pa bzhin du med pa'i tha snyad byed pa nyid kyis mthar phyin par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: At that time, the meaning of the negation, which is the essence of what is needed, is understood, and the expression ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is perfected.

original: 'di ni bum pa dang bcas pa dang cig shos kyi phyogs dmigs pa dag shes pa nyid yin te des na phyogs dmigs pa na shes pa cig shos dmigs pa dang ngang las gzhan nyid du shes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bum pa dang bcas pa dang cig shos kyi phyogs dmigs pa dag shes pa nyid yin te des na phyogs dmigs pa na shes pa cig shos dmigs pa dang ngang las gzhan nyid du shes pa kho na'o //
translated: This is because the place together with the pot and the place that is different from it are the objects of perception, and when the place is perceived, the other object of perception is known to be different from it.

original: sngon ma mthong ba sha za la sogs pa gang la shes pa med pa de la yang mthong ba las bzlog pa shes par bla ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sngon ma mthong ba sha za la sogs pa gang la shes pa med pa de la yang mthong ba las bzlog pa shes par bla ba'i phyir te /
translated: Even in the case of something not previously seen, such as a zombie, because of seeing it, the knowledge of it is known.

original: des na mthong ba'i dmigs pa mthong ba las bzlog pa'i dmigs pa las gzhan nyid du shes pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na mthong ba'i dmigs pa mthong ba las bzlog pa'i dmigs pa las gzhan nyid du shes pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the object of seeing is known to be different from the object that is the opposite of seeing.

original: gzhan du rtogs pa med pa rtogs pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du rtogs pa med pa rtogs pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not the case that the non-apprehension of difference is dependent on apprehension.

original: rang gi ngo bo kho nas bum pa snam bu las gzhan yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho nas bum pa snam bu las gzhan yin gyi /
translated: A pot is different from a cloth by virtue of its own nature.

original: 'di'i rang bzhin de dngos po med pas byas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin de dngos po med pas byas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that its nature is made non-existent.

original: de na rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin rtogs pa gzhan nyid du rtogs pa ni dngos po med par rtogs pa la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de na rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin rtogs pa gzhan nyid du rtogs pa ni dngos po med par rtogs pa la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of a nature of that kind as different is not dependent on the apprehension of non-existence.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pas na dngos po tha dad par grub pa'i phyir byis pa gang dag de 'gog par byed pa ma yin na tha dad par mi 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa de bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pas na dngos po tha dad par grub pa'i phyir byis pa gang dag de 'gog par byed pa ma yin na tha dad par mi 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa de bsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since direct perception is the means of valid cognition, the difference of entities is established. Thus, the thought of those who are childish, who think that if it is refuted, difference will not be established, is dispelled.

original: gal te dag pa dmigs pa cig shos dmigs pa la ltos nas gzhan yin la rag med /
analyzed: gal te dag pa dmigs pa cig shos dmigs pa la ltos nas gzhan yin la rag med /
translated: If the pure is different in dependence on the other, the observed object, then it is not independent.

original: gzhan nyid kyis na tha dad pa tsam du 'grub kyi gang gi tshe tha dad pa nyid kyis bum pa dmigs pa dngos po med par shes par bya ba de'i tshe ji ltar 'grub dmigs pa yod pa ni myong ba la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir dmigs pa gzhanüîΩmed pa las med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyis na tha dad pa tsam du 'grub kyi gang gi tshe tha dad pa nyid kyis bum pa dmigs pa dngos po med par shes par bya ba de'i tshe ji ltar 'grub dmigs pa yod pa ni myong ba la mi 'khrul pa'i phyir dmigs pa gzhan med pa las med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe existence of the observed object is not mistaken regarding experience. Therefore, the nonexistence of the other‚Äîthe nonexistence of the nonexistent object‚Äîis established,‚Äù

original: yod pa myong ba la 'khrul pa med pa med do zhes myong ba dmigs pa las 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: yod pa myong ba la 'khrul pa med pa med do zhes myong ba dmigs pa las 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: then if the nonexistence of the existent object is not mistaken regarding experience, the experience would be established from the observed object.

original: gang gi myong ba med pa las na med do zhes bya bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gi myong ba med pa las na med do zhes bya bar 'gyur ba /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe nonexistence of the nonexistent object is established from the nonexistence of experience,‚Äù

original: myong ba med pa go ga las rtogs /
analyzed: myong ba med pa go ga las rtogs /
translated: how could you understand the nonexistence of experience?

original: 'di de myong ba shes pa nyid yin pa des na de las bzlog pa myong ba yang shes pa nyid do zhe na bden te /
analyzed: 'di de myong ba shes pa nyid yin pa des na de las bzlog pa myong ba yang shes pa nyid do zhe na bden te /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe experience of that is itself consciousness. Therefore, the opposite of that‚Äîthe experience of the opposite of that‚Äîis also consciousness,‚Äù that is true.

original: myong ba dmigs na de las @34b bzlog pa de las gzhan nyid du rnam par 'jog pa na myong ba med pa yang gzhan nyid du rnam par 'jog pa yin na /
analyzed: myong ba dmigs na de las @34b bzlog pa de las gzhan nyid du rnam par 'jog pa na myong ba med pa yang gzhan nyid du rnam par 'jog pa yin na /
translated: If the observed object is experienced, when the opposite of that is posited as different from that, the nonexistence of experience is also posited as different from that.

original: gang gi tshe de nyid rtogs par bya ba de'i tshe rang 'dzin pa'i tshad ma med par ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid rtogs par bya ba de'i tshe rang 'dzin pa'i tshad ma med par ji ltar rtogs /
translated: When it is to be realized, at that time, how could it be realized without a valid cognition that apprehends it?üîΩTherefore, even though the existence of the vase and the existence of the observed object are established as different, nonexistence is not established.

original: des na bum pa dmigs pa phyogs dmigs pa yod pa dang gzhan nyid du grub kyang dngos po med pa nyid ni mi 'grub po zhe na re zhig bum pa dang ldan pa'i phyogs su ni bum pa dmigs pa phyogs dmigs pa las tha dad pa nyid maüîΩyin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: des na bum pa dmigs pa phyogs dmigs pa yod pa dang gzhan nyid du grub kyang dngos po med pa nyid ni mi 'grub po zhe na re zhig bum pa dang ldan pa'i phyogs su ni bum pa dmigs pa phyogs dmigs pa las tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: First, in the case of a place that possesses a vase, the observed object and the vase are not at all different.

original: de gnyis shes pa gcig gi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis shes pa gcig gi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because those two are the objects of a single consciousness.

original: des na bum pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs dmigs pa phyogs dag pa dmigs pa las tha dad par grub na /
analyzed: des na bum pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs dmigs pa phyogs dag pa dmigs pa las tha dad par grub na /
translated: Therefore, if the existence of the observed object in a place that possesses a vase were established as different from the observed object in a place that does not possess a vase,

original: de yod na de nyid de ltar gsal bar 'gyur ba zhig na rang bzhin gzhan du gsal ba yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po med par grub pa las gzhan ci zhig yin /
analyzed: de yod na de nyid de ltar gsal bar 'gyur ba zhig na rang bzhin gzhan du gsal ba yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po med par grub pa las gzhan ci zhig yin /
translated: then when it exists, it would be clearly manifest in that way. But since it is not clearly manifest, it is not established as different. Therefore, what else is there to establish as nonexistence?

original: 'o na myong ba tha dad pa gcig par mi nus pa gang yin pa de ji ltar med par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na myong ba tha dad pa gcig par mi nus pa gang yin pa de ji ltar med par shes par bya ste /
translated: But how can you know that the difference in experience is not real?

original: gzugs rig pa na sgra rig pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs rig pa na sgra rig pa yin no //
translated: When you perceive a form, you also perceive a sound.

original: 'di la ni gzhan nyid du grub kyang der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la ni gzhan nyid du grub kyang der 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if they were established as different, that would be so.

original: rig pa la 'khrul pa med pa las rig pa med pa'i phyir de med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rig pa la 'khrul pa med pa las rig pa med pa'i phyir de med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that the sound is not perceived because the perception is mistaken.

original: de med par ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de med par ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because its nonexistence is not established.üîΩIn response, Aryadeva says:

original: brjod pa // der yang smyo ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs ma gtogs par sgra rig pa yod na dmigs pa'i yul las mi 'da' ste des na gnas skabs de ma yin par grub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brjod pa // der yang smyo ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs ma gtogs par sgra rig pa yod na dmigs pa'i yul las mi 'da' ste des na gnas skabs de ma yin par grub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Even in that case, if the sound is perceived, except in the case of insanity, fainting, and so on, it is not beyond the range of perception. Therefore, in order to establish that the sound is not perceived,

original: rig pa gzhan dmigs pa la ltos par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rig pa gzhan dmigs pa la ltos par bya ba yin no //
translated: the perception of another object must be taken into account.

original: des na rig pa yod na ngas dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes rig pa gzhan rtogs par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: des na rig pa yod na ngas dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes rig pa gzhan rtogs par shes par bya ste /
translated: Thus, if the perception of a form exists, the perception of a sound must be understood to exist as well.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa dgag par bya ba'i rig pa gzhan med par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa dgag par bya ba'i rig pa gzhan med par nges pa yin no //
translated: It is certain that there is no other cognition that can be refuted as having the nature of an object.

original: de lta yin dang 'di ltar rtogs so //
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'di ltar rtogs so //
translated: It is understood in this way.

original: gzugs mthong ba'am rnam par rtog pa na sgra rtogs pa yod na gnyis dmigs pa nges pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba'am rnam par rtog pa na sgra rtogs pa yod na gnyis dmigs pa nges pa yin la /
translated: When one sees or conceives of form, if the cognition of sound exists, the apprehension of two is certain.

original: gcig dmigs pa ni de las gzhan yin no //
analyzed: gcig dmigs pa ni de las gzhan yin no //
translated: The apprehension of one is different from that.

original: des na rtogs pa cig shos yod na gnyis pa nges pa dang / dmigs pa gcig med pa yang nges par bya ste /
analyzed: des na rtogs pa cig shos yod na gnyis pa nges pa dang / dmigs pa gcig med pa yang nges par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, if the other cognition exists, the second is certain, and the non-existence of the apprehension of one is also certain.

original: gal te 'di la dmigs pa gzhan yod na dmigs par 'gyur na gcig dmigs pa yang yin no zhes gzhan du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di la dmigs pa gzhan yod na dmigs par 'gyur na gcig dmigs pa yang yin no zhes gzhan du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were another object of apprehension here, it would be apprehended, but it is apprehended as one. Thus it is understood as different.

original: @35a * // des na ji ltar dmigs pa gzhan dmigs pa myong ba med pa na de yod pa mi srid pa de bzhin du phyogs bum pa dang bcas pa dmigs pa las gzhan dmigs pa yod na yang de yod mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: @35a * // des na ji ltar dmigs pa gzhan dmigs pa myong ba med pa na de yod pa mi srid pa de bzhin du phyogs bum pa dang bcas pa dmigs pa las gzhan dmigs pa yod na yang de yod mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, just as the existence of another object of apprehension is impossible when the experience of the apprehension of that does not exist, in the same way, if the apprehension of another exists in the apprehension of the vase and the place, the existence of that is impossible.

original: ji ltar gal te yod na dmigs pa zhig na dmigs pa yang med do zhes med pa nyid du nges pa de bzhin du gal te yod na de'i bdag nyid du dmigs pa zhig rang gi bdag nyid du yang dmigs so zhes med pa nyid du 'grub pa
analyzed: ji ltar gal te yod na dmigs pa zhig na dmigs pa yang med do zhes med pa nyid du nges pa de bzhin du gal te yod na de'i bdag nyid du dmigs pa zhig rang gi bdag nyid du yang dmigs so zhes med pa nyid du 'grub pa
translated: Just as it is ascertained that it does not exist if it is nonexistent, in the same way, if it exists, it is ascertained that it is not perceived in its own nature, because it is perceived in the nature of something else.

original: kho na'o // 'dir ni 'di bsam par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: kho na'o // 'dir ni 'di bsam par bya ba yin te /
translated: Here, this should be considered:

original: ci dmigs pa med pa nyid med pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'i rten yin nam 'on te dmigs pa gzhan nyid yin /
analyzed: ci dmigs pa med pa nyid med pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'i rten yin nam 'on te dmigs pa gzhan nyid yin /
translated: Is the absence of the object the basis for the understanding of nonexistence, or is it another object?

original: de la dmigs pa gzhan las ni gzhan dmigs pa med pa nyid rtogs par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa gzhan las ni gzhan dmigs pa med pa nyid rtogs par mi 'thad de /
translated: If it is another object, it is not tenable that the absence of the object is understood from another object,

original: de de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not its nature and because there is no relation between them.

original: 'o na te de yod na de'i bdag nyid du dmigs par thal ba zhig na rang gi bdag nyid du yang dmigs pas so zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'di nyid kyis med par sgrub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na te de yod na de'i bdag nyid du dmigs par thal ba zhig na rang gi bdag nyid du yang dmigs pas so zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'di nyid kyis med par sgrub po zhe na /
translated: But if it is the nature of that, it follows that it is perceived in its own nature, because it is perceived in the nature of something else. This very argument establishes nonexistence.

original: de lta na yang yul bkag pas tshad ma nyid bkag pa na rtogs pa tsam grub pa nyid kyi mthar thug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang yul bkag pas tshad ma nyid bkag pa na rtogs pa tsam grub pa nyid kyi mthar thug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when a valid cognition is refuted by the refutation of its object, the ultimate is reduced to mere understanding.

original: des na rtogs pa tsam gyi mthar thug pa can sgrub par byed pa ni ji ltar ston par 'gyur ba bzhin du tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no //üîΩ'o na de nyid yin la rag mod ce na de ltar yang mi nus te /
analyzed: des na rtogs pa tsam gyi mthar thug pa can sgrub par byed pa ni ji ltar ston par 'gyur ba bzhin du tha snyad sgrub par byed pa yin no // 'o na de nyid yin la rag mod ce na de ltar yang mi nus te /
translated: Therefore, the proof that has the ultimate of mere understanding is a proof of a nominal existent, just as it is taught.üîΩWell then, it is just that!

original: 'di ltar der yang rtogs pa de yod pa ni dngos po gzhan nyid rnam par gnas pa'i gzhi can kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar der yang rtogs pa de yod pa ni dngos po gzhan nyid rnam par gnas pa'i gzhi can kho na'o //
translated: But that is not possible, because in that case, the existence of that understanding is based on the mere presence of another thing.

original: gang gi tshe gzhan gzhan la sgro btags te de'i bdag nyid tsam dmigs pas rnam par phye nas ci zhes der rnam par rtog par byed pa de'i tshe med do snyam pa'i shes pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzhan gzhan la sgro btags te de'i bdag nyid tsam dmigs pas rnam par phye nas ci zhes der rnam par rtog par byed pa de'i tshe med do snyam pa'i shes pa skye ba yin no //
translated: When one superimposes another on another, and then observes the mere identity of that, and then analyzes, thinking, ‚ÄúWhat is it?‚Äù at that time, the consciousness that thinks, ‚ÄúIt does not exist,‚Äù arises.

original: de'i phyir dngos po gzhan nyid med pa nyid du sgro btags pa'i tha snyad du bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po gzhan nyid med pa nyid du sgro btags pa'i tha snyad du bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is a conventional activity that superimposes the nonexistence of another thing,

original: gzhan dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs par brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs par brjod do //
translated: but rather that the non-observation of something else is expressed as the non-observation of that.

original: des na bsam pa 'dis na ci ste gzhan dmigs pas mi dmigs pa 'grub pas mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyis 'grub po zhe na zhes bshad do //
analyzed: des na bsam pa 'dis na ci ste gzhan dmigs pas mi dmigs pa 'grub pas mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyis 'grub po zhe na zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, what is the point of this idea that non-observation is established by direct perception, since the non-observation of something else is established by the observation of something else?

original: des na rigs pa khyad par med pa'i phyir don med pa yang ci ste mi 'grub ces bshad pa ni /
analyzed: des na rigs pa khyad par med pa'i phyir don med pa yang ci ste mi 'grub ces bshad pa ni /
translated: Thus, since the reasoning is the same, why is the non-existence of something not established?

original: de bzhin du gzhan yod pas kyang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yod pas kyang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, the existence of something else is also like this.

original: bum pa ni dmigs pa'i @35b mtshan nyid du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: bum pa ni dmigs pa'i @35b mtshan nyid du gyur pa yin te /
translated: A pot is the observed object-universal.

original: des na phyogs bum pa dang bcas pa yin na bum pa dang bcas pa nyid du snang ba nges pa yin pa'i phyir phyogs tsam du snang ba na bum pa dang bcas pa dang / bum pa med pa gnyis bzhin du rnam par gnas pa na /
analyzed: des na phyogs bum pa dang bcas pa yin na bum pa dang bcas pa nyid du snang ba nges pa yin pa'i phyir phyogs tsam du snang ba na bum pa dang bcas pa dang / bum pa med pa gnyis bzhin du rnam par gnas pa na /
translated: Therefore, if the place is occupied by a pot, it is ascertained as appearing as occupied by a pot. Thus, when the place alone appears, it appears as if it were either occupied by a pot or not occupied by a pot.

original: ji ltar bum pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs tsam las gzhan yin zhing phyogs tsam yang bum pa dang bcas pa las gzhan no zhes phan tshun rang bzhin bzlog pa phan tshun gyi rang bzhin las gzhan yin pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du de gnyis kyi
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs tsam las gzhan yin zhing phyogs tsam yang bum pa dang bcas pa las gzhan no zhes phan tshun rang bzhin bzlog pa phan tshun gyi rang bzhin las gzhan yin pa'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du de gnyis kyi
translated: Just as a place that is occupied by a pot is different from a place that is not occupied by a pot, and a place that is not occupied by a pot is different from a place that is occupied by a pot, and the difference between them is posited as the mutual exclusion of each, in the same way,

original: dngos po med pa yang gzhan nyid kyi rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang gzhan nyid kyi rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: the nonexistence of that thing is also posited as a difference.

original: de'i rang bzhin de'i rang bzhin las bzlog pa gzhan yin pa yang rang gi ldog pa tsam gyi rang bzhin nam rang bzhin gzhan dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de'i rang bzhin las bzlog pa gzhan yin pa yang rang gi ldog pa tsam gyi rang bzhin nam rang bzhin gzhan dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The nature of that nonexistence is the exclusion of that thing, and it is the nature of the mere exclusion of that thing or it is the nature of the thing that is different from that.

original: de'i rang bzhin ldog pa ni de'i rang bzhin las bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ldog pa ni de'i rang bzhin las bzlog pa yin te /
translated: The exclusion of the nature of that thing is the exclusion of the nature of that thing.

original: rang bzhin gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan bzhin no //
translated: It is like the nature of a different thing.

original: des ni ji ltar phyogs tsam las bum pa dang bcas pa gzhan yin pa de bzhin du de'i dngos po med pa yang yin te /
analyzed: des ni ji ltar phyogs tsam las bum pa dang bcas pa gzhan yin pa de bzhin du de'i dngos po med pa yang yin te /
translated: Therefore, just as a place that is occupied by a pot is different from a place that is not occupied by a pot, in the same way, the nonexistence of that thing is also different from the thing.

original: des na bum pa dang bcas pa la de'i ngo bo ldog pa de med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na bum pa dang bcas pa la de'i ngo bo ldog pa de med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the negation of the nature of the pot would not exist in the place that contains the pot.

original: de bzhin du ji ltar phyogs tsam bum pa dang ldan pa las gzhan yin pa de bzhin du bum pa dang bcas pa ma yin par yang 'gyur ba'i phyir phyogs tsam la de med pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar phyogs tsam bum pa dang ldan pa las gzhan yin pa de bzhin du bum pa dang bcas pa ma yin par yang 'gyur ba'i phyir phyogs tsam la de med pa yin te /
translated: In the same way, just as the place that contains a part of the pot is different from the pot, so the place that does not contain the pot would also be different from the pot, and therefore the negation of the pot would not exist in the place that contains a part of the pot.

original: gnyi ga yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are different.

original: des na dngos po rtogs pa na gnyi ga gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dngos po rtogs pa na gnyi ga gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when an entity is perceived, both are posited as different.

original: de'i rang bzhin las bzlog pa gzhan nyid du rnam par gnas pa na de'i rang bzhin bzlog pa dang / rang bzhin gzhan med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin las bzlog pa gzhan nyid du rnam par gnas pa na de'i rang bzhin bzlog pa dang / rang bzhin gzhan med pa yin no //
translated: When the negation of the nature of the pot is posited as different from the pot, the negation of the nature of the pot and the existence of another nature are both negated.

original: gal te dngos po med pa de la rang bzhin rtogs pa ni yongs su gcod pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa de la rang bzhin rtogs pa ni yongs su gcod pa yin la /
translated: If the nature of the non-entity is understood, it is a determination.

original: gzhan nyid du rnam par 'jog pa rnam par gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du rnam par 'jog pa rnam par gcod pa yin no //
translated: The positing of difference is an exclusion.

original: der yang gzhan rang bzhin dang ldan pa ni rang gi tshad mas kyang rtogs kyi dngos po med pa rtogs pa ni rang gi tshad ma la brten pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: der yang gzhan rang bzhin dang ldan pa ni rang gi tshad mas kyang rtogs kyi dngos po med pa rtogs pa ni rang gi tshad ma la brten pa ma yin no ;
translated: Moreover, the existence of something in another is understood by means of one‚Äôs own valid cognition, but the understanding of a non-existent thing is not based on one‚Äôs own valid cognition.

original: / gal te dngos po med pa ma rtogs na rtogs pa 'di ji ltar yin zhe na 'di la bshad zin to //
analyzed: / gal te dngos po med pa ma rtogs na rtogs pa 'di ji ltar yin zhe na 'di la bshad zin to //
translated: If one does not understand the non-existent, how is this understanding? This has been explained.

original: mthong ba las bzlog pa ni gnyi ga ltar yang rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba las bzlog pa ni gnyi ga ltar yang rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the opposite of seeing is understood in both ways.

original: rnam par bcad pa rang gi tshad mas bzung bas ni ci yang byar med do //
analyzed: rnam par bcad pa rang gi tshad mas bzung bas ni ci yang byar med do //
translated: By apprehending the exclusion through one‚Äôs own valid cognition, nothing is done.

original: rtogs pa nyid la de ltar 'gyur ba'i @36a * //
analyzed: rtogs pa nyid la de ltar 'gyur ba'i @36a * //
translated: Because it would be like that in understanding itself.

original: phyir ro // rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang 'jig pa rtogs pa na yang dngos po med pa rtogs pa yod pa nyid 'on kyang de gzhal bya'i mthar thug pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyir ro // rjes su 'gro ba med pa dang 'jig pa rtogs pa na yang dngos po med pa rtogs pa yod pa nyid 'on kyang de gzhal bya'i mthar thug pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ni ma yin no //
translated: Even when understanding the absence of continuation and destruction, the understanding of non-existence exists. However, because that is not the ultimate object, it is not a valid cognition.

original: tha snyad ni med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: tha snyad ni med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba nyid du bstan to //
translated: Convention is taught to be established because it does not occur without it.

original: 'dir yang bdag nyid gcig rtogs pa na nge gzhan gyi bdag nyid yin pa rnam par gcod pa la mngon sum nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang bdag nyid gcig rtogs pa na nge gzhan gyi bdag nyid yin pa rnam par gcod pa la mngon sum nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: Here, when one nature is realized, the exclusion of its other nature is direct perception itself, which is valid knowledge.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gal te gcig yongs su bcad pa nyid kyis gzhan rnam par bcad pa 'grub na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gal te gcig yongs su bcad pa nyid kyis gzhan rnam par bcad pa 'grub na /
translated: For this very reason, if the exclusion of other is established by the determination of one,

original: khyad par med pas de las gzhan thams cad med par 'grub par 'gyur gyi mtshungs par rung ba'i rang bzhin kho na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par med pas de las gzhan thams cad med par 'grub par 'gyur gyi mtshungs par rung ba'i rang bzhin kho na ni ma yin no //
translated: then, since there is no distinction, all that is different from that would be established as nonexistent, not just those of a similar nature.

original: khyad par brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtsod pa bkod de de'i bdag nyid nges par snang ba'i shes pas gcig gi bdag nyid yongs su bcad pa las de de'i bdag nyid yin pa rnam par bcad par 'gyur ro zhes rnam
analyzed: khyad par brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtsod pa bkod de de'i bdag nyid nges par snang ba'i shes pas gcig gi bdag nyid yongs su bcad pa las de de'i bdag nyid yin pa rnam par bcad par 'gyur ro zhes rnam
translated: The opponent presents the argument, The distinction cannot be expressed, and so on. He says that by the cognition that definitely appears as that very nature, the determination of one nature excludes its being of that nature.

original: gcod yongs gcod gnyis tshad ma gcig gis byed pa yin par bsgrub pa de'i phyir de ltar dmigs pas de de las gzhan gyi bdag nyid yin pa rnam par bcad par 'gyur ro zhes mjug bsdus bsngal pa yin no //
analyzed: gcod yongs gcod gnyis tshad ma gcig gis byed pa yin par bsgrub pa de'i phyir de ltar dmigs pas de de las gzhan gyi bdag nyid yin pa rnam par bcad par 'gyur ro zhes mjug bsdus bsngal pa yin no //
translated: The conclusion is: ‚ÄúTherefore, by observing that, the exclusion of its being of a nature other than that is established.‚Äù

original: de'i yul dang dus dag tu gzhan gyi dngos po thams cad bkag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams te de'i phyir 'ga' zhig tu 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'ga' zhig dgag pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis mi dmigs pa las yin no zhes
analyzed: de'i yul dang dus dag tu gzhan gyi dngos po thams cad bkag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams te de'i phyir 'ga' zhig tu 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'ga' zhig dgag pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis mi dmigs pa las yin no zhes
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúIt is not the case that all other entities are negated in terms of their place and time‚Äù and ending with ‚ÄúTherefore, the negation of something in some place and at some time is from non-observation in the manner explained‚Äù

original: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i yul la ni mi snang ba mi dmigs pa'i byed pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i yul la ni mi snang ba mi dmigs pa'i byed pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: is an explanation of the non-observation of the non-appearing object.

original: des na dngos po ni gcig gi rang bzhin du nges pa nyid du nyams su myong bas rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dngos po ni gcig gi rang bzhin du nges pa nyid du nyams su myong bas rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nature of an entity is ascertained and experienced.

original: gang gi tshe bltar rung ba 'am mi rung ba'i rang bzhin gzhan gyis du ma'i rang bzhin du dogs pa na gcig du mar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes rang bzhin gcig nyams su myong ba nyid kyis 'gog go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bltar rung ba 'am mi rung ba'i rang bzhin gzhan gyis du ma'i rang bzhin du dogs pa na gcig du mar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes rang bzhin gcig nyams su myong ba nyid kyis 'gog go //
