analyzed: rnam pa'i bye brag de nyid bshad pa ni 'gal dang 'bras bu dag ces bya'o //
translated: The specific types of that are explained as ‚Äúcontradictory and effects.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba nyid ni rang nyid 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid ni rang nyid 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Contradictory will be explained in its own context.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba yang ltos pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba yang ltos pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: An ‚Äúeffect‚Äù is also a type of dependence.

original: des na gang gis 'bras bu zhes ltos pa dang bcas pa ni skabs su bab pa'i 'gal ba nyid la ltos par bya ba yin no //üîΩdes na 'gal ba dang 'bras bu @42a * //
analyzed: des na gang gis 'bras bu zhes ltos pa dang bcas pa ni skabs su bab pa'i 'gal ba nyid la ltos par bya ba yin no // des na 'gal ba dang 'bras bu @42a * //
translated: Therefore, that which is called an ‚Äúeffect‚Äù and is dependent must be dependent on the contradictory in this context.üîΩTherefore, it is said that ‚Äúcontradictory and effects‚Äù are established.

original: dag grub ces bya ba ni 'gal ba dmigs pa dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dag grub ces bya ba ni 'gal ba dmigs pa dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The contradictory is observed and the effect of the contradictory is observed.

original: rgyu dang ngo bo khyab par byed par ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang ngo bo khyab par byed par ma grub pa'o //
translated: The cause, nature, and pervader are not established.

original: bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is suitable to appear‚Äù is the distinguishing factor.

original: med don zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya bstan pa'o //
analyzed: med don zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe object of negation‚Äù indicates the predicate.

original: de ltar na tha snyad kyi don can nyid bsal ba yin no zhes bya bar ni mi nus te /
analyzed: de ltar na tha snyad kyi don can nyid bsal ba yin no zhes bya bar ni mi nus te /
translated: Thus, it is not possible to eliminate the object of conventional expressions.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyams pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyams pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because the nonobservation of a nature is undermined.

original: gcig nyid la sgrub pa dang dgag pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid la sgrub pa dang dgag pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to affirm and deny the same thing.

original: dngos po med pa grub pa ni de rtogs pa yod pa med na ni mi 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa grub pa ni de rtogs pa yod pa med na ni mi 'byung ba yin la /
translated: The establishment of non-existence is that it does not occur when the cognition of it does not exist.

original: tha snyad kyang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad kyang de nyid yin no //
translated: And that is the conventional.

original: des na dgag par mi nus pas bsdu ba nyid rigs so //
analyzed: des na dgag par mi nus pas bsdu ba nyid rigs so //
translated: Therefore, since it cannot be denied, it is reasonable to include it.

original: mi dmigs pa nying rjes su 'jug pa de'i rnam pa nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir dgag pa gang ji snyed pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nying rjes su 'jug pa de'i rnam pa nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir dgag pa gang ji snyed pa zhes smos so //
translated: Since non-apprehension is the very form of engagement, in order to establish the text, he says, ‚Äúwhatever negations there are.

original: med na mi 'byung ba'i rtags kyis ni dgag pa dang rjes su dpag par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba'i rtags kyis ni dgag pa dang rjes su dpag par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: By the reason of non-occurrence, negation cannot be inferred,

original: ngo bo med pas yul gyi dngos por 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo med pas yul gyi dngos por 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for a non-entity to be an object.

original: 'on te gzhan gyi dngos pos bdag nyid kyang med pa rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi dngos pos bdag nyid kyang med pa rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the absence of another entity is to be inferred,

original: dngos po gzhan rtogs pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan rtogs pa nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: then the cognition of another entity would occur,

original: dgag pa rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the cognition of negation.

original: 'on te gang rtogs pa na med do zhes rtogs par 'gyur ba'i gzhan gyi dngos po rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gang rtogs pa na med do zhes rtogs par 'gyur ba'i gzhan gyi dngos po rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is inferred that the other thing does not exist when it is realized,

original: 'o na de ni gang yod na med do zhes rtogs pa yod par mi 'thad pa de lta bu las rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na de ni gang yod na med do zhes rtogs pa yod par mi 'thad pa de lta bu las rtogs pa yin no //
translated: then it is realized that it does not exist when it exists, and that is not tenable.

original: de lta yin dang rtogs par bya ba bzhin du rtogs par byed pa de mi mthun pa'i zla bo nyid do //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rtogs par bya ba bzhin du rtogs par byed pa de mi mthun pa'i zla bo nyid do //
translated: If that were so, then the realizer would be just like the realized, and it would not be its opposite.

original: mi mthun pa'i zla ma yin pa gzhan yod par rtogs pas ni med do zhes bya bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i zla ma yin pa gzhan yod par rtogs pas ni med do zhes bya bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But when the opposite of the non-opposite is realized, it is not the case that it is realized that it does not exist.

original: mi mthun pa'i zla bo yang de yod na de mi 'thad pa nyid yin pa'i de ni de rtogs par byed pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i zla bo yang de yod na de mi 'thad pa nyid yin pa'i de ni de rtogs par byed pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And the opposite is not tenable when it exists, so it is not the realizer of that.

original: de lta ma yin na rtogs par byed pa nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rtogs par byed pa nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, it would not be established as the realizer.

original: gang yod na de yang mi srid pa de yod na de dmigs pa yod mi srid pa'i phyir de dmigs pa med pa yang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang yod na de yang mi srid pa de yod na de dmigs pa yod mi srid pa'i phyir de dmigs pa med pa yang de nyid yin no //
translated: If that exists, then that is impossible, and if that is impossible, then the observation of that is impossible.üîΩTherefore, the non-observation of that is just that.

original: de na dgag pa ji snyed pa de thams cad ni mi dmigs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de na dgag pa ji snyed pa de thams cad ni mi dmigs pa kho na yin no //
translated: And whatever is a negation is only a non-observation.

original: da ni tha na shes pa med pa rtogs pa na mngon sum ji ltar mi dmigs pa yin /
analyzed: da ni tha na shes pa med pa rtogs pa na mngon sum ji ltar mi dmigs pa yin /
translated: Now, when even the absence of consciousness is cognized, how can there be non-observation of perception?

original: 'di ni dgag pa ma yin pa ma yin na de ji ltar dgag pa gang ji snyed pa dmigs pa las yin zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'di ni dgag pa ma yin pa ma yin na de ji ltar dgag pa gang ji snyed pa dmigs pa las yin zhes brjod ce na /
translated: If this is not a negation, then how can it be said that all negations are from the observation of something else?

original: brjod pa gang gis mngon sum gyis kyang dgag par @42b 'gyur ba la mngon sum dngos po med pa rtogs par byed pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang dngos po gzhan gyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: brjod pa gang gis mngon sum gyis kyang dgag par @42b 'gyur ba la mngon sum dngos po med pa rtogs par byed pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang dngos po gzhan gyi mtshan nyid tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: We say that even a negation is from perception, but perception does not cognize the non-existence of a thing, but rather the difference in characteristics of another thing.

original: dngos po med pa ni rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The absence of a thing cannot be cognized.

original: gang gi don du 'di rtogs pa de ni de rtogs pa med kyang 'grub ste /
analyzed: gang gi don du 'di rtogs pa de ni de rtogs pa med kyang 'grub ste /
translated: And the purpose for which this is cognized is accomplished even without cognizing it.

original: bum pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs las phyogs tsam gzhan du grub nas /
analyzed: bum pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs las phyogs tsam gzhan du grub nas /
translated: Because it is possible to go without fear from a place with a pot to a place just a little bit different,

original: dogs pa med par 'gro ba dang / chu bcu ba don du gnyer ba'i 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dogs pa med par 'gro ba dang / chu bcu ba don du gnyer ba'i 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it is possible to engage in and disengage from the activity of seeking to draw water.

original: des na med pa rtogs pas ni ci yang byar med de /
analyzed: des na med pa rtogs pas ni ci yang byar med de /
translated: Therefore, when one understands nonexistence, nothing can be done,

original: dngos po gzhan rtogs pa nyid kyis de'i 'bras bu grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan rtogs pa nyid kyis de'i 'bras bu grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mere understanding of another thing establishes its effect.

original: de rtogs pa na med do snyam pa'i rtogs pa mthong ba las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin sgro 'dogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par skye ba de'i tha snyad kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de yang gzhan nyid la the tshom mi za ba na mngon sum nyidüîΩlas skye ba yin te /
analyzed: de rtogs pa na med do snyam pa'i rtogs pa mthong ba las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin sgro 'dogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par skye ba de'i tha snyad kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de yang gzhan nyid la the tshom mi za ba na mngon sum nyid las skye ba yin te /
translated: When one understands that, the result of the convention that arises from the conceptual thought that superimposes the nature that is the opposite of the understanding ‚Äúit does not exist‚Äù is undoubtably born from direct perception.

original: gang gi phyir gcig dmigs nyams su myong ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig dmigs nyams su myong ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained by ‚Äúbecause of the experience of the observation of one.‚Äù

original: de ltar ma yin na myong pas yul du ma byas ba rnam par rtog pas mi nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na myong pas yul du ma byas ba rnam par rtog pas mi nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then that which is not experienced as an object could not be apprehended by conceptual cognition.

original: des na mngon sum ni dgag pa grub pas mthar phyin pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na mngon sum ni dgag pa grub pas mthar phyin pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, perception is not a means of valid cognition that has reached the ultimate in the establishment of negation.

original: 'on kyang gzhan ni rab tu sgrub par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan ni rab tu sgrub par byed pa nyid do //
translated: However, it is the means of valid cognition that establishes the existence of something else.

original: rjes su dpag pa nyid sgrub pa'i byed pa dgag pa'i mthar thug pa nyid de bya ba'i rtogs pas mthar 'byin pa'i phyir gzhan yod pa ni mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nyid sgrub pa'i byed pa dgag pa'i mthar thug pa nyid de bya ba'i rtogs pas mthar 'byin pa'i phyir gzhan yod pa ni mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa nyid do //
translated: Inference is the means of valid cognition that has reached the ultimate in the establishment of negation, because it is the means of valid cognition that brings about the realization of the object to be established by negation. The existence of something else is established by perception itself.

original: der dgag pa 'jug pa ni gzhan yod pa tshad ma'i yul du gyur pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: der dgag pa 'jug pa ni gzhan yod pa tshad ma'i yul du gyur pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The engagement of negation there is the non-occurrence of the existence of something else that is the object of a means of valid cognition.

original: dngos po med pa sgrub pa'i phyir khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa la sogs pa gang du gzhan yod pa bsgrub par bya ba yang dgag pa'i sgo nyid kyis de 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa sgrub pa'i phyir khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa la sogs pa gang du gzhan yod pa bsgrub par bya ba yang dgag pa'i sgo nyid kyis de 'jug pa yin no //
translated: In order to establish the non-existence of a thing, the establishment of the existence of something else by the means of valid cognition of non-apprehension of something that can be apprehended, etc., which are the differentiators, is also by the door of negation.

original: des na sgrub pa'i byed pa dgag pas mthar phyin pa can gang yin pa de ni mi dmigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na sgrub pa'i byed pa dgag pas mthar phyin pa can gang yin pa de ni mi dmigs pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, that which is perfected by the negation of the activity of proof is only non-apprehension.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par nges pa'i /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par nges pa'i /
translated: For this very reason, the Vini≈õcayasa·πÉgrahaüîΩsays, ‚ÄúWhen one negates something here, it is not proper to do so by means of direct perception.‚Äù

original: 'di 'ga' zhig tu dgag par byed pa na mngon sum gyis ni bya bar 'os pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'i bar du de yang legs par drangs par 'gyur ro //üîΩji skad bshad pa nyid kyi dngos po gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir 'di ltar zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di 'ga' zhig tu dgag par byed pa na mngon sum gyis ni bya bar 'os pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'i bar du de yang legs par drangs par 'gyur ro // ji skad bshad pa nyid kyi dngos po gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir 'di ltar zhes smos so //
translated: This is well cited.

original: dgag pa de ni rnam pa gnyis kyis byed de dngos po 'ga' zhig bsgrub pas /üîΩde yod par rtogs pas sam /
analyzed: dgag pa de ni rnam pa gnyis kyis byed de dngos po 'ga' zhig bsgrub pas / de yod par rtogs pas sam /
translated: That negation is done in two ways: by proving some existent thing,üîΩone understands that it exists;

original: dgag pa ste med par rtogs @43a * //
analyzed: dgag pa ste med par rtogs @43a * //
translated: or by negation, one understands that it does not exist,

original: pas te rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pas te rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other way.

original: rnam pa gzhan med pa nyid kyis gzhan yod pas med pa rtogs pa na gzhan de 'gal ba'am mi 'gal ba zhig yin zhes bsgrubs na ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan med pa nyid kyis gzhan yod pas med pa rtogs pa na gzhan de 'gal ba'am mi 'gal ba zhig yin zhes bsgrubs na ni zhes smos so //
translated: If one establishes that when one understands non-existence by the very absence of another mode, is that other mode contradictory or non-contradictory?

original: re zhig phyogs phyi ma ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: re zhig phyogs phyi ma ni mi 'thad de /
translated: First, the latter position is untenable.

original: gang gi phyir mi 'gal ba bsgrubs na ni bkag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi 'gal ba bsgrubs na ni bkag pa ma yin no //
translated: If you prove that they are not contradictory, then they are not refuted.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lhan cig yod par 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig yod par 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no contradiction in their co-existence.

original: de gnyis lhan cig gnas par yod pa 'thad pa'i phyir ji ltar de dag las gcig gis gzhan 'gog par 'gyur /
analyzed: de gnyis lhan cig gnas par yod pa 'thad pa'i phyir ji ltar de dag las gcig gis gzhan 'gog par 'gyur /
translated: Because it is tenable that those two exist together, how could one of them refute the other?

original: 'gal ba sgrub pa yang mi dmigs pa med par 'gal ba mi rtogs so //
analyzed: 'gal ba sgrub pa yang mi dmigs pa med par 'gal ba mi rtogs so //
translated: Also, without non-observation of a contradictory object, a contradiction is not ascertained.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: 'gal ba bsgrub pa ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba bsgrub pa ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The proof of a contradiction is a reason that refutes.

original: des na 'gal ba yod pa gzhan med pa rtogs pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: des na 'gal ba yod pa gzhan med pa rtogs pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Therefore, the existence of a contradiction is a reason that ascertains the nonexistence of another.

original: de yang 'gal ba nyid kyis de dang mi mthun pa'i zla bor ni de rtogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de yang 'gal ba nyid kyis de dang mi mthun pa'i zla bor ni de rtogs pa nyid de /
translated: Moreover, by the contradiction itself, the contradictory object is ascertained.

original: de yod na de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if it exists, that does not exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dgag pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dgag pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: For that very reason, it becomes a reason that refutes that.

original: gang gi phyir dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin pa de nyid kyi phyir de dang mi mthun pa'i zla nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin pa de nyid kyi phyir de dang mi mthun pa'i zla nyid kyang yin no //
translated: Because it is a logical argument for negation, it is also the contradictory of that.

original: ji ltar 'gal ba'i phyir de yod pa dang mi mthun pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gal ba'i phyir de yod pa dang mi mthun pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it is contradictory because it is incompatible with existence,

original: de dmigs pa dang mi mthun pa dag kyang yin no //
analyzed: de dmigs pa dang mi mthun pa dag kyang yin no //
translated: it is also incompatible with the observation of that.

original: de yod na de med pa'i phyir de dang 'gal ba de de med par sgrub par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de yod na de med pa'i phyir de dang 'gal ba de de med par sgrub par byed pa yin la /
translated: Because it does not exist when that exists, that which is contradictory with it establishes the nonexistence of that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de de dang mi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de de dang mi mthun pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is incompatible with that.

original: de yod na de dmigs pa yang med pa yin te /
analyzed: de yod na de dmigs pa yang med pa yin te /
translated: When that exists, the observation of that does not exist.

original: de nye bar gnas na de bzhin du de dmigs pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nye bar gnas na de bzhin du de dmigs pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when it is present, the observation of that does not exist in that way.

original: de ltar de dmigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de ltar de dmigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it the observation of that,

original: ji srid du de yod na de med do zhes rtogs par bya ba'i phyir do mi dmigs pa la yang ltos par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji srid du de yod na de med do zhes rtogs par bya ba'i phyir do mi dmigs pa la yang ltos par bya ba yin no //
translated: but as long as that exists, it is also incompatible with the nonexistence of that, because it is to be understood that it is not observed.

original: de yod pa dmigs pa dang mi mthun pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gzhung gzugs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yod pa dmigs pa dang mi mthun pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir gzhung gzugs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the existence of that is incompatible with the observation of that, he states, ‚Äúit is not so.‚Äù

original: rgyun chags par 'jug pa can 'byung ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir 'gal bar rtogs so //
analyzed: rgyun chags par 'jug pa can 'byung ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir 'gal bar rtogs so //
translated: One should understand that the absence of the entity that arises in a continuous process is incompatible with the existence of that.

original: rgyun chags par 'jug pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir de'i rgyu mtshan smos pa ni rgyu ma gtugs pa can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun chags par 'jug pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir de'i rgyu mtshan smos pa ni rgyu ma gtugs pa can zhes bya'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate that very continuous process, he states, ‚Äúthe cause of which is not interrupted,‚Äù the reason for which is stated.

original: gang gi phyir 'di'i rgyu nye bar len pa snga ma'i mtshan nyid grang ba'i skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rgyun 'phen par byed pa yod pa de'i phyir na 'di'i rgyun chad pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di'i rgyu nye bar len pa snga ma'i mtshan nyid grang ba'i skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rgyun 'phen par byed pa yod pa de'i phyir na 'di'i rgyun chad pa med pa yin no //
translated: Because the cause of this is the prior appropriation of the characteristics of the second moment of cold, etc., which impel the continuous process, therefore, there is no interruption of this.

original: 'o na rgyu'i nus @43b pas byas pa'i rgyun 'jug pa med pa gang las she na /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu'i nus @43b pas byas pa'i rgyun 'jug pa med pa gang las she na /
translated: But if the continuous process is not due to the power of the cause, then from what is it?

original: gzhan yod na zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan yod na zhes smos so //
translated: He states, ‚Äúwhen the other exists.‚Äù

original: dngos po gzhan me yod na de yod pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis so //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan me yod na de yod pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis so //
translated: When the other entity, fire, exists, the cause of that is the reason.

original: des na rgyun chags par 'jug pa'i dngos po 'di ldog pa de las ni /
analyzed: des na rgyun chags par 'jug pa'i dngos po 'di ldog pa de las ni /
translated: Therefore, this continuum of engagement is stopped.üîΩ

original: 'gal bar rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gal bar rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the cessation of this thing that is engaged in a continuum is understood to be incompatible with that cause.

original: gal te rang gi rgyu med na 'bras bu med pa'i phyir de nyid rang gi 'bras bu ldog par byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te rang gi rgyu med na 'bras bu med pa'i phyir de nyid rang gi 'bras bu ldog par byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the effect does not exist because its cause does not exist, then that cause would be the cessation of its effect.

original: dngos po gzhan gyis go dngos po gzhan gyis bskyed pa'i dngos po ji ltar bzlog ce na /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan gyis go dngos po gzhan gyis bskyed pa'i dngos po ji ltar bzlog ce na /
translated: But how could one thing that is generated by another thing be stopped by another thing?

original: dngos po gzhan gyis bskyed pa dngos po gzhan gyis kyang bskyed pa ji lta bar ro //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan gyis bskyed pa dngos po gzhan gyis kyang bskyed pa ji lta bar ro //
translated: Just as one thing that is generated by another thing is generated, so too another thing stops it.üîΩIf another thing assists it by its own power, then it would be included in the same collection as that thing.

original: gal te dngos po gzhan gyis phan 'dogs pa nyid kyis de dang lhan cig tshogs pa gcig tu gyur nas gzhan gyis skyed pa la gzhan nye bar sbyor ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po gzhan gyis phan 'dogs pa nyid kyis de dang lhan cig tshogs pa gcig tu gyur nas gzhan gyis skyed pa la gzhan nye bar sbyor ro zhe na /
translated: But how could another thing that is generated by another thing be stopped by another thing?

original: gal te de lta na phan pa sgrub pa nyid kyis tshogs pa gcig tu gyur pas gnyis pa la sogs pa bskyed par mi nus pa skyed pas gzhan bzlog pas gzhan yang zlog par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta na phan pa sgrub pa nyid kyis tshogs pa gcig tu gyur pas gnyis pa la sogs pa bskyed par mi nus pa skyed pas gzhan bzlog pas gzhan yang zlog par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then since the first moment of the cause is able to generate the second moment, etc., it would also be able to generate other things, since it is able to generate that which is not similar to itself.

original: phan 'dogs pas ni skad cig mar 'jig par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pas ni skad cig mar 'jig par bsam par bya'o //
translated: The cause is considered momentary because it is able to benefit.

original: drod chung du 'am snang ba chung du'i phyogs su grang ba dang mun pa dag lhan cig tu gnas pa yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: drod chung du 'am snang ba chung du'i phyogs su grang ba dang mun pa dag lhan cig tu gnas pa yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that cold and darkness exist together in a place where heat and light are weak?

original: der drod dam snang ba nyid chung ba yin no zhes bya bar ni mi nus te /
analyzed: der drod dam snang ba nyid chung ba yin no zhes bya bar ni mi nus te /
translated: It cannot be said that heat and light are weak there,

original: de dang mi mthun pa yang dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa yang dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because their opposites are observed there.

original: brjod pa chu dang 'o ma 'am rigs mi mthun pa'i rdzas kyis dri'i rdul phra rab so sor byed pa dag kyang 'dres par gyur pa phan tshun bzlog par bya ba dang / zlog par byed pa'i dngos po med par yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa chu dang 'o ma 'am rigs mi mthun pa'i rdzas kyis dri'i rdul phra rab so sor byed pa dag kyang 'dres par gyur pa phan tshun bzlog par bya ba dang / zlog par byed pa'i dngos po med par yang yod pa yin no //
translated: We reply: It is not so, because even when the subtle particles of smell of water and milk, or of different substances, are mixed, they do not mutually exclude each other.

original: de nyid ni lhan cig gnas pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid ni lhan cig gnas pa zhes brjod do //
translated: That is called ‚Äúco-existent.

original: dro ba'i reg pa dang me dag ni grang ba dang mun pa bzlog nas de'i yul du 'ong ba yin la de ma nus pa la ltos nas mi gnas par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: dro ba'i reg pa dang me dag ni grang ba dang mun pa bzlog nas de'i yul du 'ong ba yin la de ma nus pa la ltos nas mi gnas par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: ‚Äù Heat and fire, for example, come into the domain of cold and darkness, respectively, and then stop, depending on the inability of the latter to continue.

original: des na rang gi rgyu nus pa shin tu chung ba dang ldan pas mang po 'byung ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs cung zad tsam bzlog kyang nye ba yin yang gzhan ma bzlog pa gang yin pa de tsam gyis ni 'gal ba mi nyams te /
analyzed: des na rang gi rgyu nus pa shin tu chung ba dang ldan pas mang po 'byung ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs cung zad tsam bzlog kyang nye ba yin yang gzhan ma bzlog pa gang yin pa de tsam gyis ni 'gal ba mi nyams te /
translated: Therefore, because of the small amount of power of their causes, they are called ‚Äúweak,‚Äù and because they arise in large numbers, they are called ‚Äúnumerous.‚Äù Even though they stop a small amount of the opposing side, they are called ‚Äúnear.‚Äù But the opponent is not stopped, and that much does not destroy the opponent.

original: phyis rang gi rgyu las 'phel bar 'gyur ba na rnam par thams cad du sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis rang gi rgyu las 'phel bar 'gyur ba na rnam par thams cad du sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Later, when they increase from their own causes, they are called ‚Äúgreat.‚Äù

original: des na de ltar gzhan yod na med pa rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar gzhan yod na med pa rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this way, the reason for understanding the nonexistence of one when the other exists is that they are mutually exclusive.

original: des na de'i ngang bzhin yang gzhan yod na de med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i ngang bzhin yang gzhan yod na de med pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, their nature is that when one exists, the other does not exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir @44a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir @44a * //
translated: For this very reason,

original: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid du bstan to //
translated: they are taught to have the characteristic of not coexisting.

original: gzhan yod na med pa 'gal bar rtogs pa'i rgyu yin mod /
analyzed: gzhan yod na med pa 'gal bar rtogs pa'i rgyu yin mod /
translated: It is true that the existence of one thing is the cause for understanding the incompatibility of the existence of another.

original: med pa de nyid gang las rtogs she na /
analyzed: med pa de nyid gang las rtogs she na /
translated: But how is the nonexistence of that other thing understood?

original: de yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: de yang zhes smos so //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúThat nonexistence is also from the nonapprehension of that.‚Äù

original: med pa de yang mi dmigs pa las yin no //
analyzed: med pa de yang mi dmigs pa las yin no //
translated: That nonexistence is also from the nonapprehension of that.

original: mngon sum las kyang 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum las kyang 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it also from direct perception?üîΩIt is true, but it is not said that it is from direct perception.

original: bden te mngon sum las yod dam med ce na mi brjod kyi 'on kyang mngon sum gyis me yod pa na grang ba rtogs par bya ba na yang de na grang ba mi dmigs pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: bden te mngon sum las yod dam med ce na mi brjod kyi 'on kyang mngon sum gyis me yod pa na grang ba rtogs par bya ba na yang de na grang ba mi dmigs pa yod pa yin no //
translated: However, when direct perception understands the existence of fire, the nonapprehension of cold exists there.

original: des na de de yod pa dang 'gal ba ltar de dmigs pa dang yang mi mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na de de yod pa dang 'gal ba ltar de dmigs pa dang yang mi mthun pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, just as the existence of that fire is incompatible with the existence of cold, so too the apprehension of that fire is incompatible with the nonapprehension of cold.

original: des na 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: Thus, this is what is being said:

original: me yod pa na grang ba mi dmigs pa yod pa yin la /
analyzed: me yod pa na grang ba mi dmigs pa yod pa yin la /
translated: When fire exists, the nonapprehension of cold exists.

original: de yang gzhan yod pa nyid yin no /
analyzed: de yang gzhan yod pa nyid yin no /
translated: And that is the existence of another.

original: de lta yin dang khyim nang gi nam mkha'i cha dro bas khengs pa rtogs pa na dro ba de yod pas grang ba mi dmigs par rtogs bzhin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang khyim nang gi nam mkha'i cha dro bas khengs pa rtogs pa na dro ba de yod pas grang ba mi dmigs par rtogs bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, when one understands that the part of the house filled with hot air is filled with hot air, one understands that the cold is not perceived because of the presence of the hot.

original: des na de nyid dang de 'gal ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis de med pa dang mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: des na de nyid dang de 'gal ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis de med pa dang mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Thus, the absence of the cold and the non-perception of the cold are of the same nature as the perception of the hot and the existence of the hot.

original: phyogs sam snang ba de nyid des na dben pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs sam snang ba de nyid des na dben pa yin no //
translated: The place or the light is empty of the cold because of the hot.

original: snang ba yang de las gzhan nyid kyis de ltar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: snang ba yang de las gzhan nyid kyis de ltar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The light is established as being different from the cold.

original: 'di ni gzhan yang yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan yang yin la /
translated: This is also the case for the other.

original: zlog par byed pa yang yin pas med pa shin tu gsal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: zlog par byed pa yang yin pas med pa shin tu gsal ba kho na'o //
translated: The cold is clearly absent because of the hot.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar 'gal ba rtogs pa na de lta bu'i yul rtogs pas grang ba med pa khong du chud pa de bzhin du grub pa'i 'gal ba sgrub pa na yang gang rtogs pa na sngon med do zhes bya bar mi rtogs pa de nyid grub na
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar 'gal ba rtogs pa na de lta bu'i yul rtogs pas grang ba med pa khong du chud pa de bzhin du grub pa'i 'gal ba sgrub pa na yang gang rtogs pa na sngon med do zhes bya bar mi rtogs pa de nyid grub na
translated: Thus, just as one understands the absence of the cold when one understands the hot which is incompatible with the cold, in the same way, when one establishes the incompatibility of the established, one understands the absence of the cold when one understands the hot which is incompatible with the cold.

original: 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The cold is established as absent.

original: des na sngon bzhin du da ltar yang de mi dmigs pa nyid khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sngon bzhin du da ltar yang de mi dmigs pa nyid khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, just as before, now also, the non-apprehension of that is not a specific characteristic.

original: 'di ni rigs pa yin te 'di ltar dgag pa'i don 'gal ba mthong bas rtogs par mi nus la gzhan rtogs na ni med do zhes mi rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa yin te 'di ltar dgag pa'i don 'gal ba mthong bas rtogs par mi nus la gzhan rtogs na ni med do zhes mi rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This is logical, because the meaning of negation cannot be understood by seeing a contradiction, and if the other is understood, it cannot be that one does not understand ‚Äúit does not exist.‚Äù

original: des na gang rtogs na med do snyam par 'gyur ba de rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gang rtogs na med do snyam par 'gyur ba de rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which, when understood, becomes ‚Äúit does not exist,‚Äù is what is to be understood.

original: des na 'dir me 'am me'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: des na 'dir me 'am me'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: Here, when fire or the result of fire is understood,

original: gzhan yang rung ste rtogs pa na med do snyam par 'gyur ba'i phyir de nyid dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ste rtogs pa na med do snyam par 'gyur ba'i phyir de nyid dmigs pa yin no //
translated: one thinks ‚Äúit does not exist.‚Äù Therefore, that itself is the object.

original: gal te dro ba ni reg pa gcig pu'i yul yin pa'i phyir de yod par rtogs na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa nyid kyi grang ba med par sgrub par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dro ba ni reg pa gcig pu'i yul yin pa'i phyir de yod par rtogs na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa nyid kyi grang ba med par sgrub par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: If heat is the object of touch alone, and when it is understood one understands that it exists, then it becomes the characteristic of the object, and one establishes that cold does not exist.

original: thag ring por yang mi mthong @44b du rung ba'i phyir la grang ba'i reg pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhe na /üîΩbden te gzugs dmigs kyis reg pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thag ring por yang mi mthong @44b du rung ba'i phyir la grang ba'i reg pa ma yin pa ni ma yin no zhe na / bden te gzugs dmigs kyis reg pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a tangible that is perceived, since it is not seen from a distance.

original: de ltar gyur pa ni reg pa yin pas de mi dmigs par brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa ni reg pa yin pas de mi dmigs par brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: But it is a tangible that is inferred, since it is a cause of the sensation of cold.üîΩBut it is not a tangible that is perceived, since it is not seen from a distance.

original: gzugs ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not a tangible that is perceived, since it is not seen from a distance.üîΩBut it is a tangible that is inferred, since it is a cause of the sensation of cold.üîΩBut it is not a tangible that is perceived, since it is not seen from a distance.üîΩIt is not a tangible that is perceived, since it is not seen from a distance.üîΩBut it is a tangible that is inferred, since it is a cause of the sensation of cold.

original: de de bzhin kho na ste gzugs bzlog par bya ba ma yin pas 'gal ba med pa'i phyir me ni reg pa nyid kyis grang ba dang 'gal ba yin yang /
analyzed: de de bzhin kho na ste gzugs bzlog par bya ba ma yin pas 'gal ba med pa'i phyir me ni reg pa nyid kyis grang ba dang 'gal ba yin yang /
translated: But it is not a tangible that is perceived, since it is not seen from a distance.

original: 'bar ba rtogs na reg pa la yod par the tshom za ba ni ma yin no //üîΩmngon sum mam tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i rjes su dpag pas kyang rung ste mngon par zhen pas kyang ci bya /
analyzed: 'bar ba rtogs na reg pa la yod par the tshom za ba ni ma yin no // mngon sum mam tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i rjes su dpag pas kyang rung ste mngon par zhen pas kyang ci bya /
translated: It is not a tangible that is perceived, since it is not seen from a distance.

original: reg pa rtogs pa nyid kyis grang ba bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: reg pa rtogs pa nyid kyis grang ba bzlog pa yin no //
translated: But it is a tangible that is inferred, since it is a cause of the sensation of cold.üîΩBut it is not a tangible that is perceived, since it is not seen from a distance.üîΩIt is not a tangible that is perceived, since it is not seen from a distance.üîΩBut it is a tangible that is inferred, since it is a cause of the sensation of cold.üîΩBut it is not a tangible that is perceived, since it is not seen from a distance.üîΩIt is not a tangible that is perceived, since it is not seen from a distance.üîΩBut it is a tangible that

original: yang na 'gal ba dag gis phyogs dang phyogs can gyi zhen pas ci bya ste 'gal ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa la de med pa'i phyir 'bar ba'i bdag nyid kyi me nyid grang ba med pa yin mod /
analyzed: yang na 'gal ba dag gis phyogs dang phyogs can gyi zhen pas ci bya ste 'gal ba'i 'bras bu la sogs pa la de med pa'i phyir 'bar ba'i bdag nyid kyi me nyid grang ba med pa yin mod /
translated: Or else, what is the use of the adherence to the position and the possessor of the position by means of contradiction, since that does not exist in the effect of contradiction and so on? The fire itself, which has the nature of burning, is indeed without cold.

original: ji ltar phyogs nyid kyi phyogs bum pa med pa yin pa de bzhin du de'i rang bzhin ma yin yang phyogs dmigs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar phyogs nyid kyi phyogs bum pa med pa yin pa de bzhin du de'i rang bzhin ma yin yang phyogs dmigs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the position itself is without a pot, so also, although it is not its intrinsic nature, the position is perceived.

original: de ni de ltar yin no zhes mi mthun pa nyid las rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de ni de ltar yin no zhes mi mthun pa nyid las rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: That is so, it is established from the very contradiction.

original: bum pa yod na phyogs tsam dmigs pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa yod na phyogs tsam dmigs pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the pot exists, the mere position is not perceived.

original: des na ji ltar phyogs dmigs pa rtogs pa na yang bum pa med pa rtogs pa de bzhin du me dang me'i 'bras bu gzhan la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ji ltar phyogs dmigs pa rtogs pa na yang bum pa med pa rtogs pa de bzhin du me dang me'i 'bras bu gzhan la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, just as the pot is perceived when the position is perceived, so also it is with fire and the effect of fire.

original: des na de thams cad med do snyam pa'i rtogs pa'i yul du 'gyur ba na 'di dag 'jug pa'i du bas me bzhin du gang yin dgag pa'i don nye bar bsgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de thams cad med do snyam pa'i rtogs pa'i yul du 'gyur ba na 'di dag 'jug pa'i du bas me bzhin du gang yin dgag pa'i don nye bar bsgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when all of these are the objects of the cognition that thinks ‚ÄúThey do not exist,‚Äù it is not the case that the existence of fire is established by the existence of smoke.

original: des na 'di thams cad mi dmigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na 'di thams cad mi dmigs pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, all of these are only non-apprehended.

original: 'gal ba gzhan yang bshad pa ni phan tshun dmigs pa spangs te /
analyzed: 'gal ba gzhan yang bshad pa ni phan tshun dmigs pa spangs te /
translated: Another contradiction is explained: mutually exclusive observation and

original: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: the nature of being mutually exclusive.

original: gang dag gi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni de dag gi phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gang dag gi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni de dag gi phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of being mutually exclusive is that whatever is the nature of the observation of one is the nature of the non-observation of the other.

original: de dmigs pa ni gzhan gyis spangs la gzhan dmigs pa yang de spangs pa de'i phyir bdag nyid gcig par mi srid pa 'gal ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dmigs pa ni gzhan gyis spangs la gzhan dmigs pa yang de spangs pa de'i phyir bdag nyid gcig par mi srid pa 'gal ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Since the observation of one excludes the other and the observation of the other excludes that, they are said to be contradictory in the sense that they cannot possibly have the same nature.

original: de dang mi mthun pa nyid du gyur pa rang gi bdag nyid kyi mthar thug pa tsam gyis ngo bo nyid ni der dngos po'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa nyid du gyur pa rang gi bdag nyid kyi mthar thug pa tsam gyis ngo bo nyid ni der dngos po'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of being a thing is the mere nature of being the opposite of that.

original: snga ma la ni lhan cig mi srid pa la brten pa bzlog bya zlog byed kyi dngos po ma yin la /
analyzed: snga ma la ni lhan cig mi srid pa la brten pa bzlog bya zlog byed kyi dngos po ma yin la /
translated: In the former case, the impossibility of co-existence is not a real entity that can be refuted or can refute.

original: mi srid pa ni mi @45a * //
analyzed: mi srid pa ni mi @45a * //
translated: Impossibility is just non-establishment,

original: 'thad pa tsam gyi rang bzhin nyid kyis dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'thad pa tsam gyi rang bzhin nyid kyis dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and by nature it is not established as the nature of a real entity.

original: 'gal ba ni dper na ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'gal ba ni dper na ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is contradiction?

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa bzhin no zhes smos so //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa bzhin no zhes smos so //
translated: For example, like permanence and impermanence.

original: gal te rtag pa la ni dmigs pa 'ga' yang mi srid do //
analyzed: gal te rtag pa la ni dmigs pa 'ga' yang mi srid do //
translated: If something is permanent, it is impossible to observe it at all.

original: de na gang na'ang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na gang na'ang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist anywhere.

original: mi rtag pa la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it impermanent.

original: mngon sum gyis mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not conceived by direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa la ni dngos po dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la ni dngos po dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: In inference, there is no observation of a real entity.

original: des na sngon po la sogs pa dmigs pa rtogs pa dag bzhag ste gang spangs pas 'di gnyis kyi rang bzhin gnas pa dang por bkod pa ji ltar 'di dag dmigs pa yin zhe na brjod pa dmigs pa nyid yod pa rnams kyis yod pa yin no zhes
analyzed: des na sngon po la sogs pa dmigs pa rtogs pa dag bzhag ste gang spangs pas 'di gnyis kyi rang bzhin gnas pa dang por bkod pa ji ltar 'di dag dmigs pa yin zhe na brjod pa dmigs pa nyid yod pa rnams kyis yod pa yin no zhes
translated: Therefore, having posited the realizations of objects such as blue, what is the nature of these two that is posited first, by the abandonment of which they are said to be objects?

original: gnas pa'i tha snyad blo la bzhag nas 'di gnyis kyi rang bzhin nyid dmigs pa'i tha snyad du brjod do //
analyzed: gnas pa'i tha snyad blo la bzhag nas 'di gnyis kyi rang bzhin nyid dmigs pa'i tha snyad du brjod do //
translated: Having posited the convention of existence in the mind, the nature of these two is said to be the convention of an object.

original: des na phan tshun bdag nyid spangs te gnas pa'i rang bzhin nyid 'gal ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na phan tshun bdag nyid spangs te gnas pa'i rang bzhin nyid 'gal ba yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the nature of these two is mutually exclusive.

original: 'gal ba 'di tshad ma gang gis rtogs par bya /
analyzed: 'gal ba 'di tshad ma gang gis rtogs par bya /
translated: By what valid knowledge is this contradiction understood?

original: rgyu yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is its cause?

original: re zhig 'di la rgyu ni 'ga' yang rtogs pa med de /
analyzed: re zhig 'di la rgyu ni 'ga' yang rtogs pa med de /
translated: First, there is no cause at all for this.

original: sngon po ni sngon po'i bdag nyid yin la ser po ni ser po'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba de dag tha dad pa'i bdag nyid ni rang gi rgyu nyid las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po ni sngon po'i bdag nyid yin la ser po ni ser po'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba de dag tha dad pa'i bdag nyid ni rang gi rgyu nyid las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Blue is of the nature of blue, and yellow is of the nature of yellow. The difference in their natures is due to their own causes.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sgro btags pa'i gcig dgag pa'i phyir gcig par 'gal lo zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sgro btags pa'i gcig dgag pa'i phyir gcig par 'gal lo zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, in order to refute the superimposition of oneness, it is said that oneness is contradictory.

original: phan tshun tha ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun tha ba ma yin no //
translated: They are not mutually exclusive.

original: bltar mi rung ba bltar rung ba dang 'gal ba ni gcig 'gog pa'i sgrub byed yin la /
analyzed: bltar mi rung ba bltar rung ba dang 'gal ba ni gcig 'gog pa'i sgrub byed yin la /
translated: The contradiction between the invisible and the visible is the proof for refuting one.

original: bltar mi rung ba rnams kyi rang bzhin tha dad pa'i 'gal ba ni the tshom za ba nyid do //
analyzed: bltar mi rung ba rnams kyi rang bzhin tha dad pa'i 'gal ba ni the tshom za ba nyid do //
translated: The contradiction of different natures in the invisible is itself doubt.

original: rang gi ngo bo yod na tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo yod na tha dad pa yin la /
translated: If there is an existent nature, there is difference.

original: tha dad pa yang 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo la the tshom za ba na the tshom mi za ba gzhan ci zhig yod /
analyzed: tha dad pa yang 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo la the tshom za ba na the tshom mi za ba gzhan ci zhig yod /
translated: And difference is contradictory. Therefore, when there is doubt about the nature, what other non-doubt is there?

original: bltar rung ba dang bltar mi rung ba dag ni bltar rung ba rang las bzlog pa las tha dad grub na bltar mi rung ba gzhan las tha dad par mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid de las 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bltar rung ba dang bltar mi rung ba dag ni bltar rung ba rang las bzlog pa las tha dad grub na bltar mi rung ba gzhan las tha dad par mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid de las 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: If it is established that that which can be seen and that which cannot be seen are different, then that which cannot be seen is established by direct perception to be different from that which can be seen.

original: bltar mi rung ba bltar rung ba dang 'gal ba ni bltar rung ba las gzhan nyid kyis rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: bltar mi rung ba bltar rung ba dang 'gal ba ni bltar rung ba las gzhan nyid kyis rtogs par byed do //
translated: That which cannot be seen is understood to be different from that which can be seen because it is contradictory to that which can be seen.

original: gzhan nyid kyang the tshom za ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyang the tshom za ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the difference itself also doubtful?

original: bden mod kyi bltar mi rung ba gzhan nyid du the tshom @45b za ba bltar rung ba dang bdag nyid gcig par the tshom za ba las sam /
analyzed: bden mod kyi bltar mi rung ba gzhan nyid du the tshom @45b za ba bltar rung ba dang bdag nyid gcig par the tshom za ba las sam /
translated: That is true, but the doubt that that which cannot be seen is different from that which can be seen is a doubt that it is the same as that which can be seen.

original: med pa gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo las the tshom za ba las 'gyur /
analyzed: med pa gzhan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo las the tshom za ba las 'gyur /
translated: Or it is a doubt that it is different from its own nature because it is not nonexistent and different.

original: bltar rung ba yod pa the tshom za ba las gzhan du the tshom za bar 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: bltar rung ba yod pa the tshom za ba las gzhan du the tshom za bar 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: It is a doubt that it is different from that which can be seen because it is a doubt that that which can be seen exists.

original: de'i ngo bor the tshom za ba ni med de /
analyzed: de'i ngo bor the tshom za ba ni med de /
translated: But it is not a doubt that it is its nature.

original: rang las bzlog pa thams cad las tha dad par grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid rjes su dpag pa las grub na de rang las bzlog pa las tha dad pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i phyir gal te rtag pa zhes bya ba med pa de lta na yang dngos po med pa 'gal ba'am /
analyzed: rang las bzlog pa thams cad las tha dad par grub pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid rjes su dpag pa las grub na de rang las bzlog pa las tha dad pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i phyir gal te rtag pa zhes bya ba med pa de lta na yang dngos po med pa 'gal ba'am /
translated: because it is established as different from all that is contrary to itself.

original: ji ltar brtags bzhin pa'i ldog pa med pa'i rang bzhin can nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid dang 'gal ba nyid las rab tu grub po //
analyzed: ji ltar brtags bzhin pa'i ldog pa med pa'i rang bzhin can nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid dang 'gal ba nyid las rab tu grub po //
translated: In the same way, if impermanence is established by inference, it is established as having a nature that is different from what is contrary to itself. Therefore, even if what is called permanence does not exist, still, the nonexistence of things is established as having a nature that is contradictory to the nature of what is imagined, that is, as having a nature that is not the opposite of that.

original: de yang tha dad pa la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang tha dad pa la brten pa yin te /
translated: And that is based on difference,

original: dper na sngon po la sogs pa dang ser po ba lta bu'am /
analyzed: dper na sngon po la sogs pa dang ser po ba lta bu'am /
translated: like, for example, blue, etc., and yellow,

original: de'i rang bzhin ma yin par tsam la bran pa yin te /üîΩdper na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa 'am /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma yin par tsam la bran pa yin te / dper na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa 'am /
translated: or it is based on the mere absence of that nature,üîΩlike, for example, permanence and impermanence,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa lta bu'o //
translated: or existence and nonexistence.

original: tha dad par grub pa de ma thag pa can bltar rung ba bltar mi rung ba'i bdag nyid yin pa bkag pa ni blun po la yang mngon sum gyi gzhi las ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad par grub pa de ma thag pa can bltar rung ba bltar mi rung ba'i bdag nyid yin pa bkag pa ni blun po la yang mngon sum gyi gzhi las ma yin no //
translated: The refutation of the immediately preceding condition as a different entity, which is visible or invisible, is not direct perception even for a fool.

original: tha dad pa'i bltar mi rung ba ni dgag tu med do //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i bltar mi rung ba ni dgag tu med do //
translated: The invisible, which is different, cannot be refuted.

original: de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid kyis bltar rung ba ni rmongs pa la snang ba mi dmigs pa las yin la gzhan la ni mngon sum ma yin no zhes mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid kyis bltar rung ba ni rmongs pa la snang ba mi dmigs pa las yin la gzhan la ni mngon sum ma yin no zhes mang du bshad zin to //
translated: The visible, which is different in character from that, is for the ignorant, from the non-apprehension of what appears, but for others it is not direct perception. This has been explained many times.

original: 'di la gzhung lugs shes par rlom pa dang kyang gol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di la gzhung lugs shes par rlom pa dang kyang gol ba'i phyir /
translated: Here, those who are conceited about knowing the system go astray.

original: de gzhan du legs par bkag zin to //
analyzed: de gzhan du legs par bkag zin to //
translated: That has been well refuted elsewhere.

original: 'gal ba 'di ni 'gal ba brjod pa'i skabs kyi 'dir bshad do //
analyzed: 'gal ba 'di ni 'gal ba brjod pa'i skabs kyi 'dir bshad do //
translated: This contradiction is explained here in the context of expressing contradictions.

original: de ni rnam pa gcig nyid du zad do zhes shes par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gcig nyid du zad do zhes shes par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is in order that one not understand that it is just one kind.

original: mtshan nyid las gyur pa'i 'gal ba nye bar mkho bar lhan cig mi gnas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid las gyur pa'i 'gal ba nye bar mkho bar lhan cig mi gnas pa bzhin no //
translated: The contradiction of character is like the requirement of non-coexistence.

original: mtshan nyid las gyur pa'i 'gal ba grub pas 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid du khas len na rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid las gyur pa'i 'gal ba grub pas 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid du khas len na rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Since the contradiction is established by way of the definition, if you accept that the observation of a contradiction is the nonobservation of a nature, then the nonobservation of a nature would be the observation of a contradiction.

original: der yang gzhan yod pa nyid kyis med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbdag nyid gcig pa dgag pa'i don du /
analyzed: der yang gzhan yod pa nyid kyis med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro // bdag nyid gcig pa dgag pa'i don du /
translated: Because in that case, the existence of something else would be the realization of nonexistence.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i rgyu sgrub pa 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid du zhe na /üîΩda ni ji ltar du ma'i bdag nyid 'gog pa ltar rung @46a * //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i rgyu sgrub pa 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid du zhe na / da ni ji ltar du ma'i bdag nyid 'gog pa ltar rung @46a * //
translated: If you say that the observation of a contradiction is the establishment of a cause that is contradictory to the object of negation in order to negate identity,üîΩthen how could the observation of a contradiction be the nonobservation of a nature?

original: ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because we do not see how it is suitable to negate identity by way of a contradiction.

original: da de ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ga las /
analyzed: da de ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ga las /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúWe do not see that,‚Äù then how could it be established?

original: de las gzhan rtogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de las gzhan rtogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause the observation of something other than that is observed,‚Äù

original: de las gzhan rtogs pa yod kyang de med pa'i re zhig mi gsal ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de las gzhan rtogs pa yod kyang de med pa'i re zhig mi gsal ba ma yin nam /
translated: then even if the observation of something other than that exists, it is not the case that it is not clear that it does not exist.

original: phyogs dmigs pa na bum pa rtogs pa yod na rigs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: phyogs dmigs pa na bum pa rtogs pa yod na rigs par 'gyur la /
translated: If the observation of a part is the observation of a pot, it would be reasonable.

original: med na ni rigs pa med par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: med na ni rigs pa med par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it is not, it would be unreasonable.

original: rigs pa med do zhes bya bar mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: rigs pa med do zhes bya bar mi 'grub bo //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no reason‚Äù is not established.

original: des na ji ltar shes pa gzhan yod na shes pa gzhan med par rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na ji ltar shes pa gzhan yod na shes pa gzhan med par rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could it be understood that when another cognition exists, another cognition does not exist?

original: de'i phyir bum pa dang bcas pa dang bum pa med pa'i phyogs gnyis nyid gzhan yin pa na gzhan med pa la 'khrul pa med pa cig grub pa ni gzhan med pa rtogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bum pa dang bcas pa dang bum pa med pa'i phyogs gnyis nyid gzhan yin pa na gzhan med pa la 'khrul pa med pa cig grub pa ni gzhan med pa rtogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus, when the two positions‚Äîthat which is associated with a pot and that which is not associated with a pot‚Äîare different, the establishment of the nonexistence of another without error is the cause of understanding the nonexistence of another.

original: de lta yin dang bum pa dang bcas pa dang bum pa med pa'i phyir bum pa dang bcas pa dang bum pa med pa'i phyogs dag la 'gal ba 'di yod pa'i phyir thams cad du 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang bum pa dang bcas pa dang bum pa med pa'i phyir bum pa dang bcas pa dang bum pa med pa'i phyogs dag la 'gal ba 'di yod pa'i phyir thams cad du 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, since there is this contradiction between that which is associated with a pot and that which is not associated with a pot, it follows that the observation of contradiction would occur in all cases.

original: dmigs pa las bltar rung ba bltar mi rung ba dang bdag nyid gcig pa 'gog pa na yang 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa'i dbye ba nyams par 'gyur te 'dir 'gal ba'i dmigs pa bltar mi rung ba'i yul can yinüîΩpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa las bltar rung ba bltar mi rung ba dang bdag nyid gcig pa 'gog pa na yang 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa'i dbye ba nyams par 'gyur te 'dir 'gal ba'i dmigs pa bltar mi rung ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because here the subject is the non-observation of an object that is inconsistent with it.

original: de'i phyir gcig gi bdag nyid 'gog pa ni mngon sum nyid las yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig gi bdag nyid 'gog pa ni mngon sum nyid las yin la /
translated: Therefore, the refutation of one nature is from direct perception itself.

original: tha dad pa la ni 'gal ba de dang ldan pa yin yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid las dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba 'di 'gal ba dmigs pa grub par bya ba'i don du bshad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa la ni 'gal ba de dang ldan pa yin yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid las dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba 'di 'gal ba dmigs pa grub par bya ba'i don du bshad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In the case of difference, although it has that inconsistency, it is non-existence from the non-observation of essence itself. Therefore, this inconsistency is not explained for the sake of establishing the observation of an inconsistency.

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang gal te 'di la gzhung gzugs par sbyor na /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang gal te 'di la gzhung gzugs par sbyor na /
translated: If one applies the text beginning with ‚ÄúMoreover,‚Äù

original: snga ma la de ma sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma la de ma sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the former is not established.

original: des na ji skad bshad pa nyid rigs so //
analyzed: des na ji skad bshad pa nyid rigs so //
translated: Therefore, what was explained is correct.

original: des na de ltar gzhan bsgrubs pas gzhan 'gog pa la ni 'gal ba nyid 'gog par byed pa yin la 'gal ba nyid kyang mi dmigs pa las rtogs pa yin no zhes 'gal ba yang zhes bya ba nas bzung nas de yang mi dmigs pa la zhes pa'i
analyzed: des na de ltar gzhan bsgrubs pas gzhan 'gog pa la ni 'gal ba nyid 'gog par byed pa yin la 'gal ba nyid kyang mi dmigs pa las rtogs pa yin no zhes 'gal ba yang zhes bya ba nas bzung nas de yang mi dmigs pa la zhes pa'i
translated: The passage from ‚Äúcontradiction itself‚Äù up to ‚Äúthat is also nonapprehension‚Äù

original: mthar thug pas bsgrubs te /
analyzed: mthar thug pas bsgrubs te /
translated: establishes this.

original: ji ltar bdag cag gis brjod pa bzhin du bsam pa gang gis de bshad pa de bstan pa'i phyir de la @46b yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag cag gis brjod pa bzhin du bsam pa gang gis de bshad pa de bstan pa'i phyir de la @46b yang zhes smos so //
translated: In order to show the thought by which we explain this, we say ‚Äúin that case‚Äù as we have stated.

original: skabs su bab pa'i 'gal bsgrub pa de la yang me la sogs pa'i 'gal ba cig dmigs pas grang ba la sogs pa gzhan mi dmigs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i 'gal bsgrub pa de la yang me la sogs pa'i 'gal ba cig dmigs pas grang ba la sogs pa gzhan mi dmigs pa kho na ste /
translated: In that establishment of contradiction that is relevant here, the contradiction of fire and so on is apprehended, and the nonapprehension of cold and so on is just that.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du brjod do //
translated: We call that the characteristic of the nonapprehension of essence.

original: ji ltar 'di mi dmigs pa kho nar brjod do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di mi dmigs pa kho nar brjod do //
translated: How is it just nonapprehension?

original: bzlog par bya ba dang zlog par byed pa dag las gcig yod par bsgrubs pas gzhan med par bstan pa'i phyir rang bzhin mi dmigs pa rtogs pas ni ma yin no zhes dogs na /
analyzed: bzlog par bya ba dang zlog par byed pa dag las gcig yod par bsgrubs pas gzhan med par bstan pa'i phyir rang bzhin mi dmigs pa rtogs pas ni ma yin no zhes dogs na /
translated: Since one of the two, the object of refutation and the refutation, is established as existent, the other is shown to be nonexistent.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes smos so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes smos so //
translated: If that were not so, then the non-observation of essence would not be a proof.

original: bzlog par bya ba dang / zlog par byed pa'i dngos po yin du zin kyang zlog par byed pa nye ba las bzlog par bya ba med par gzhal bar mi nus te /
analyzed: bzlog par bya ba dang / zlog par byed pa'i dngos po yin du zin kyang zlog par byed pa nye ba las bzlog par bya ba med par gzhal bar mi nus te /
translated: Even if the object of refutation and the refutation were things, the object of refutation could not be cognized as nonexistent due to the presence of the refutation,

original: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //üîΩde'i phyir gang dmigs pa med pa'i rtogs pa bskyed pa de dmigs pa'i mthong ba nyid med do zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa bskyed par bya ba'i don du bsgrub par bya ba yin no //üîΩdngos po med pa sgrub par byed pa nye bar dgod pa byas pas sgrub par mi nus la /
analyzed: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no // de'i phyir gang dmigs pa med pa'i rtogs pa bskyed pa de dmigs pa'i mthong ba nyid med do zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa bskyed par bya ba'i don du bsgrub par bya ba yin no // dngos po med pa sgrub par byed pa nye bar dgod pa byas pas sgrub par mi nus la /
translated: as was previously explained.üîΩTherefore, the non-observation of the object of refutation is a proof that generates the understanding that the object of refutation does not exist.üîΩIt is not a proof that generates the understanding that the observation of the object of refutation does not exist.

original: de rtogs pa yang gdon mi za bar bya dgos pa na /
analyzed: de rtogs pa yang gdon mi za bar bya dgos pa na /
translated: Since it is not possible to posit a proof of nonexistence, and since it is necessary to generate the understanding of that,

original: de'i yul bstan pa nyid kyis de bsgrub pa yin gyi rnam pa gzhan ni srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i yul bstan pa nyid kyis de bsgrub pa yin gyi rnam pa gzhan ni srid pa ma yin no //
translated: The object of that is taught, and that is established, but another aspect is not possible.

original: der yang dgag bar bya ba'i don dang mi mthun pa'i dngos po nye bar bstan par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: der yang dgag bar bya ba'i don dang mi mthun pa'i dngos po nye bar bstan par bya ba yin te /
translated: And there, the thing that is incompatible with the object of negation is to be taught.

original: phyogs dben pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phyogs dben pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a secluded place.

original: de ni dgag par bya ba'i yul can gyi dmigs pa dang yang mi mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni dgag par bya ba'i yul can gyi dmigs pa dang yang mi mthun pa nyid do //
translated: That is incompatible with the object of negation, the object of observation.

original: des na gang nye bar bstan pas med do snyam pa'i rtogs pas 'grub pa de ni mi dmigs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des na gang nye bar bstan pas med do snyam pa'i rtogs pas 'grub pa de ni mi dmigs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, that which is taught and established by the cognition that thinks ‚ÄúIt does not exist‚Äù is called ‚Äúnon-observation.‚Äù

original: des na de lta bu bstan pas dmigs pa bkag par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na de lta bu bstan pas dmigs pa bkag par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, by teaching that, the observation is refuted.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te dmigs pa ma bkag pa can de med par rtogs pa'i rten du 'gyur ba mi mthun pa'i zla bo rab tu ma bstan par mi 'grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te dmigs pa ma bkag pa can de med par rtogs pa'i rten du 'gyur ba mi mthun pa'i zla bo rab tu ma bstan par mi 'grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: The meaning of that is this: Without refuting the observation, the basis for the understanding of nonexistence would not be established, because the incompatible opponent is not taught.

original: med do snyam pa'i rtogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med do snyam pa'i rtogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cognition that thinks ‚ÄúIt does not exist‚Äù is not tenable.

original: des na 'gal ba rab tu bstan pas kyang yul bstan pa nyid kyi sgo nas med do zhes bya bar rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: des na 'gal ba rab tu bstan pas kyang yul bstan pa nyid kyi sgo nas med do zhes bya bar rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Thus, it is established that the demonstration of contradiction also causes one to understand that the object is nonexistent by way of the demonstration of the object.

original: des na de ltar 'ga' zhig bsgrubs pas 'gog pa mi dmigs pa nyid du bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: des na de ltar 'ga' zhig bsgrubs pas 'gog pa mi dmigs pa nyid du bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, having established non-apprehension of the object of negation by means of the establishment of some object,

original: dgag pa yang bshad pa ni gcig bkag pas zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa yang bshad pa ni gcig bkag pas zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: the negation is explained as ‚Äúby the negation of one.‚Äù

original: sngar bshad pa'i rigs pa'i stobs kyis grub pa kho na @47a * //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i rigs pa'i stobs kyis grub pa kho na @47a * //
translated: It is established by the power of reasoning explained previously,

original: yin te / de la sgrub par byed pa gzhan ni mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yin te / de la sgrub par byed pa gzhan ni mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and it is implied that there is no need for another proof.

original: gal te der ni 'gal ba'i don gzhan mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te der ni 'gal ba'i don gzhan mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: But wasn‚Äôt it explained that the meaning of contradiction is the non-apprehension of another object?

original: 'dir gzhan med pa sgrub pa la mi dmigs pa de gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan med pa sgrub pa la mi dmigs pa de gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: Here, what is that non-apprehension that proves the non-existence of another?üîΩThe text says, ‚ÄúThe negation . . .

original: dgag pa ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: dgag pa ni zhes smos so //
translated: The negation is stated.üîΩüîΩ

original: skabs su bab pa gcig bkag pa gang yin pa de nyid gzhan med pa sgrub pa la mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa gcig bkag pa gang yin pa de nyid gzhan med pa sgrub pa la mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is the negation of one thing in a particular context is the non-apprehension that proves the non-existence of another.

original: gcig bkag pa gzhan med pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de nyid kyang dgag par bya ba mi dmigs pa gzhan yod pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gcig bkag pa gzhan med pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de nyid kyang dgag par bya ba mi dmigs pa gzhan yod pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: That which is the nature of the negation of one thing is the nature of the non-existence of another.

original: dgag pa ni thams cad du rang gi yul grub par brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dgag pa ni thams cad du rang gi yul grub par brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: Negation is always expressed in terms of the establishment of its own object.

original: 'di sgrub par byed pa gzhan las ni grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di sgrub par byed pa gzhan las ni grub pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not established by another proof.

original: des na bzlog par bya ba dang zlog par byed pa'i dngos po las 'gal ba bzhin du rgyu la sogs pa med pa yang yod par srid pa bzlog pa tsam gyis ni sgrub pa ma yin pa nyid do ;
analyzed: des na bzlog par bya ba dang zlog par byed pa'i dngos po las 'gal ba bzhin du rgyu la sogs pa med pa yang yod par srid pa bzlog pa tsam gyis ni sgrub pa ma yin pa nyid do ;
translated: Therefore, the non-existence of a cause, etc., is not established merely by the negation of the possibility of existence, as in the case of the contradiction between the negatee and the negating factor.

original: / de'i phyir gzhan yod pa gcig bkag pa'i bkag pa gang yin pa de nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i med pa yang yin te /
analyzed: / de'i phyir gzhan yod pa gcig bkag pa'i bkag pa gang yin pa de nyid bsgrub par bya ba'i med pa yang yin te /
translated: Therefore, the negation which is the negation of the existence of another is also the probandum, non-existence.

original: de yod na de bzhin du gzhan yang med par mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na de bzhin du gzhan yang med par mi 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, if it exists, there is no confusion about the non-existence of another in the same way.

original: de la gzhan gang zhig med pa la nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gzhan gang zhig med pa la nges pa'i phyir /
translated: What is the other that is non-existent there?

original: mi dmigs pa nyid du bstan pa gang yin pa de rang nyid ston pa ni don gzhan dgag pa zhes smos so //üîΩde la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dgag pa rgyu dang 'bras bu dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin pa'am /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid du bstan pa gang yin pa de rang nyid ston pa ni don gzhan dgag pa zhes smos so // de la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dgag pa rgyu dang 'bras bu dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin pa'am /
translated: That which is taught as non-apprehension itself is taught as the negation of another object.üîΩMoreover, the negation of cause and effect is the reason for the negation of cause and effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis ma yin pa zhig bkag pa gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis ma yin pa zhig bkag pa gtan tshigs te /
translated: Or, the negation of what is not both cause and effect is the reason.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i don gzhan bkag pas don gzhan med pa bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes ba'i don te /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i don gzhan bkag pas don gzhan med pa bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that by negating another object as explained, the non-existence of another object is to be established.

original: tha dad pa 'gog pa la rnam pa 'di tsam las mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa 'gog pa la rnam pa 'di tsam las mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other way to negate difference.

original: dgag par bya ba ste 'brel pa 'am ma 'brel ba yin la /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba ste 'brel pa 'am ma 'brel ba yin la /
translated: What is to be negated is either related or unrelated.

original: 'brel pa yang rnam pa gnyis yin pa'i phyir gsum bstan to //
analyzed: 'brel pa yang rnam pa gnyis yin pa'i phyir gsum bstan to //
translated: Because relatedness is of two kinds, three are taught.

original: de la srid pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir mi srid pa dgag pa bshad pa ni de la zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la srid pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir mi srid pa dgag pa bshad pa ni de la zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: There, the negation of the impossible is explained for the sake of comprehending the possible. This is in that regard.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga ma yin te de med na dgag par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba der lta ga la 'gyur rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa med na rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa med par @47b
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga ma yin te de med na dgag par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba der lta ga la 'gyur rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa med na rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa med par @47b
translated: There is no reason to say that if that which is not a cause and effect does not exist, that which is a cause and effect does not exist.

original: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshigs med do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshigs med do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: He thinks that there is no reason.

original: gtan tshigs med pa nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs med pa nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: The absence of a reason is explained:

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is neither is unrelated.

original: de'i 'brel pa ni rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'brel pa ni rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Its relation would be twofold.

original: de dgag par bya ba 'brel pa'am dgag par bya ba de 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dgag par bya ba 'brel pa'am dgag par bya ba de 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the relation of that which is to be refuted or because of the relation of that which is to be refuted to it.

original: de la gal te dgag par bya ba la de 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gal te dgag par bya ba la de 'brel pa yin no //
translated: If that which is to be refuted is related to it,

original: de tsam gyis ni de med kyang med par mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni de med kyang med par mi 'grub bo //
translated: merely that does not establish its nonexistence even if it does not exist.

original: 'brel pa bkag pas ni 'brel pa'i yul dgag pa mi 'grub ste khyab par bya ba med kyang khyab par byed pa med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa bkag pas ni 'brel pa'i yul dgag pa mi 'grub ste khyab par bya ba med kyang khyab par byed pa med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The negation of the relation does not establish the negation of the object of the relation, because even if the pervaded is absent, the pervader is not necessarily absent.

original: des na 'brel pa ni dgag par bya ba yin la 'brel pa'i yul ni 'gog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'brel pa ni dgag par bya ba yin la 'brel pa'i yul ni 'gog par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the relation is what is to be negated, and the object of the relation is what does the negating.

original: des na gnyi ga ma yin pa ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de la dgag par bya ba ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: des na gnyi ga ma yin pa ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de la dgag par bya ba ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúbecause neither is the case, there is no relation‚Äù means that the object of negation is not related to it, as is clearly intended.

original: de lta na yang de dang 'brel pa'i 'brel pa dgag par nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na yang de dang 'brel pa'i 'brel pa dgag par nus pa nyid do //
translated: Even so, it is still possible to negate the relation that is related to it.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: gal te gnyi ga ma yin pa la dgag par bya ba 'brel pa yin no /
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga ma yin pa la dgag par bya ba 'brel pa yin no /
translated: If the object of negation were related to neither,

original: de de la rag las pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di nyid kyis de med na med do zhes bya bar sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de la rag las pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di nyid kyis de med na med do zhes bya bar sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: then this very reason, ‚Äúbecause it depends on that,‚Äù would establish that it is absent when that is absent.

original: 'brel pa med na ni de med na de med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta ga la 'gyur 'bras bu la ltos nas kyang bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'brel pa med na ni de med na de med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta ga la 'gyur 'bras bu la ltos nas kyang bshad pa ni /
translated: If there is no relation, how could it be that when one does not exist, the other does not exist?

original: 'bras bu mi dmigs kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu mi dmigs kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation in terms of the effect is: ‚ÄúEven though the effect is not perceived.‚Äù

original: rgyu ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin pas de gtan tshigs kyis so //
analyzed: rgyu ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin pas de gtan tshigs kyis so //
translated: Since the cause is not necessarily related to the effect, it is the reason.

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu gor ma chag par rgyu nye bar gnas na 'gyur ba ma yin pa de'i phyir 'bras bu med kyang rgyu med pa sgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu gor ma chag par rgyu nye bar gnas na 'gyur ba ma yin pa de'i phyir 'bras bu med kyang rgyu med pa sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the effect does not occur when the cause is not present, the effect is not established in the absence of the cause.

original: 'dir khyad par can brjod par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni slob dpon gyis rnam par nges pa nyid du gtan la phab bo //
analyzed: 'dir khyad par can brjod par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni slob dpon gyis rnam par nges pa nyid du gtan la phab bo //
translated: Here, the master has determined the certainty of the distinction that is intended to be expressed.

original: gang gi phyir ji skad bshad pa'i gcig bkag pas gzhan med pa mi 'grub pa de'i phyir rgyu mi dmigs pa kho na skabs su bab pa'i med pa go bar byed pa yin gyi 'bras bu 'am gnyi ga ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji skad bshad pa'i gcig bkag pas gzhan med pa mi 'grub pa de'i phyir rgyu mi dmigs pa kho na skabs su bab pa'i med pa go bar byed pa yin gyi 'bras bu 'am gnyi ga ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since the negation of one thing in the way that has been explained does not establish the absence of another, therefore the non-perception of the cause alone is the means of understanding the absence that is appropriate, not the effect or both.
